author: {'steamid': '76561198008687861', 'num_games_owned': 1314, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 13950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11993, 'last_played': 1705417292}
review:
Pour les plus pressés :

Les plus :
+ le rapport qualité/prix
+ le gameplay profond
+ un contenu riche
+ les solides références
+ un scénario convenu mais efficace

Le neutre:
un jeu marathon

Les moins :
- des graphismes perfectibles
-une optimisation à revoir


Pour les autres, c’est par ici que ça se passe !


TROUBLESHOOTER: Abandoned Children constituera pour moi la plus grosse surprise de l’année. Pas le meilleur jeu, mais le plus inattendu, et cela faisait bien longtemps que je n’avais pas passé autant d’heures d’affilée sur un jeu.

L’action se passe au sein d’un monde d’après-guerre, plus précisément à Valhalla, une cité-Etat en proie à la violence des gangs, ce qui a mené les autorités à employer des sociétés privées pour le maintien de l’ordre, les troubleshooters.

Vous incarnez donc Albus, un jeune troubleshooter qui va fonder sa société, la fera prospérer, recrutera de nouveaux membres, et tout ce petit monde révèlera au fil de l’histoire son passé et ses motivations individuelles.

Indubitablement, plusieurs jeux (dont principalement Xcom et FF tactics) et certains animés (comme bungo stray dogs par ex) ont une influence plus ou moins prononcée sur TS, tout en lui laissant, et c’est important de le signaler, sa propre originalité et son adn.

Vous allez donc devoir combattre, développer vos compétences et votre équipement, renforcer vos liens avec vos équipiers, régler les factures et les demandes de contrat.

Les combats se déroulent au tour par tour, à l’instar de Xcom, et où les joueurs auront 2 actions possibles durant leur activation : 2 déplacements, 1 déplacement et une action spécifique (objet, soin, compétence, combat). Jusque-là, du très classique. Mais le coup de maître réside dans une échelle de temps que se révèle vitale, puisque l’activation de vos joueurs se fera en fonction du temps gagné ou perdu, et non selon un ordre pré établi. Ainsi, si un de vos persos se prend un tir de barrage, il reçoit une pénalité de temps et son activation sera retardée. Et c’est cumulatif. A contrario, vous découvrirez des compétences qui vous feront gagner de précieuses secondes, voire qui feront perdre du temps à vos cibles. Vous apprendrez tout de même très vite à ne pas envoyer un perso en solo trop en avant dans le brouillard de guerre, sous peine de le voir devenir une cible clouée au sol et à devoir monter une expédition de secours …

Les compétences. Alors, c’est précisément là qu’on attaque le point fort de TS. Grosso modo, vous aurez donc 3 manières pour apprendre les près de 1000 compétences disponibles et remplir les tableaux différents pour chaque personnage puisque les spécificités sont à chaque fois différentes.

-	Les classes : par exemple, votre personnage principal qui manie l’épée et le vent pourra choisir tour à tour entre la classe d’épéiste, maître-épéiste, ou encore chevalier magique. Chaque classe comporte 16 niveaux, des compétences passives, et des cases bonus/malus sur votre tableau de compétences.
-	Tout ennemi mort vous fera hériter de ses propres compétences, et vous pourrez en posséder plusieurs identiques, à la manière d’un deck de cartes.
-	Apprendre de nouvelles compétences via la recherche et l’échange de compétences obtenues préalablement, lesquelles seront sacrifiées durant l’opération.
Et ensuite vient le moment de les placer dans les colonnes des tableaux de compétence nommées basique, attaque, capacité, soutien, défense, et une petite à part, le mastery set qui aura son intérêt. Et donc, vous placez vos compétences de 2 manières : soit personnalisée ou soit, à la manière d’un jeu de placement comme muséum, par collection, lesquelles sont indiquée dans le mastery set, et qui vous apporteront un bonus complémentaire. Pas mal, hein ?

Pour l’équipement et les armes, vous aurez également 3 possibilités.
-	Comme vous récupérez le butin, vous pouvez vous en équiper ou le vendre.
-	Les commerçants vous permettront d’acheter l’équipement ou certains composants.
-	Le fabriquer via l'artisanat. Vous pouvez démonter le butin obtenu et fabriquer votre équipement ou l’améliorer. Notez que votre ingénieur aura la possibilité de fabriquer des robots TRES personnalisés et que votre sniper pourra capturer et entraîner des animaux sauvages pour les faire combattre à vos côtés.

Les liens, encore une fois une possibilité de bonus !  Au total, vous recruterez une dizaine d’employés, dont un maximum de 8 pourront être déployés sur le champ de bataille. A la fin de chaque combat, il y a une augmentation des relations, en fonction des affinités. Sachez que chaque personnage a un nombre limité d’amis, et que chaque amitié comporte 3 niveaux et qu’à chaque vous pourrez choisir un bonus spécifique, comme une contre-attaque sans pénalité de temps, une vision améliorée … Pour faire court, vous vous rendrez vite compte que vous allez constituer 2 groupes de combat bien soudés, ce qui sera un gros atout en cas de rencontre avec un boss.

L’argent dans le jeu … Comme vous devrez payer vos employés et améliorer leur équipement, il va vous falloir du flouze ! Vous allez donc être mis à la tête de la sécurité d’un secteur de la ville, puis de plusieurs selon vos choix, et plus le niveau de sécurité sera élevé, plus la récompense hebdomadaire sera sympa. Qui dit niveau de sécurité signifie nécessité de livrer bataille dans vos secteurs « protégés » sous peine de voir baisser la sécurité, et donc vos revenus. Par ailleurs, comme expliqué plus haut, vous gardez le butin que vous pourrez revendre, ou revendre du matériel que vous fabriquerez dans votre atelier. Enfin, les missions pour les commerçants vous rapportent de la réputation, de l’argent, et probablement parmi les meilleurs équipements du jeu.

Maintenant que le très riche gameplay est survolé, place aux graphismes, et là, malheureusement, force est de constater que ce n’est pas le point fort du jeu …

Si les cartes de combat sont globalement réussies, certaines ressemblent quand même vraiment à un mod de XCom, c’est dommage. Idem, ces cartes peuvent être grandes, très grandes même, et les développeurs se sont ingéniés à nous faire utiliser le relief. C’est une très bonne chose, mais j’aurais préféré gravir une colline avec de vraies pentes plutôt que ressemblant à un escalier …
Si les graphismes en 2d sont très jolis, tant en décors qu’en personnages, la même chose ne saurait être dite pour la 3D. Si les personnages jouables en 3D sont passables, les NPC sont tout simplement hideux, en plus d’être peu nombreux et recyclés à l’excès, à grands coups de lunettes et de perruques …
Ce qui mène à l’optimisation, qui mérite d’être (re)travaillée. Beaucoup d’aliasing à certains endroits, ce qui n’est pas très compréhensible (je joue avec une 3080TI et la config en rapport), ni très beau. De même, je remarque des temps de chargement trop importants, même en le mettant sur un SSD.

L’ost est variée, de bonne facture, mais là encore, on ressent l’influence JRPG et d’animés venant du soleil levant, dont une improbable sorte de variation sur le détective Conan.

Quant au scénario, sur fond de complots et coups de théâtre, pour dire les choses franchement, la narration est lente, et je n’ai pas encore terminé le jeu avec 190 heures au compteur, et pas non plus recruté tous les personnages !! Et c’est probablement cela qui fait abandonner les joueurs, qui sont pourtant enchantés d’avoir acheté TS à en juger par les critiques élogieuses. C’est évident quand on regarde les succès : si 80% des joueurs ont achevé la 1ere mission, à peine 15% construisent un robot ou arrivent aux missions de la fin du second tiers.


Les missions, justement, vous en aurez beaucoup; comptez une cinquantaine pour l'arc principal, plus celles pour les missions secondaires. Toutes sont rejouables, et sont de taille plus que respectable.



[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39131147-Jeux-joue/] Si vous aimez cette évaluation, vous pouvez suivre mon groupe de curation ! [/url]
developer_response:
Above all, thank you for writing a detailed review of the game. However, since I don't know French at all, I used Google Translator. But there were still many sentences that I couldn't understand. This is my obvious limitation, so I ask for your understanding.

XCOM is a game that really represents this genre. And as you mentioned, we borrowed the core battle mode of XCOM from the Troubleshooter. Therefore, the evaluation that Troubleshooter is similar to XCOM was a natural result.

No one wants to release a famous game as a different game by simply changing its appearance. We knew what gamers wanted from an independent game development team. From the moment we recognized this, our update has always been part of the process of securing the identity of the Troubleshooter.

Many SRPG or TBS genre games had many contents only for combat. We wanted gamers to get into the story of the characters. Combat is an important means of giving gamers the opportunity to participate directly in the story, but I wanted it to eventually make the story of the game stand out.

On the other hand, it's the mastery system that comes from XCOM and other battles. There are definitely differences between individual characters' tendencies and selectable occupations, but beyond that, we are not involved in the growth of the characters. Even if they are the same characters, I wanted to give them a feeling that their use is completely different depending on their characteristics. And the individual characters are designed to never be perfect. But when these less than perfect individuals come together and team up, the team can be perfect.

We developed the story of the game and the system of the game intensively because we lack the ability to implement graphics. Great game graphics require a lot of manpower and time. These two are representative things that a small independent game development team like us can't have. However, it's a shame that we couldn't show our own unique art style even if it wasn't at a great graphic level. Our graphics improvement direction will be more unique to us than the graphics shown by other large game companies.

I hope your article will be a representative piece to introduce Troubleshooter to French gamers.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971004526', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1619448902}
review: Haven't played too much because I thought it would be more gameplay than visual novel. If you like that then go for it
developer_response:
Nice to meet you!

I would like to give you a small tip to make the game more enjoyable.

First, complete the scenario missions first. More and more colleagues will gather around you.

You don't have to set the game's difficulty to hard from the beginning. All missions in the game, including scenario missions, can be re-challenged at any time, and at this time, you can set a more difficult difficulty.

Actively utilize the mastery set. It is the core system that makes your character strong.

You can set the pace of the mission fast. Reduce your wait time by adjusting the values of Ally Units Action Speed and Non-ally Units Action Speed in the game's settings.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561199375015313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2628, 'last_played': 1695993728}

author: {'steamid': '76561198285985888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 37563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32595, 'last_played': 1700489941}
review:
战棋类型的刷子游戏，有点费肝。

设计师在各种地方针对玩家，包括但不限于：
0、对新人玩家极度不友好；
1、商店卖的普通材料（不是稀有材料）居然还是随机品质的，品质不对要么自己合成（麻烦），要么等1个小时刷新（再继续看脸）；
2、装备要刷前缀，5星可能还是废品，过于费肝了；
3、职业之间非常不平衡，甚至很多职业强度不如野兽；
4、魔剑士这个职业是在搞笑吧，对犯罪份子特攻？艾琳那么仇视犯罪份子，都没搞个特攻职业；
5、我方无人机纯娱乐，敌方无人机超强力（fw）；
6、凑数的天赋和天赋组太多了，看得眼都快瞎了，结果绝大部分都是在堆数值；
7、连个正经的装备图鉴都没；
8、野兽洗遗传天赋，居然还要DLC2刷60紫？
9、超能力系被极端针对；
10、獴咕王是怎么设计出来的？不会设计就别设计了，真是不走心。

什么垃圾代码？批量鉴定把游戏搞崩溃好几次了，这不是优化问题，是代码有多垃圾的问题，本来还想打好评的。
——上面的问题我都勉强能接受，还是乐意给个好评，然而一个批量鉴定让我改变了意见。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

我们在更新游戏的过程中,不是反复向玩家展示现有的内容,而是想展示一些新的东西。 结果，这迫使玩家改变。 有些人喜欢这种变化，但有些人不喜欢。

游戏开发者和玩家之间有很深的隔阂。 虽然我们的创造不可能让每个人都开心，但我们将继续研究如何获得尽可能多的人的支持。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989741239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11261, 'last_played': 1696368226}
review:
This is the first game that I have ever felt compelled to write a review for.
Troubleshooter is simply amazing, if you are a fan of turn based tactics games, buy this. It WILL be worth every dollar spent.
Visually the game is beautiful, the art is amazing, environments detailed, animations are flashy and full of personality.
The story is wonderfully developed, characters experience growth, have fleshed out storied. Everyone has their time to shine in the limelight. 'Villains' aren't just monolithic bad guys, but rather have their own unique personalities, motivations, and clear justifications as to why they do what they do. The world itself feels wrapped in conflict with different groups struggling to gain influence, or maintain their foothold. There are breaks from the drama, giving room for character development and insight, not only for the main cast, but for auxiliary characters and 'villains' . At times there are light-hearted sub-plots. Overall the world feels alive, and the characters feel like people, which is a remarkably difficult task to accomplish, but Dandylion pulls it off beautifully. 
The Mechanics are honestly staggering, the flexibility in character customisation is absurd. Character have three classes to choose from, one of which being a base class, the other being advanced classes. While these classes lean towards certain roles (Tank, Melee DPS, Support, etc.) , you can setup their mastery boards in a way that can serve almost any purpose. If you like finding unique interactions or combos the mastery board system gives you so much play room that you could try new builds constantly and only really run out of choices after 1000's of hours.  
If you want to play with even more unique build, beyond the expansive cast, you can get into drone making, or pets. Both of which have their own mechanics, and forms of progression, Or, you can completely ignore them, as they're entirely optional. 
Gearing is also developed, with crafting, upgrading, set pieces, unique drops from certain enemies. But at no point did I ever feel as though I 'had' to craft anything, or farm for a specific item. It's just another thing you can do if you want to.
 Dandylion does an amazing job of giving the player mechanics they can interact with, if they want to. The longer you play Troubleshooter, the more you get out of it.
To top this all off, Dandylion is constantly working on the game. New updates come out constantly, new missions being added, new masteries, new enemies. Troubleshooter has an absurd amount of content, and Dandylion is adding more, an making that content even better. It honestly blows my mind seeing what Dandylion has accomplished with Troubleshooter. Its clear that they have put their passion into every fibre of Troubleshooter.
If you like Turn based tactics games, you should play this.
If you want a game you can sink your teeth into, you should play this.
If you're even slightly interested, you should play this.
Troubleshooter is absolutely worth the price, I cannot recommend this enough.
developer_response:
Through your review, we were able to feel the pleasant memories you experienced through Troublesooter and the heart that you think positively of the development team.

Danylion is a small independent game development team. Since the development team does not receive investment from outside, we can continue the game development we want. Of course, it is true that a revenue model is needed to keep the development team afloat, so it is also true that we have struggled a lot between our ideal development philosophy and revenue. 

We have always asked ourselves whether our developmental philosophy is right. But this was a question we couldn't answer. But your review today answered our question.

Someone else who reads your review may disagree with you. However, we will prepare more updates to improve the game so that as many people as possible can agree with your review.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014454290', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 7216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7216, 'last_played': 1673013071}
review: At the moment, this is one of the best tactical superhero rpgs on the market, an alternative to Marvel's Midnight Suns... but it's more like a phone game in terms of mechanics
developer_response:
When we first started developing games, a lot of mobile games were being released and those games received a lot of attention. I think we were influenced a lot by those games. But Troubleshooter is a Steam game. We will continue to update the Troubleshooter to make it a game that gives you a completely different experience than a mobile game.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960485694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 9748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9748, 'last_played': 1696315654}
review:
Destrons.... just why?

I wonder who thought it was fun to implement enemies that are nearly unkillable and stack them like crazy.
So stupid, and sooooo not fun. Just a terrible design choice. 
I'm sure you can kill them if you design your whole setup around it, where the fun in that is: I have no clue.
And we are talking normal difficulty here... they made a game I enjoyed up to that point just terrible, which is a feat to behold.
developer_response:
We were obsessed with showing gamers something new as the game got more and more. So we keep adding new enemies and new traits. Sometimes this forces you to change the way you used it well. I'm also well aware that this feels like a great inconvenience to someone. We will continue to study how people playing games can accept new content without feeling rejected.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389648363', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10609, 'last_played': 1694828522}
review:
백사자 dlc까지 클리어 하고 작성합니다!

장점

- 특성판 및 무기제작
- 동료들 간에 유대 및 연계공격
- 착한 가격
- 긴 플레이 시간
- 캐릭터들 개성이 뚜렷해서 좋음
- 스토리 상으로도 그렇고 게임 상에서도 포지션이 정해져 있어서 좋음(역할을 상기시켜줌)
- 잦은 업데이트 및 소통
- 이쁜 일러스트
- 미션 때 들리는 성우분들 보이스

단점

- 한 판 당 긴 호흡
- npc의뢰가 대체적으로 부실(보상도 부실하다 느낌)
- 맵 보기가 다소 불편(미니맵도 포함)
- 특정미션 중 적 저격수 소란꾼 등등  지원사격 한무(다른방식으로 난이도 조정이 필요해보임)
- 카일리, 레톤 캐릭터가 여러모로 약간 아쉽
- 재료수급이 특성수급보단 약간 불편함(물론 미션 노가다 하면 되지만 무기제작까지 뭔가 수월하지 않음)
- ui가 다소 불편

생각나는 건 여기까지네요! 제 주관적인 생각이라 보시는데 불편함이 없었으면 좋겠습니다.

정말 재밌게 플레이 했고 스토리도 서사가 쌓이는 것 같아 기대가 많이 됩니다!

캐릭터들도 정말 매력적이고 개성적이라 스토리 보며 몰입도 했고 플레이 할 때는 전략적으로 생각을 하게 되어

최대한 캐릭터들 죽지 않는 방향으로 클리어하면 뿌듯함도 있었습니다!

트러블슈터 다음 시즌이 정말 기다려집니다!
developer_response:
장단점을 읽기 쉽게 정리해주셔서 감사합니다. 지적한 단점들에 대해서 절대적으로 동감합니다. 이미 다른 게이머들에게서 지적받은 저희의 고질병이기도 합니다. (카일리와 레톤에 대해서는 다른 의견들이 존재하긴 합니다.) 다만 해당 시스템을 전면적으로 개선하기에는 저희의 개발력이 부족합니다. 지금은 모든 개발력을 진홍 까마귀를 마무리하는데 사용하고 있습니다. 다만 진홍 까마귀의 업데이트가 끝났다고 해서 게임의 업데이트가 완전히 종료되는 것은 아니라고 생각합니다. 이후의 업데이트를 통해서 말씀하신 것들에 대해서 차근차근 개선의 시간을 가져보겠습니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089817402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3337, 'last_played': 1708382504}
review:
THIS GAME IS ABSOLUTELY NUTS. If you are a fan of XCOM 2 (especially the long-war mod) and fan of Anime visuals (which I am not but I didnt mind) this is a must-but. You will need to invest time to get it going but man, this game is a gem.

[I have to correct myself here, the comparisons I made were a lazy way to describe the game. This game is so much more than a xcom copy; it has the 'combat action time' system, the mid/late-game chars are truly unique, the mastery board, oh the mastery board, what a fantastic system! and other things too. The game is its own thing really]


Thank you to whoever developed this game and I am looking forward to the next DLC or whatever next game you go for.
developer_response:
Our communication with gamers through more games is the ultimate goal of the development team. This is also why we are trying to keep the position of the independent game development team. It's the same thing you and we want. Now everyone will be happy if we develop games harder than now!

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198797760951', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 13741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7052, 'last_played': 1697035186}
review: 游戏性很不错，人物造型也很精美，连我闺女都喜欢看游戏里的帅哥美女！游戏开荒阶段不推荐高难度。高难度一局游戏时间太长，材料收集太慢，人物级别却升的很快，这就造成装备级别远远落后于人物级别，后面你会越玩越痛苦！建议先在最低难度刷材料，刷到每个人至少有满级紫装再开炼狱挑战自己。几个给开发组的建议：1.应该提高高难度掉落奖励，目前所有难度掉落没有区别，单纯为刷材料的话根本没有选择高难度的理由。2. 打造材料需求很不合理，别的不说，火花碎片我需要成百上千的从商店买，但霜雪、闪光碎片我却攒了上千个没处用！3.建议设立一个地牢，每层挑战不同，奖励不同，刷子游戏嘛，单纯就是为了刷！
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

谢谢你给我留下好的评价和好的意见。 现在为了圆满结束DLC，正在使用开发组的所有开发资源。 所以不能同时开发其他更新。 但是DLC的更新结束并不意味着游戏的更新结束，所以可以期待反映您意见的更新。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561197984576327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 10622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6924, 'last_played': 1707118095}
review:
Bought this on 16th Jan 2021, I think it's time for a review.
This game needs update for more content. Also I feel like the pet and robot building doesn't shine as much since it sticks to characters. If you tell me these 2 are bonus characters and they don't count in the total team quota for the missions. Then yes, training the pets, getting good pets and machine parts are worth it. But as of now no. Also melee characters dmg wise can only build either tank / dmg so a little underwhelming and could use a boost.

P.S : DLC was 21th Oct 2022, and now it's September 2023 I want more STORY PLEASE! Where are the updates?!? Where are the content?!?

Update (Jan 2024): This game is now in like a decaying state.
Need more actual content not making skins for people to buy!
Need more updates please!!
developer_response:
We are preparing for the last update of Crimson Crow. Of course, I don't think the update of the game will end just because A has been developed. However, it is not clear whether the development team will be able to stay until we start talking more. The time ahead will be very harsh for the development team.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090460597', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10908, 'last_played': 1694990577}
review:
This game is perfect for fans of Xcom and also rpgs in general. The mastery system is incredibly complex, and there are so many possible builds for each character.

Love the game, 10/10
developer_response:
We are now very embarrassed to receive such a high score from you. But we don't want you to revise the review. Rather, I think it would be a good way for everyone if we improve the game close to 10 points. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198381930972', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4742, 'last_played': 1700655384}
review:
从解锁炼狱开始就一直是炼狱+挑战的模式往后面打
大概打到43主线的时候有些玩不下去了，一堆带着沉默的敌方远程输出让我觉得有些困惑
在游戏的前期还是很享受慢慢探索新的天赋组合的那种感觉的，但是到后面试出一个天赋组合的时间实在太长了
当缺一个天赋出新天赋组合的时候，翻一两页天赋的时候我还是很乐意的，但是如果要翻六七页的话就还是算了吧
感觉比起战旗的战略更侧重于rpg式的人物培养，让我这个更喜欢战略一点的玩家玩下去的动力就没那么强了
所以思索了很久决定暂时还是不往后面打了，但剧情还是比较期待的
制作组的态度让人非常感动，所以决定买dlc支持一下，等后面什么时候想玩了再回归
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

" 感觉比起战旗的战略更侧重于rpg式的人物培养，让我这个更喜欢战略一点的玩家玩下去的动力就没那么强了 "

你的估计是对的。 游戏的基础是以A为基础。 但是角色的设定对策略有很大的影响。 这部分还会继续强化，因为角色的成长是游戏的重要因素之一。 但是为了避免角色能力导致可以无视所有战略的情况，我认为在任务中安排最低限度的战略要素非常重要。

一个特性在所有任务中发挥最高效率也是我们所摒弃的之一。 为了使用我们准备的各种天赋，正在部署具有多种特征的敌人。 管理特性是游戏的核心之一，但也有可能像你提到的那样有点累。 我们将研究如何让玩家更愉快地体验这个过程。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042144889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6984, 'last_played': 1711172171}
review:
Great, fun gameplay loop.  Characters are okay so far with some touching moments.
It can take a while to figure out the systems (masteries, mastery research, crafting, etc.), but it is very fun with lots of room for experimentation.
Wish there was mod support for offline mode.
Wish the story was told in a more straightforward way.
Online mode does not seem to be that meaningful.
However, it has become one of my favorite games of all time so far!
Looking forward to playing more.
developer_response:
We used a way of intersecting past and present stories to avoid too fragmented a composition when developing the story of the game. However, I realized later that this might not help me easily grasp the story of the game. We'll continue to work on a more intuitive way of storytelling.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039623388', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 12141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7628, 'last_played': 1706819593}
review:
During a time of unprecedented crime plice has seen themselves forced to hire mercenaries of extraordinary talent to help them curb unrest; these mercenaries are called troubleshooters. In the Windwall district of Valhalla a young troubleshooter sets out to setup his own troubleshooter company. In the shadow of the disbanding of the legendary Silverlining troubleshooter company... can Albus succeed where they did not?

Troubleshooters has quickly become a favorite of mine for bringing me the customisation of the disgaea series, the gameplay of Xcom and a way of storytelling that explains plenty but still leaves you with an equal amount of questions. Starting off small with just a couple of partymembers you are assigned missions which come in the typical SRPG style... kill these enemies, destroy these targets, rescue these civilians, escort this VIP to an exit etc etc but where Troubleshooters shines is it's customisation. Every partymembers has 3 classes, an equipments set (with an elaborate crafting system) and a mastery board. 
This mastery board pretty much works like the evility system from Disgaea or a Passives Trait system which is fully customisable. By slotting passives you can significantly improve your partymembers' abilities or even give them aditional abilities and on top of that, by combining certain passives/masteries, you get mastery sets which further enhance them.
Combine this with a system where you can also build mini-tanks or adopt pets and the possibilities become near endless (within the archetype of each individual characters available classes ofc).

Gameplay is what you expect from an SRPG of Xcom's calliber... an X-amount of soldiers each get their own turn in which they get 2 actionpoints to spend how they wish on movement or abilities. I say abilities because this definitely ISN'T Xcom... You have mages who can shoot lightning blasts or cast chain lightning, Bruisers who don't care about cover because they WANT to get hurt, healers who'll want to stay close but not TOO close. It ALSO isn't XCOM in the respect that 80% chance to hit is usually a miss... in fact it might be the exact opposite as a chance of 40% will give you a decent chance to hit your target anyways and with your masteries being so customisable you really don't have to miss at all

The story is glorious for a person like me... Valhalla feels like a real place with real problems where nothing is strictly black or white; the bad guys are bad for reasons you can get behind. Being down on their luck, got dealt a raw deal or just embraced their inner demons; we get to see what makes everyone tick. They have the same problems as us, think about the same things as us, even eat at the same places as us. Plenty of scenes are revisited from the perspective of others and on top of that there are some glorious slice of life moments of "mundane" people working in "mundane" jobs.

Is this game perfect? No, ofcourse not.
You are often pitted as a small band of brothers against extreme odds (think 8 Vs 200) and some missions have the staple "You gotta do it this way or you'll lose". On top of that the crafting system involves some serious farming if you want the top of the line stuff and even though you can buy most of those materials in shops, those materials are expensive enough and your overall income low enough that farming really is your only option...And that farming can become tedious.
You are dependant on Psi-stones, elemental ores with psionic energy, which you can find and mine in missions using a specific tool. The problem here is that you need a massive amount of specific elements and every mission have only a limited amount of minable ore. On top of that... once you complete the mission you don't get the time to mine this ore... done is done. So you need to mine this ore BEFORE you complete the mission (slowing down missions) and these stones are usually in the far corners of the map. Having to use a specific tool means you lose equipment slots on partymembers too in order to bring them and the yield is VERY low.... ofc you can make equipment sets to up the yield but then you exchange viability in combat for that option.. and those sets need to be crafted too.

All in all:
THE GOOD
* Good Gameplay, It's XCOM with all the trimmings and hardly any of the finnicky of THAT game
* Good Story, though this is hard to explain; it feels believable for this world and even though it's obviously animé inspired it has very little of the typical animé tropes
* Good Customisation, though the system goes deep, VERY DEEP, which might turn people off too but you can even tweak the music that plays in your loading screen, during combat, when elites/bosses show up etc
* Good Diversity. There's plenty of missions and mission types and even though the maps are always the same there's a measure of random placement of enemies to make stuff different (or even more difficult) and there's difficulty options on top of this and a challenge mode to make sure even the earliest mission can be brought back up to your current level of play
* Plenty of content. This is not a short game

THE BAD
* This is a strategical/Tactical game with deep systems which means that if you don't understand a system you're inevitably are going to have a harder time and the more systems you either don't understand and/or neglect the harder the game is going to be
* SOME (but not many) tedious concepts like farming or the min/maxing equipment items
* Some story missions are simply not fun or HAVE to be played a certain way in order to be brought to a succesfull conclusion
* SOOOOoooooo MAAAAaaaaany Menu's to keep track of
* Though not a gripe of mine.... it IS an obvious animé inspired game with animé-styled graphics

Conclusion: 8/10 would definitely have Ray blow herself up because of mixing unstable chemicals in her spraycans again in the middle of combat to kill the boss again.
developer_response:
Disgaea and XCOM are games that have been mentioned a lot, even until now, during our development of Troubleshooter. Most of the time we've been referring to this game has been spent thinking about how we can bring these characteristics together through Troubleshooter.

And of course, it wasn't an easy goal for a small independent game development team like us, who are developing games for the first time. To be honest, the closer we tried to reach this goal, the more we faced the limitations of our development capabilities. At some point, we changed it to a goal that fits our development reality. In the process, we found our way, but we couldn't predict how this would be accepted by gamers. However, today we were able to confirm through your writing that the core game content we were trying to convey was well delivered. More than anything, the development team is most pleased with this fact.

The development team is all Korean and has individuals who specialize in the technology needed for game development. Since we are a small development team, we are developing games with a minimum number of people, and we don't have any team members specializing in humanities, geography, or sociology. That's why Valhalla incorporates all the social characteristics that the development team has experienced. In fact, the Spoonist group is the result of the projection of Korean social problems. Ironically, our lack of humanities knowledge seems to have made Valhalla feel more familiar to you. :D

Even if we got a bad review because of the parts you mentioned in THE BAD, I would have had to admit it. Nevertheless, I would like to express my gratitude through this reply to you for your consideration to continue our game development through good review.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058514971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 26674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26674, 'last_played': 1667532977}
review:
장점:
턴제전략 시스템적으로 유사 X-COM 분위기: 엑스컴은 엄폐와 연막탄으로 방어한다면 얘들은 피부(...)로 공격을 방어한다
특성조합의 다양성: 파고들면 시간이 한도끝도 없다, 조합에 따라 완전 다른 매커니즘으로 작동하는 캐릭을 커스텀할수 있음
가격혜자: 할인없이 사도 뽕뽑음, 게다가 스토리&캐릭터 DLC 무료, 게다가 아직까지 게임 업데이트 계속하고 있음
개발의욕: 일일히 댓글 달고, 헤이싱 첫 합류미션 무한튕김때 개발자분이 친추건거 받고 직접 기술적 상담도 해주심

단점:
세계관 설정: 시온 소개할 때 엄청 어색한 인게임 3D모델에 이름이 블러드워커에 무슨... 아테르 제국 가문 출생... 항마력 못버팀
스토리: 살인과 강도짓 하는 조폭들 감성팔이 하느라 정작 메인 캐릭들 스토리는 뒷전임, 특히 주인공 알버스 어머니 사건 어찌됨?
미션 밸런스: 특정미션 뇌절, 스컬조직 단체는 양반, 인간형로봇 네임드 단체로 나오는 강력사건 로봇 무적비슷한거 걸고 즉사급 반격 날려댐, 익숙하면 깨긴 깨는데 특정조합 강제나 익숙해지기 전까지 심히 ㅈ같음... 지금은 해결된지 모르겠음
온라인: 서버 세이브 저장이 아니라 온라인 플레이를 만들겠다고 초반에 말한거 같고 광장같은데서 사람 만날수 있는데... 애매하게 구현하려면 인디라면 개발력 떨어질텐데 전혀 필요 없을거같음, 시간좀 지난거같은데 역시나 지금은 어찌된지 모르겠음

도전과제 다찍고 특성수집 전부 다했는데 지금 많이 추가되서 9월 갓겜들 좀 즐기다 복귀할 예정임
초반 씹덕조차 항마력 딸리는 부분만 넘어가서 특성조합 시작하면 마약같은 중독성을 발휘함, 고민된다면 그냥 사, 돈 안아깝다

개인적으로 있으면 좋은거: 마트 카트같이 못생긴 드론 말고 나도 폭풍간지 인간형 로봇 쓰게 해줘요, 카일리 그정도 능력 되잖아
돈씨한테 빌린 창고에 웬 동물만 있어요 그 비좁은데 꽉꽉... 드론 너무 못생김...
그리고 루나 언제 실장되나요? 앤이 트러블슈터 자격증 따서 관리하에 데려오면 될텐데, 딱 한번 쓸수있는 미션보면 전기톱에 보라곰인지 뭔지 전용특성까지 있으면서 웨 아직 없음요? 나오면 유료라도 당장산다진짜
developer_response:
* 세계관:
공감합니다. 이전부터 많은 비판을 받아왔고, 개성을 유지하면서 호불호의 차이를 줄여보려 하였으나 저희가 대중적인 감성에 공감하려는 노력이 부족했던 것 같습니다.

* 이야기:
게임은 다양한 등장인물의 이야기를 다루고 있습니다. 삼국지가 다양한 등장인물을 다루는 와중에 유비라는 인물에게 주인공이라는 무게를 주었던 반면, 저희는 알버스가 그러한 역할을 비중있게 담당하지 못했습니다. 이것은 위의 세계관 설정과 함께 저희가 앞으로의 게임 설정에서 크게 반성해야 할 부분입니다.

* 미션 밸런스: 
어떤 하나의 특성 조합이 게임 전체에서 통용되는 것을 막고 상황에 따라 다양한 팀원 조합, 특성 조합을 사용하도록 유도하고 싶었습니다. 다만 이런 변화를 유도하는 과정에서 충분한 사전 정보와 이유를 전달하는데에는 미숙했던것 같습니다.

* 온라인:
온라인 기능은 여전히 작동하고 있고 온라인 모드의 특징을 포함하고 있다고 생각합니다. 다만 게임 개발의 최우선 순위가 '혼자서도 즐길 수 있는 게임'을 먼저 완성하는 것이다보니 온라인 기능을 더 유용하게 사용하지 못한 것이 조금 아쉽습니다. 

* 폭풍 간지 인간형 로봇:
이것이...그...요청은 많이 받았습니다만...발할라에서는 전투 기계를 사용할 수 없는 설정이 있고, 알버스가 또 고지식한지라...저희의 세계관이 발할라 이외의 지역으로 확장되지 않는한 어려울 것 같습니다.

* 루나:
그러기 위해서는 앤의 이야기가 좀 더 다뤄져야 하는데, 지금은 이 부분의 개발에 대해서 확답하기 어렵습니다.

언급하신 단점만으로도 게임에 나쁜 평가를 남기기에 충분했습니다. 그리고 저희는 그것에 대해서 수긍할 수 밖에 없었을 것입니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 좋은 평가를 통해  저희가 게임을 계속 개발할 수 있는 용기를 주신 것에 대해서 감사드립니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030722315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2026, 'last_played': 1697950936}
review: Troubleshooter is basically JRPG + XCOM.  The result is a really good strategy rpg.
developer_response:
Implementing JRPG and XCOM as a single game is our ultimate goal and we are still moving toward that goal. We cannot guarantee that we can achieve our goals. But I think that goal is definitely worth the challenge.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098637904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 4652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4652, 'last_played': 1694878737}
review:
스토리가 500피스 퍼즐 조각 맞추는거처럼 드문 드문 비어있어서 
처음에는 뭔 소린지 알 수가 없음
게임 하다보면 어느 정도 이해가 됌
다음 스토리의 여지를 두고 만든 엔딩 같아 보이기는 하는데 
벌려놓은 스토리에 비해 엔딩이 약간 아쉬움
developer_response:
많은 것을 염두에 두었지만 저희의 개발력과 구현력이 그것에 미치지 못했습니다. 미래의 개발을 통해 아직 봉합하지 못한 부분에 대한 이야기를 더욱 재미있게 그려내기 위해 노력할 것입니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193395650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2949, 'last_played': 1695298090}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989286967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3654, 'last_played': 1698160977}
review: 왜 튜토리얼이고 처음이고 계속 무한 반복되는거임? 깨도 깨도 다시 똑같은 스테이지 시작하는데 문제가 뭡니까 대체
developer_response:
오늘 오후 3시부터 6시반까지 아시아 서버 노후화로 인한 교체 작업이 있었습니다. 그 과정에서 저희의 실수로 서버가 비정상적인 상태로 올라가게 되었습니다.

모두 저희 관리 역량의 문제로 불편을 드리게 되어 진심으로 사과드립니다. ㅠ

현재 정상화를 위해 2시간의 임시점검을 진행하고 있습니다.

최대한 빨리 정상화되는 대로 서버를 올리도록 하겠습니다!

이런 불편을 드려 진심으로 사과드립니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561199155621101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1699764877}
review:
복잡해보여서 고민했는데 조작방식에 익숙해지니까 너무 재밌네요
다만 시작할때마다 무조건 한번은 튕기네요 저는ㅠ


+
29시간 정도 플레이 했구요. 여전히 재밌다고 생각하지만, 몇가지 단점들도 눈에 띄네요.
우선 조작해야 하는 아군이 많을 경우 하나하나 조작하는게 상당히 귀찮아요...
적들의 위치가 바로 파악이 안되고 거리가 상당히 있는 편이기 때문에 적들의 위치가 파악될때까지 몇번이고 아군들 조작해서 이동시키는게 너무 너무 귀찮아요...
심지어 저는 길치라서... 가끔 방향을 잘 못 잡을때가 있는데 그럴땐 또 반대로 이동시켜야 해서 눈앞이 깜깜하더라구요........

그리고 적이 많을때도 ㅋㅋㅋㅋ 적들 하나하나가 공격하고 이동하는거 기다리다가 날 새겠다는 생각도 했어요.... 
나도 공격을 하고 싶은데 내 차례가 안 와.......... 

위 문제 때문에 플레이타임이 너무 길어져서 피로하고 부담스럽긴 하지만 재미는 있어요.
설정에서 속도를 조절해주니까 좀 낫긴 하네요.
developer_response:
게임을 포기하지 않고 즐기려는 당신께 정말로 감사의 말씀을 올립니다. 하지만 시작할 때마다 튕기는 것은 심각한 문제로 보입니다. 만약 또 그런 현상이 발생한다면, 해당 현상이 발생한 이후에 게임을 다시 실행하고, 게임의 '환경설정' → '오류보고' 기능을 이용하여 저희에게 오류 보고서를 보내주세요. 저희가 당신이 겪고 있는 문제의 단초를 찾을 가능성이 있습니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271531024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15701, 'last_played': 1702308255}
review:
I never ever leave reviews for games I play but it's not a stretch to say Troubleshooter is definitely up there in my list of favourite single-player turn-based RPGs (being the genre of games I play the most - e.g. Fire Emblem, Persona, Atelier, Trails series etc.). There's so much potential for customisation in this game that it's honestly overwhelming, and new content for the game continues to pose a challenge even for those of us who've been playing for a while. It's become one of the very few games I continue to play occasionally, even an entire year after I first bought it.

It's really refreshing to see a game from Korean developers and the KR voice lines are sometimes actually really funny (shoutout to Sion and Leton especially). It's definitely one of those instances where translations don't do the original vibes justice.

Many other reviews already go pretty in-depth into what anyone can expect from the game. I just wanted to say I'm happy to help out with the translation/proofreading from KR to EN as well - please feel free to hit me up. :)
developer_response:
It would be a great pleasure for us too if Troubleshoote could be included in your preferred RPG game list. The games you mention are recognized masterpieces, and frankly I don't think the Troubleshooter can stand shoulder to shoulder with them. But right now, Troubleshooter is not enough to call it a masterpiece in many ways, but we will always think about improving the game to make it a game that can stay on your RPG game list for a long time.

If you want to participate in the translation improvement of the game, please refer to the link below. You can participate in translation whenever you want.

https://steamcommunity.com/games/470310/announcements/detail/2734200255916490573

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205797627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1694304070}
review: X-Com style combat with a very indepth skill progression system for Character based units, allowing almost endless customization. I haven't had much time to invest into playing it, but i highly recommend it for whats there. Also updated with Online-Only mode you can choose at the start of play.
developer_response:
Nice to meet you!

I would like to give you a small tip to make the game more enjoyable.

First, complete the scenario missions first. More and more colleagues will gather around you.

You don't have to set the game's difficulty to hard from the beginning. All missions in the game, including scenario missions, can be re-challenged at any time, and at this time, you can set a more difficult difficulty.

Actively utilize the mastery set. It is the core system that makes your character strong.

You can set the pace of the mission fast. Reduce your wait time by adjusting the values of Ally Units Action Speed and Non-ally Units Action Speed in the game's settings.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119936530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 22725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4281, 'last_played': 1708729043}
review:
아직 쪼끔밖에 못했는데 재밌음
------------------------------------------------------
2023/9/10 - 보통난이도기준 게임은 전체적으로 무겁지 않게 플레이가능한편, 특성판도 그렇고 장비옵션도그렇고 하나하나 티가나는 차이를 보여주다보니 성장의 재미가 있음
------------------------------------------------------
2023/09/30 - 일하면서 즐기다보니 이제야 파티원 8명을 모았네요!
스토리 빨리 다음꺼 보고싶다 싶으면서도 다보고나면 아쉬울것같기도하고,
빨리 다깨고 최고난이도에서 스펙업 해보고싶으면서도, 한창 성장중인 지금당장이 성격상 더 재미있을것같기도하고...
행복한 고민이네요.
------------------------------------------------------
2023/09/30 - 으닛! 행복한 고민을 한지 30분만에 현 스토리 종장까지 봐버렸....
마지막 전투만 남겨놓고 쓰고있었네 ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ
DLC 하러 가야지~
------------------------------------------------------
2023/10/05 - 와...DLC 시작전에 특성추가로인한 게임난이도상승을 예고하긴 했는데...
기존에는 적이 뭐든간에 딜과 명중만 올리고 충격장만 신경쓰면 되었던것이,
이제는 적들 자체가 방어율80% 이런대다가
시즌1엔 상대가 탱커면 탱밖에 못하던 반면, 이젠 탱도되는대 딜량도 무지막지한...
모든잡몹이 엘리트가 된것같은 느낌이 들어요 ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ
근데 그렇다고 갑자기 '못해먹겠다' 라기보단 그동안 신경안쓰던 방어스텟을 신경써서 추가특성을 조정하게되는등 좀더 전략적으로 어려워졌달까요?
developer_response:
캐릭터의 육성과 그 결과에 따른 특성의 다양한 조합은 저희가 추구하는 게임의 핵심 재미중 하나입니다. 그것을 좋게 평가해주셔서 저희는 정말로 기분이 좋습니다. 저희는 그 시스템이 아직 발전의 여지가 남아 있다고 생각합니다. 당신에게 더 많은 즐거움을 드리기 위해 노력하겠습니다!

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035708562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 172, 'playtime_at_review': 6094, 'last_played': 1712436442}
review:
I never write reviews, but this is seriously a wonderfully executed XCOM-like game with a the kind of charm and flair that I prefer over games with military aesthetics. The negative reviews seem to be a few years old at this point so maybe things have been improved on a bit since then.

There are a lot of things I love about this game- the animations, combat mechanics, characters, music, the *settings* that provide more options than I've seen in another game! 
But one thing that stands out in particular to me is the ability to customize character builds like crazy. If you love coming up with character builds, this game has a really satisfying and innovative system for it.

This game is super fun, unique, and charming and I'm very very impressed by the creators- who, by the way, also are very polite, communicative, and are still performing updates and releasing content as of this review. Much love!
developer_response:
Character customization is one of the core contents of the game. Customization of a character's appearance requires high-quality graphics skills, and we didn't have the time, manpower, or skills to achieve it. So we decided to give players a choice about the character's ability to feel directly within the game. All the members of the development team were able to develop it together because this is a part where designing ability plays a bigger role than the development team's graphic development ability.

We are very lucky that you like this. We still think that this system can be expanded further. This will be further improved through our future development. I hope you can be with us then, too.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815983314', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1697543616}
review: 可以。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

如果我们准备的游戏内容能愉快地填满你的时间，那对我们来说也是很大的乐趣。

关于你如何更愉快地体验【分争调整者】，我可以给你一个诀窍吗？

先完成【剧情任务】，让更多的同事加入你的团队。有了强大的战友，你就有了更多的战斗机会，这就意味着你很快就能在战斗中获胜。

刚开始游戏的难度不要设置得高。 各种任务只要完成一次，随时都可以再挑战。 而且以后再挑战的时候，你可以选择的装备和同事的范围会更大。

啊，游戏正式开始之前，请确认环境设置中的各种选项。包括加快游戏速度的功能(【快进队友行动】，【快进队友外的行动】)，提供利用多种设置舒适享受游戏的方法。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561199027446722', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1693903200}
review: good
developer_response:
More stories and more colleagues are waiting for you. 

I recommend that you complete all the scenario missions at a low level of difficulty first. Then you can recruit more colleagues and use more diverse masteries to change your character powerfully. 

You can try again at any time after completing any kind of mission in the game. In this process, you can change the difficulty of the mission or select more people to participate in the mission. Therefore, it is not necessary to complete violent cases or normal cases from the beginning.

Enjoy the story first. Then use your strategy on the battlefield to your heart's content.

Oh, and have you noticed that there are options that make game speed faster? Please check the [Ally Units Action Speed] and [Non-ally Units Action Speed] in the [GAMEPLAY] in the game option.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263494897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10119, 'last_played': 1705676358}
review:
이 게임, 많이 한건 아니지만 정말 재밌게 했습니다. 특히 인물과 인물 사이에 얽힌 스토리 면에서 정말 몰입하면서 재밌게 한 것 같습니다. 특히 꼽자면, 재밌는 점으론 주인공 측 인물 간 서사가 무척 재밌었고, 아쉬운 점으론 빌런 측 서사가 쓸떼없이 너무 길었던 점 같네요. (여기선 적어도 빌런측 중요인물 쪽엔 별도의 일러스트라도 들어갔다면 조금 더 몰입도가 높아졌을 것 같습니다) 

그렇다 하더라도 정말 재밌게 즐겼던 게임입니다. 앞으로 계속 DLC를 출시한다더래도 걸맞는 스토리와 일러스트만 나온다면 꼭 계속해서 구매하겠습니다.
developer_response:
제 생각에 평가를 쓰신 분께서는 트러블슈터에 대해서 어떤한 평가라도 내릴 수 있을 정도로 충분히 게임을 이해하고 계신것으로 보입니다. 플레이 타임과, 주인공 측의 인물간 서사를 즐긴 것에서 그 점을 충분히 추측할 수 있습니다. 선과 악의 캐릭터들의 이야기의 비중을 적절하게 조절하여 게임의 서사가 물 흐르듯이 자연스러울 수 있도록 저희가 연구를 멈추지 않을 것입니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991631538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6643, 'last_played': 1693818042}
review:
Gameplay - 9/10
It's an XCOM style game with RPG elements. It has more of a focus on individual hero units rather than generic soldier units. I have very minor complaints but it's more so an issue with me being lazy and refusing the actually work around a problem. Like there are some combinations of masteries that the enemies can have at the higher levels that are kind of a pain to deal with but it is also on the hardest difficulty so it's kind of expected. The earlier levels are relatively easy but the mid to later levels will require you to actually think about your placement and builds. Missions can range from 10 minutes to an hour depending on the size

Music - 8/10
I really like most of the music in this game especially in the DLC maps. The main reason i rate it 8/10 is just because there aren't that many songs so expect to hear the same song a lot.

Story - 7-8/10
It feels like a fairly generic JRPG story which personally I don't mind that much. I'll refrain from spoilers but there are quite a few RPG tropes that happen. Not anything amazing but not bad, expect a fairly standard JRPG story.

Developers - 10/10
They are very active, still updating this game 3+ years after release. New masteries, DLC/characters, bug fixes, etc. I bought this game in 2020 fully expecting it to be done after like a year but they're still going. I think they deserve a lot more and I hope whatever they work on keeps getting more recognition.

Overall - 8.5-9/10
It's a very good strategy JRPG game in the style of XCOM. If the idea of a hero-based XCOM JRPG sounds fun to you, then this is absolutely a game you should try. At the time of writing this, I have 110 hours played and I still haven't gotten close to unlocking everything. There are still some builds I haven't tried, enemies I haven't beaten, masteries I haven't gotten. They also mentioned a potential for multiplayer/co-op which I think will be a great addition. I do enjoy this game and hope you do too.
developer_response:
Thank you very much for giving us a higher score than we expected for Troubleshooter. In fact, if there was an item about graphic quality in your evaluation, our score would have been much lower than now. The reason you excluded this evaluation item is probably because you played Troubleshooter for a long time and decided that graphics were not a key item in the game.

We are selecting the music of the game to suit the public's taste as much as possible. But because of our choices, we've reduced the list of songs that we can use in the game by ourselves. We will try to contact more composers and secure more sound sources to add more diverse songs to suit each situation. 

The reason why we continue to develop games is to keep our promises with gamers. In fact, if our development was more powerful than it is now, we would have updated it faster. I would like to express my deep gratitude once again by encouraging the development team rather than criticizing this situation.

Thank you for this review.

review:
五月份无意中发现这个游戏，然后沉迷。工作日每天玩一两把，休息日有时能玩一整天。2个月超过200小时的游戏时间，近年已经极少有游戏能让我如此高强度的游玩了，这些年能让我以每月超过百小时的高强度游玩的游戏，只有骑砍、宫崎英高的游戏，和怪物猎人系列。

听说下一作已经在做了？制作组加油！

author: {'steamid': '76561198010646847', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 9237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1694834116}
review:
스토리도 좋고 전략부분도 상당히 재밌네요.
6시간정도 했는데, 천천히 계속 즐길거 같아요.

-------------50시간 정도 더 플레이하고 평가 수정한다.-------------------

이거 ㅈㄴ 재밌다...
시간가는줄 모르고 계속하는중.
무기, 방어구 제작 시작하고 특성도 맞추기 시작하니까 개재밌음.
스토리도 은근 몰입감 있어서 볼만해.
할인할때 구매했는데, 정가주고 사도 불만없을듯.
developer_response:
먼저! 환경설정에서 게임의 속도를 빠르게 설정해 주세요. 환경설정의 '게임 진행' 에서 '아군 행동 빠르게 연출' 과 '아군 외 행동 빠르게 연출' 의 값을 조정하면 미션에서 적들이 행동하는 동안 대기하는 시간이 조금 줄어들 것입니다. 그리고 시나리오 미션을 먼저 빠르게 완료하여 동료들을 모으세요. 시나리오 미션은 언제든 재도전 할 수 있으니 처음부터 난이도를 높게 설정할 필요가 없습니다. 동료들이 하나 둘씩 합류하다보면 게임의 재미도 훨씬 나아질 것입니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017514148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1697226129}
review:
Spieltechnisch (im Kampf) ist das Spiel in Ordnung. Mir gefällt auch die große Breite von Missionstypen. Hier und da etwas viel Laufen und ab und zu die letzten Gegner suchen zu müssen ist leider nicht optimal gelöst. Wegen diesen Dingen brauchen die Gefechte viel länger als sie müssten, auf kosten von Spaß. Habe erst nach 30 Stunden gesehen das die Polizisten mit einer automatischen KI gesteuert werden können :Thunder_Girl_3:

Storytechnisch muss ich Ihnen absolut recht geben, die wurde im Verlauf besser. Die Charakter werden viel besser vorgestellt. Insbesondere die Geschichte zu "Van Helsing" ist tiefgreifend, viel weiter bin ich noch nicht gekommen. Auf dieser Ebene hätte ich mir den Start gewünscht. Im Vergleich dazu ist die Story der anderen Charakter, die bisher spielbar wurden, echt trocken.

Das Thema rund um Ausrüstung hat sich selbst gelöst durch die erhöhte Zeit die der Charakter im selben Level verbringt (sprich immer mehr exp für das nächste benötigt), aber ich guck mir die Ausrüstung einfach nicht mehr oft an. Neue und zugleich passende Ausrüstung wird im späteren Verlauf nicht mehr oft gefunden.


=> Ich kann einfach niemandem Empfehlen so viel Zeit reinzustecken, nur damit sie vllt. danach das Spiel mögen. (ob sie das Spiel dann mögen hängt natürlich von den Spielern selbst ab)

PS: 28.11.2023 vorheriger Kommentar komplett überarbeitet
developer_response:
I'm so sorry but no one in the development team knows the language of your country so I used the Google Translation to understands your review. I ask for your understanding.

We got a lot of bad reviews and a lot of them were because the initial progress of the game was slow and frustrating. This was the result of our inexperience in game development. But I'm sure this experience will be more and more relaxed as you go on with the game. Of course, another thing in the game may not be to your liking, but we believe that after the middle of the game, you won't rate Troubleshooter badly for the same reason.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000443320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3321, 'last_played': 1709741871}

This is a fantastic game. Bad reviews about difficulty are skill issues, take a minute to put together good mastery builds on your characters and you'll be fine. The translation could be better, but this game more than makes up for it. The gameplay is phenomenal and really keeps you engaged.

This game needs to be more popular, 9/10.
developer_response:
First of all, I sincerely apologize for not providing you with a good translation. Nevertheless, I think you are very lucky because you seem to be actively analyzing the game. We will continue to improve the game so that your experience can last longer.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198810858185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9610, 'last_played': 1704536350}

author: {'steamid': '76561198858757532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 14027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13517, 'last_played': 1699330213}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
Immensely fun combat system (feels heavily XCOM inspired) with an interesting world and story to boot. It's not perfect, but it's a great game; and the developers feel like they're actively listening to the community and working on improving it on an ongoing basis.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[olist]
    [*][b]Combat[/b] - Easily the best part of the game. If you've played XCOM games (or anything in that vein) you should have a decent sense of what to expect. There are tons of classes to choose from and hundreds of skills and skill sets (obtained by equipping certain combinations of skills) which give a lot of build freedom. I played on hard difficulty with high-risk, high-return throughout the vast majority of the game and the difficulty level felt well balanced for me. You can freely tweak the difficulty any time outside combat, so it's extremely easy to adjust to your own preference.
    [*][b]No Permadeath[/b] - This point is purely personal preference, so it could be a con for some people. However, I loved not having to worry about permanently losing characters. I had many battles that I just barely won (only a couple of members surviving) which would be potentially disastrous with permadeath. Not having that worry in mind allowed for much more risk and exploration which is quite important considering the vast amount of abilities, classes, and so on available.
    [*][b]World Building[/b] - The game does a great job of introducing and slowly expanding the world and characters. The world feels pretty simple at the beginning, but it quickly expands and you discover a myriad of factions and groups with their own goals.
     [*][b]Art[/b] - I really liked the art used in the stills during story exposition and dialogue. It felt like it did a great job accompanying whatever events were happening or being discussed. I'll throw in that the graphics for characters and the environment during actual combat also generally felt quite smooth.
     [*][b]Soundtrack[/b] - I found the soundtrack quite pleasant. I never felt "tired" of any particular track and they all felt fitting in the scenarios they were used in as far as I can recall. Given how long the game is overall and how long missions can take (especially late game), I think that's quite an achievement in itself.
[/olist]

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
[olist]
    [*][b]Story[/b] - I loved the story and characters. That said, the reason I placed this aspect in neutral is because effectively nothing feels resolved by the end of the game, including both story DLC. Note: the final story mission has not released at the time of writing this review, however, there is no way a single scenario can resolve all the ongoing plots. If this game was a TV show, it would be an apt comparison to say it felt like the end of the first season (and the developers might have meant it that way since that's what the achievement for completing the main story says). You are introduced to a multitude of interesting characters and their backgrounds, yet none of the present stories have concrete conclusions so far. I look forward to the final mission and the sequel and hope that it can at provide closure on at least some of the story threads.
    [*][b]English Translation[/b] - At no point is there anything egregious enough that it is incomprehensible. However, the phrasing at times can feel a bit stiff or awkward for the context of the situation. It happened enough times throughout the game that it's definitely noticeable and hence I figured it was worth mentioning.
[/olist]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[olist]
    [*][b]Crafting[/b] - The game has an interesting crafting system where you level up your ability to craft specific items (and craft their higher level versions) by crafting them enough times. My issue with it though is that most of the crafted items do not feel worth the effort to craft. I actually crafted enough that I unlocked all but a few set items. However, legendary items, which are boss drops, felt superior in almost every case. They typically have interesting unique abilities as well as some potentially amazing stats (there is some RNG involved). If you have high-risk, high-return enabled (which I did for most of the time I played) you get guaranteed legendary item drops which meant I had plenty of them to go around for all my members. Set items have fixed stats, and it generally felt like a huge stat sacrifice to try using a crafted item set for its particular special ability.
   [*][b]Quests[/b] - The quest system feels a little half-baked. Most quests are fetch quests and the rewards are primarily craftable items (see my point about crafted items above). I finished them all because I was wondering if they would go somewhere, add some interesting side character content, etc. but I can't really say they did. You learn a couple of minor things about some side characters but nothing that really felt worth the effort. The one silver lining is that they're entirely optional, so in hindsight I would not have bothered doing them.
[/olist]
developer_response:
The core content of the game is the growth and story of the character. It's a relief that these two contents received more than a medium rating from you. However, it is regrettable that Crafting and Quests, who believed that they would enrich the process of these two contents, received poor reviews from you. However, this regret is not due to your review, but due to our lack of game development skills.

If we list the performance of a piece of equipment solely on a numerical basis, there is no reason for its existence other than a certain (especially legendary) class of equipment. In order to avoid this problem, we're designing an equipment that has exceptional capabilities in a particular way, in addition to its figures. The reason why our intentions did not convince you is because we did not accurately grasp the intentions of the users. We will consider the process of designing the equipment more carefully so that the efforts that users have made to obtain the equipment and the results correspond to each other.

Quests plans to continue to expand accordingly as the game is updated. Through this system, our final goal is to make it easier to supply and receive materials needed for Crafting and finally create a virtuous cycle of Quests and Crafting. 

I would like to thank you for pointing out the current situation of the game through a well-organized document. I believe this review will be a good guide for anyone who wants to buy a Troubleshooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561199193448591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1694599597}
review: 不错的游戏
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

如果我们准备的游戏内容能愉快地填满你的时间，那对我们来说也是很大的乐趣。

关于你如何更愉快地体验【分争调整者】，我可以给你一个诀窍吗？

先完成【剧情任务】，让更多的同事加入你的团队。有了强大的战友，你就有了更多的战斗机会，这就意味着你很快就能在战斗中获胜。

刚开始游戏的难度不要设置得高。 各种任务只要完成一次，随时都可以再挑战。 而且以后再挑战的时候，你可以选择的装备和同事的范围会更大。

啊，游戏正式开始之前，请确认环境设置中的各种选项。包括加快游戏速度的功能(【快进队友行动】，【快进队友外的行动】)，提供利用多种设置舒适享受游戏的方法。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072233822', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4531, 'last_played': 1591973320}
review: The quality of the English translation is so poor that it completely breaks the immersion. You'd think that after all these years, they would have improved it. However, it seems they have prioritized Chinese and Japanese translations instead.
developer_response:
English is the language spoken by the most gamers, so it is also the most important language for us. However, since it is a language spoken by many people, the quality required is also high. We are not satisfied with this yet. English translation will also continue to improve while the game is being updated.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387276589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9707, 'last_played': 1694420270}
review:
XCOM+FFT+ハクスラという評判に偽りなし。やること沢山で面白い。
キャラ育成、特性（パッシブスキル的なもの）集め、装備堀り（orクラフト）、ドローンのカスタマイズ、野獣の捕獲＆育成、敵キャラの図鑑埋め等々……
戦闘も歯ごたえがあり、緊張感を失わずにプレイできる。逆に敗北・撤退時のペナルティは非常に軽いところもいい。

今後のアップデートにも期待しています。
developer_response:
(この文は翻訳機を使って作成されました。)

とても良いゲームを例に挙げて、私たちは果たしてTroubleshooterがこのような賞賛を受ける資格があるのか気になりました。 もちろん私たちが製作したトラブルシューターで褒められるのはいつもありがたいことですが、一方では自分自身を振り返らせるようです。 あなたがおっしゃったとおり、私たちはアップデートを通じてゲームをさらに改善していきます。

いい評価ありがとうございます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198280526896', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5696, 'last_played': 1681132342}
review:
量贼大的韩式回合制RPG，爽玩100h不是问题！
每个角色都有至少2套截然不同的成长方向，天赋树内容也相当丰富，加上角色本来就不少，根据任务需要可以组合出相当丰富的阵容策略，还有野兽培养/机械的内容，丰富度不亚于角色养成！
不过话分两头，由于游戏内容相当丰富，想要充分体验势必要……非常的肝！天赋要打，装备要打，信赖要刷，剧情要推，打一把少说二三十分钟，多则一个多小时……建议每日游玩时间不超过3h，不然身心健康难以保障（认真脸）
总的来说还是非常推荐游玩的，这个内容量绝对对得起价格！
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

幸好我们准备的游戏分量没有让你失望。我们也同意您的意见，即完成一项任务所需的时间不长。这是因为我们没有将最近的游戏趋势应用到我们的游戏中。我们现在一定会记住我们的错误，以免在我们未来的发展中重复同样的错误。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198073687318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1692879010}
review:
우리나라 게임이지만, 엑스컴 비슷한데 재밌다. 가격이 저렴하다. 그래픽은 약간 아쉽지만

developer_response:
역량이 많이 부족한 팀이다보니 부족한 부분이 많습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 즐겁게 즐겨주시니 그저 감사할 뿐입니다. ㅠ

그런 저희 팀이 여러분이 저희 게임에  보여주시는 관심에 보답하기 위해서는 꾸준히 이 게임을 조금 더 나은 모습으로 개선해 나가는 것이라고 생각합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217604620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 20598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9288, 'last_played': 1697818370}
review:
物超所值的硬核RPG戰棋遊戲
雖然是韓系畫風 但不影響遊玩體驗
本遊戲沒有SL玩法 完全的走一步算一步
有可能步步錯 也有可能一步到位
完全取自於玩家本身或電腦AI的隨機判斷
本遊戲搭配的被動技能玩法相當多樣 應該說超TM多
完全可以一人物搭配到你所想玩的部分
重點 主線劇情真有料的 真的沒想過韓國這家遊戲公司在人物的劇情描寫的非常到位
玩家所屬的劇情先不說 反派的劇情也是讓人有所感觸
玩著玩著 其實也蠻同情反派的某些部份 有些出於環境因素而改變 有些則是順著潮流新起 有些則是為了家庭
主角團也是每個都深懷絕技 也有些包括身世也是藏的很深的 雖然身為玩家來說其是清楚的 但在劇情內大家都像是刻意隱瞞
我是蠻希望這遊戲繼續推動主線 或是增加新人物進來
這遊戲只要熬過前期的兩人公司就真的蠻好玩的
我還是很在意這遊戲在男主身上最後到底會如何揭發幕後
希望製作方能繼續做下去
加油
developer_response:
( 這篇文章是在翻譯機的幫助下寫成的。)

感謝您對我們的良好嘗試給予好評。

很多同類型的遊戲,遊戲的故事往往只是起到戰鬥的排場作用。我們著眼於這一點，想把【分爭調整者】打造成故事處於一切中心的遊戲。我們這樣的意圖符合您的口味，真是萬幸。

" 這遊戲只要熬過前期的兩人公司就真的蠻好玩的 "

我同意這個說法。遊戲的故事遵循過去RPG遊戲的公式。但是最近的遊戲故事趨勢一刻也不能讓玩家們遠離注意力。不管故事的結局多麼有趣，這個過程也不能無聊。我們在這方面感覺到了我們的能力不足。而且因為不能隨意修改已經展開的故事，所以感到很遺憾。好好改善這些缺點，我們在未來的發展中會做出更好的遊戲。

感謝您的評論。

謝謝。

author: {'steamid': '76561198116319777', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 7485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7485, 'last_played': 1689945216}
review:
优点：
本体很耐玩，且战略和养成之间的结合做得比较好
build构筑非常丰富，不断尝试各种天赋搭配十分有趣，在战斗中检验养成和天赋搭配成果的成就感很强；如果愿意花功夫研究的话，基本每升几级就能有不一样的玩法
大部分剧情和地图的重玩价值都比较高，尝试不同战术反复通关可以带来多样的体验
有些剧情比较出彩，虽然并非所有情节都写得很好，但已经很难得了

缺点：
前期我方三位角色定位比较重合，均为偏近战的角色（虽然席翁在后期的玩法会发生变化），治疗者和射手的加入相对较晚，对于冲着“XCOM代餐”而来的玩家来说并不是好事
中期容易被敌人暴击秒杀（大概是初遇白虎帮的阶段），负反馈较强
中后期需要花费大量时间重复刷取资源
中后期敌人多为重复模板换皮
部分关键天赋容易错过，不看攻略都不知道要回到以前的关卡获取
对成就党不太友好，部分成就比较难完成
合成装备和天赋的操作非常繁琐，UI有待改进
DLC相对无聊（个人没有打完DLC2，因为今年好游戏太多了:P）

综合来说，喜欢SRPG的玩家推荐一试，第10~80小时的体验会非常棒，第80小时之后可能就没什么新鲜感了
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

感谢您不顾诸多短著，通过好评给予开发组继续未来开发的勇气。正如你所提到的，今年真的推出了很多好的游戏，我们也从那些游戏中得到了很好的刺激。 我们是6人组成的小型独立游戏开发组,所以事实上不可能制作那样的游戏。 但是我们会努力以我们自己的方式向玩家传达与大规模游戏不同的乐趣。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198008287497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7822, 'last_played': 1696367288}
review: An interesting take on the Turn based tactical game with an Anime feel. The mastery system makes it hard to level up. Getting the right sets is very important, but at the same time hard as you do noy know what masteries goes into a set. Still lots of content and very playable.
developer_response:
" An interesting take on the Turn based tactical game with an Anime feel. "

One of the expressions of the assessment that we saw often was "Anime XCOM". But I think your expression is the best abbreviation of Troubleshooter in a sentence.

As the content of the game increases, there is also more prior knowledge to experience the game more fun. All of these are meaningful only when gamers use them them themselves. We're going to work on ways to make this more accessible.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065448893', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6159, 'last_played': 1693532506}
review:
Calling a game a 'Hidden Gem' is kind of cliche at this point, but this is absolutely 100% a hidden gem of the strategy RPG genre. I've been a big fan of series like X-Com, Fire Emblem, or Tactics Ogre for a long time and this $25 game from a small studio holds up against the best of the best. So even though I never write Steam reviews I feel like it would be a disservice NOT to shill this game a bit. 

If you're familiar with X-Com or similar titles, you can largely understand how this game works. Top-down, tile-based, squad fighting. Unlike X-Com and more similar to titles like Final Fantasy Tactics, this game uses an AP system where instead of each side taking its turn at once, each individual character will take its turn depending on its speed, as well as modifiers such as what actions it took the previous turn or status effects. Also unlike X-Com, through the game you build a small squad (9 at end of main game) with no permadeath.

+Pros/-Cons:

+ High Build Customization: There's a system in this game called the Mastery Board. Basically, each character has multiple slots to place Masteries on. Masteries are modifiers for your character, and equipping certain masteries together might also unlock a Set which boosts the modifiers given. There are, at this moment, 827 masteries and 427 mastery sets. Many of these masteries are class or even character specific, and many of them are also limited to Beast units (more on that later) but that is a MASSIVE amount of build variety possible. I spent a lot of time workshopping combinations and then testing them in battle and I loved every minute of it. Also, every enemy you encounter in the game is built on its own masteries, only a few of which are enemy-restricted. So if you see an enemy with an interesting build, you can check that enemy's masteries and build your own unit similarly.

+ The Beast/Drone System: Later in the game you get a character on your squad who can tame beast enemies you encounter-- including many bosses. The process of taming is rather delicate, and taming a difficult enemy can involve a lot of risk taking for the ultimate reward: however tough that enemy was, once tamed your tamer character can summon them to most battles. This greatly expands the variety of units you can build and bring into battle. The drone system is similar-- you get a character who can summon controllable drones to the field. These drones have their own version of masteries called modules, of which there are 103 with 45 possible sets. There are different kinds of drones with different niches from high-speed drones with flamethrowers to tanky slow drones that fire movement-restricting spider webs. You individually build each drone with the crafting system, and it's a good sink for excess money and material late-game.

+ Massive gameplay customizability. If you don't like something about the game, there's a decent chance you can change it. For difficulty level alone, there are five options (Safe to Cruel), as well as a Challenge Mode that makes missions much harder which can be enabled for most missions individually. You can enable additional challenge options such as making boss units more difficult, limiting your level to the recommended level cap of each mission, give enemies additional masteries, and more. For speed of game, there are SEVEN options for how fast your or enemy's movements go where most games would give three options at most. 

+ Guides and Information: This game has a lot going on in terms of mechanics, masteries, enemy variety, loot, etc. However, just about anything you need to know CAN be found in game. The help menu is extremely thorough and even gives exact information such the equation to see how a unit's speed translates into AP. Every piece of loot or crafting material you get, as well as every mastery and every mastery set you have used, are all kept in easily accessible indexes in-game. There is an information system where as you encounter an enemy type more and more you get information on what masteries and attacks it has, its loot drop table with exact percentages, what maps you can find it on, and other useful information. For such an complex game, I only had to use google ONCE to find an answer to something I couldn't figure out. Everything else was readily available in-game. 

+ The story takes a while to really build but it is very engaging, does a fairly good job balancing the arcs of all the different characters that join you, and gives a lot of interesting lore about the world around you both implicitly and explicitly. The end of the main game ("Season 1") leaves some plotlines incomplete for the DLC and possible future seasons, and I genuinely want to see where it goes.

- The early game is slow and doesn't come close to how good the later game becomes. You start off with just the main character supported by generics, and you only build your team up gradually through the game's story. I think this largely comes down to how the game was developed chapter to chapter in Early Access. The best battle mechanics such as beast taming or the dance system only really come into play midway into the game because they took time to develop. 

- When you first start a new game you have to choose between playing Online mode or Offline mode. If you choose Offline, you can not switch that game to be Online later, meaning you can not interact with other players in-game or fighting others in PvP (I don't see many people online at any given time and have not tried to do PvP). If you choose Online, you have to have internet connection and the server has to be up any time you want to play. You CAN export a copy of your online mode game to offline mode, but this option isn't really mentioned clearly anywhere. I don't think all these restrictions are worth it for fair PvP experience

+ The game is STILL being updated gradually. If you look in the DLC you can see that after the game came out of early access in 2020, an additional free DLC chapter was added, and now there's an additional $10 DLC chapter for which content is still being released. So that's new missions, higher level caps, new unique characters with their own highly customizable niches, still being added to a game with 100+ hours of content in the base game.

+ Content Content CONTENT: I've gotten 100+ hours of game time without even touching the DLCs yet. Main game has 7 chapters divided into 47 missions. A few of these missions are as short as a one-on-one battle but some can take well over an hour to complete. Every single story mission is repeatable and you can take different options in story dialogue by repeating these missions, with some achievements even requiring this. There are (as far as I've discovered) 35 repeatable mission maps, 11 of which are 'violent case' maps which offer additional challenge in exchange for useful boss drops. There are a few other one-off maps you might see through doing side quests. The game gives you plenty of incentive to repeat chapters to unlock new masteries, get better loot, tame the interesting boss beast, complete a side quest, etc. There are 258 steam achievements, some of which are quite difficult and I'm tempted to get them all.

There's probably a lot more I could say about this game, but I'll end by saying that if Troubleshooters 2: Banished Children or whatever it could be called came out tomorrow for three times the price of this game, I would buy it in a heartbeat.

[EDIT]: I have since beaten the first, free DLC and tried PVP. The free DLC adds one chapter and two characters, each of which holds up to the quality of what is in the main game. 

As for PVP, it is unlocked only once you beat the main game meaning you could, like me, hit 100+ hours before ever even getting access. It is, however, very fun when you happen to find someone to do it with.
developer_response:
It's good to meet you a gamer who likes the strategy RPG genre. Especially a fan of Tactics Ogre. ( Because I also a fan of it :D )

The games you mentioned are all known as super classic ones. I think these are games that not only people who like this genre but also anyone who likes games should experience at least once. I'm not sure if Troubleshooter is eligible to be included in the list. But when we were young, we grew up being told by adults to keep our dreams grand. I think it's time for us to set that grand dream goal.

" The early game is slow and doesn't come close to how good the later game becomes "

I totally agree with this. When you want to tell a story, there are various ways to attract the reader's attention. It could be a great level of video, or a dense narrative style edited by a professional writer.

But we didn't make good use of any of the things mentioned above. Then we should have explored something else but we just thought of the RPG we used to enjoy in the old days and had the vague idea that if we did like them, we would be like them.

The old ways of RPGs are not always bad. But as I mentioned earlier, we're getting this assessment because we haven't recreated it in line with the current trend and we've been obsessed with following it. This is recognized by the development team as one of the most important things to watch out for when developing future games.

" When you first start a new game you have to choose between playing Online mode or Offline mode. "

When we first released the game, our ultimate goal was for gamers to be able to interact with each other and play the game long after the game had been updated, but we realized that an overwhelming number of gamers wanted Troubleshooter to be a complete single game first, rather than online-only content.

While our goals changed a bit, I think it was a great way to learn more about what gamers in this genre want.

We could read things in your review that we couldn't find in other reviews, and we could tell how carefully you played the game to write this review. 

We are confident that your review will be a good guide for anyone who is on the fence about buying Troubleshooter.

Thank you for your valuable review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108013557', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1703508892}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972229972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1703526197}
review: Yes
developer_response:
Nice to meet you!

I would like to give you a small tip to make the game more enjoyable.

First, complete the scenario missions first. More and more colleagues will gather around you.

You don't have to set the game's difficulty to hard from the beginning. All missions in the game, including scenario missions, can be re-challenged at any time, and at this time, you can set a more difficult difficulty.

Actively utilize the mastery set. It is the core system that makes your character strong.

You can set the pace of the mission fast. Reduce your wait time by adjusting the values of Ally Units Action Speed and Non-ally Units Action Speed in the game's settings.

Thank you for this review.

developer_response:

让联合训练成为受更多人喜爱的内容，对开发组来说也是一件愉快的事情。 只是对于游戏结束的人来说，联合训练成为最好的选择是我们不想做的事情。 我们将继续研究通过多种途径,以各自想要的方式享受游戏的方法。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041673937', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 7649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4697, 'last_played': 1692840412}
review: Very addicting TRPG with an interesting cast of characters and a TON of systems and optimizations you can engage with you make your perfect party for whatever mission you're tackling. The translation is a bit choppy but the story and characters come across well enough, and ultimately it's all about the missions and tactics (for me, anyway).
developer_response:
I apologize for not providing a high quality translation. Nevertheless, I appreciate your good review of the game, giving a small independent game development team the courage to continue developing the game.

Thank you for this review.
