author: {'steamid': '76561198317598857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 50380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41572, 'last_played': 1707039121}
review:
I promised myself that I would write a review after I finished the main game, but a year and a DLC later, I still haven’t fulfilled that promise, so here goes.

This game is awesome. It is in my recommendation list for someone who adores Final Fantasy Tactics Advance and the likes, with all the customizability and character customization, as well as the fantastic storyline I can’t help but got hooked into it. So, without further ado, here are the my judgements:

[h1] Pros [/h1]
-	[b] An awesome mix of “magic” and modernity [/b] : World-building is extensive, and I love how you got the side-characters and antagonists’ backstories to show their motivations and backgrounds. I actually felt sad and was internally crying at some moments :’(
-	[b] New mode of character customization [/b] : I was really impressed by the mastery system. It’s so distinct and innovative. Most I’ve played with has something to do with skills, classes, and equipment optimization for builds. For this game, passive masteries are equippable and are the bread and butter of the character. With over 700+ masteries available, add the specific combination of masteries giving extra bonuses, optimization and theorycrafting becomes your one of the reasons why you can’t put down the game.
-	[b] Lovable characters [/b] : From the kind but distant Albus to the easygoing Sion, you’ll fall in love with them and their interactions with everyone else. Instead of customizing random characters for your team, you are given set number of protagonists, and they did a great job in keeping them interesting yet customizable enough.
-	[b] Innovative gameplay [/b] : Fair enough, I love tactical games but they did a great job to the genre. A wide variety of effects, builds, enemies, and abilities, you won’t feel bored through the progression
-	[b] Korean VA [/b] : As an ignorant gamer, hearing Korean voice-acting gives me shivers. They did a great job at it!
-	[b] Developer communication [/b] : They regularly communicate, update, and reply to the reviews. Seeing it makes you believe that they really pour their heart out with this game.
-	[b] Soundtrack [/b] : they’ve got original awesome soundtrack and amazing soundtrack direction, enough to pull your heartstrings
-	[b] Awesome art [/b] : I love how varied and beautiful the artworks are, and really have details that are important in the whole storyline.

[h1] Cons [/h1]
-	[b] Steep learning curve [/b] : This game is definitely not for casual gamers. When I first bought it, I became overwhelmed with the game system that I didn’t touch it again until the pandemic happened.
-	[b] Limited endgame [/b] : I did say that you won’t feel bored through the progression, but towards the endgame, the missions that you can actually tackle with characters dying (or become out of action) can only be counted with your hands. You want to replay the mission again from your earlier gameplays? They become very pitiful against you, even at the hardest difficulty possible.
-	[b] Minor mistranslation, typos, and capitalization inconsistencies [/b] : Especially for newly released content. well, to be fair, English is not their first language, and they do correct it from time to time, so I’ll give them that.
-	[b] Can get grindy [/b] : [spoiler] Especially for legendary beasts, if you want to optimize them but you got an unfortunate mastery that can’t be changed, well, retry the mission again. [/spoiler]
-	[b] Some soundtrack looping [/b] : some battle soundtrack aren’t looping properly [spoiler] (especially the Clown ones) [/spoiler]
-	[b] Mostly male enemies [/b] : Well, to be fair, they have budget constraints during their early access. But sometimes, it feels like a fight against patriarchy during the battlefield

Overall, it’s one of the best games I have ever played and spent. I’m excited for the Crimson Crow DLC, as well as the Season 2 of Troubleshooter!
developer_response:
Your praise makes us reflect on ourselves. We're going to check again to see if Troubleshooter is a game that deserves good reviews like this. If the result falls short of your evaluation in the process, we will improve it to match your result!

- Steep learning curve :
As you mentioned, Troubleshooter is no longer a casual game. But actually, this wasn't intended. When we first designed this game, we wanted to create an easy turn-based game that anyone could easily access. Since then, many updates have been applied and eventually it has become a game with steep learning curve. Even if there are many systems, if it is not used, it will be like nothing. The development team will think about how to finish learning curve a little faster.

- Limited endgame :
In order for gamers to continue to play, the development team must continue to supply new elements or meet the challenges of gamers. But it doesn't seem easy to appeal to gamers (including you) who have figured everything out in the game. In this situation, we decided to introduce a new story and a new character rather than a forced difficulty mission. This is not going to last forever. Because it's almost time for us to make a sequel. Still, we want to provide as many variables as we can to provide gamers with the best opportunity to utilize these variables.

- Minor mistranslation, typos, and capitalization inconsistencies :
This is one of the problems that has been going on since we released the game. We are trying to update the amendments received through various channels as soon as possible, but it is true that there are clear limitations. This problem that we've updated the game over and over again will continue. That won't dampen game updates.

- Can get grindy :
The game started with turn-based, but we're starting to introduce elements of RPG here, and the game is becoming SRPG. Here we thought too much of a traditional RPG element, and it seems that we lacked the thought of upgrading it to the speed of modern games. We will thoroughly distinguish between optional and essential content so that grindy contents does not interfere with the progress of the game.

- Some soundtrack looping :
It sounds like a bug. I'll check it. Thank you for letting me know.

- Mostly male enemies :
You're right. At the beginning of our development, we didn't have the development funds to make female enemies. We had no choice but to modify and reuse the existing enemies little by little. And so over time, we're now able to produce female figures. But now each country's cultural characteristics are an obstacle. We offer the same game to all countries. That's why we're setting up characters and enemies from a conservative point of view.

Thank you for the valuable review. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198002771162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 12722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3513, 'last_played': 1673641687}
review:
I originally refunded this game back when it came out in early access. Recently repurchased after seeing the positive reviews as well as the review details and I have to say I could not be happier with my purchase.

For a great price you get a hybrid between XCOM2 and more complex character driven RPGs like Path of Exile. The Mastery system is truly complex and allows you to freely customize how your characters play. I am not even half way through the game and yet have more than 50 hours played mainly because I stare at my screen trying to theory craft new builds and then go farm the stuff I need for them. On top of that you also get a Manga/Manhwa-esque Story and characters. This could be a plus if you are into stuff like that, but can also be ignored if you just want the gameplay, as the game lets you skip most story sequences from the start. Not that you should skip them, but you can if you'd like.

The one thing that can get in the way of your fun a little bit is the sometimes rocky translation. This is mostly a problem for skill and mastery descriptions as opposed to the story elements, as things tend to be expressed in a very roundabout or convoluted way. They are still understandable, but you will most likely have to re-read descriptions and potentially try some of them out in combat to fully understand how they work.

Still, it's an absolute gem of a game, and I can't wait to finish the main story and then get the DLC that is currently available. I hope they either release more DLC in the future, or maybe even make a sequel with more crazy character customization (and possibly more classes for each character, a man can dream after all).
developer_response:
Despite refunding our game, thank you for re-buying our game!! 

We're so happy to hear your first sentence. Because we are low capabilities, we could't provides lots of contents at the Early Access. And although we did our best to fill the enjoyable contents after that time, we couldn't catch the player who already lost an interesting in our game.

Wow! Oh my God! You have returned! 

Low qulaity of translation is perfectly our falut. Now, we are doing our best to improve it with player volunteers. We know that it' not sufficient to make translation perfect. So we'll do our best to improve it steadily!

Once again, thank you so much for finding our game.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

author: {'steamid': '76561198177797777', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 7611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2304, 'last_played': 1672149037}
review:
So this is the latest Korean strategy indie that I tried out after getting a taste of ProjectMoon's games and it was pretty great, the theorycrafting potential is especially impressive. There are some systems that feel bloated and unfinished compared to Library of Ruina's more polished and tighter game design but Troubleshooter is still a full experience in many ways (inexpensive too!) And yes it's like XCOM but it feels more like a SRPG with the build potential and stats.

I will definitely be picking up whatever future installments coming out for this series.
developer_response:
We think that Project Moon's games(Lobotomy corporation, library of ruina) is the attractive game! The Project Moon dev is passionate and sincere.

We'll also be a development team that consistently provides the pleasure that satisfies your expectations!

Thank you for playing our game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052290330', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1704129309}
review:
Très bon RPG tactique avec beaucoup de systèmes interdépendants, des personnages bien développés.

Attention, beaucoup de grind en perspective, à réserver aux amateurs du genre, tentés par un contexte qui changerait un peu des sempiternels mondes fantastiques et magiques.

English version: very good tactical RPG, with a lot of interlinked systems and well-developped characters.

A lot of grinding, it is a better fit for lovers of the genre, who would like a change of setting, compared to the usual fantasy and magical worlds.
developer_response:
No one in the development team knows the French so I used the Google Translation to understands your review. I ask for your understanding.

First of all, I would like to thank you for playing the game despite the fact that French translation was not provided in the game. We also thank you for giving the development team the strength to move forward through a good review despite these huge shortcomings.

We'll do our best to give more pleasures!

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020800894', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4121, 'last_played': 1684722701}
review:
I really love this game. For a long time I was looking for a good game that will hook me, somehow new games are mostly not interesting for me and then I decided it's time to buy Troubleshooter. I fell in love from first minutes, characters are well done, story is quite engaging, graphic is quite ok (it can be improved, but I like it), soundtrack matches the game, especially I love "We are Troubleshooters" "Next Step" and " Finish My Work". It's all nice but of course there is one awesome aspect, gameplay, I just love it, fights  at least for me are really rewarding, sometimes I'm a bit mad but then after work done I'm satisfied, even if sometimes I needed to repeat the mission. Mechanics, difficulty, maps are well thought out. I love finding new build (even if they are not optional xD), it's always refreshing xD (maybe my love for turned based games help here as well).
Only thing I would maybe want, a bit less farm, thos it's not big of a problem for me. Maybe I became too big fanboi but it's hard to find big cons :D

So overall I should pick up this game earlier but for some unknown hesitated. I just want to play more. I'm amazed that small studio put much more love into its product than big companies. Keep up with good work, Dandylion became my top game studio ( with Larian Studio).
developer_response:
Thank you for your sincere review.

We can do our best to develop and improve this game because you like us and our game. So we'll do our best to repay you more enjoyable contents.

And it's a shame that we couldn't approach to you quickly because it's an unknown team. This is entirely our problem, and we'll do our best to become famous through "Troubleshooter"!

Have a good time!

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271512663', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14466, 'last_played': 1697170069}
review:
《纷争终结者》作为一款类xcom的战棋游戏，着重刻画每个人物的剧情（不只是主角），与xcom只有主要人物剧情，其他士兵都是可替代的有着鲜明的区别。
    本游戏的每个人职业、属性的不同使得每个人都是不可替代的，同时增加了可同时上场人数，最多8人的作战小队使得玩家的战术更加丰富，游戏并不像xcom有着丰富的基建系统，只有装备的制作、分解，以及两位同伴加入赋予的机械制作和宠物捕捉。
   游戏里最核心的就是其中的天赋系统，每个人每个职业需要在有限的格子搭配各种天赋套装，使得每个人的养成更加多元化；天赋的获取需要进行大量的刷取，而且开发商对于天赋的更新一直是持续的，机械和宠物也有着与人类完全不同的天赋表，令游戏的重复可玩性大幅增加。
    附：不知道是不是联机模式的原因，操作的时候会有延迟，如果不是网络原因希望开发商能对卡顿情况进行优化。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

XCOM对我们来说是大哥一样的存在。 我们从XCOM借用了经过很多人验证的优秀的战斗系统。 而且作为代价，我们不得不实现与XCOM不同的独特系统。 因为游戏玩家对独立游戏开发组想要的不仅仅是改变大作游戏外表的游戏，而是能够传达独特经验的游戏。

其中最具代表性的就是天赋。 我们没有能力制作能够多样地装饰角色外形的系统。 相反，我们想建立一个能够灵活运用角色能力的系统。 幸运的是，你掌握了它，它似乎完全被利用了。为了让你有更多的时间和我们游戏在一起，我们会继续丰富现在的系统。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198976246201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14732, 'last_played': 1698221994}
review:
评测：纷争终结者，被遗弃的孩子们

作为一个老年回合类游戏的深度玩家，纷争终结者这款游戏毫无疑问，我是推荐回合制爱好者入手的。我先来说说优点
优点：
1.角色很好看，对于颜值控来说这点很重要。主角和反派都有塑造自己的故事，非常不错，剧情可圈可点；很不错的感觉，本施耐德很有魅力！
2.技能天赋系统虽然还不全，但是能看出来制作组用心的设定，而且一直在更新，可以看出了制作组和玩家一样很热爱这款游戏
3.每个角色有两条转职可以选，研究空间巨大，还有宠物的玩法
4.很容易让人爱不释手，开发自己的套路打法

再说一下我觉得需要改进的地方，主要是角色方面
@Dandylion
1.艾琳——艾琳的组合天赋“我的梦想是英雄”，组合效果为“复活之后可以触发英雄”，然而这个组合天赋本身并不能复活而且加强的效果有限，如果再给防御模块配第二个心脏或者不死鸟来响应，性价比真的非常低，所以现在几乎不怎么使用“我的梦想是英雄”这一个组合天赋

2.吉赛尔，精密狙击—这个天赋狙击头部居然不是百分百爆头。说真的狙击手这一职业我觉得并不是特别强，因为在游戏后期，近战角色几乎人人格挡加冲击场，远程射手各种隐蔽移动，很难一枪直接把人狙死，而且敌人有烟雾的情况下免疫爆头，所以这个天赋狙击头部改成百分百爆头并不过分

3.比安科，黑魔女—这一组合天赋，只有强化技能的风之魔女还不错，其他几个几乎是完全没有作用。问题是这一天赋强化的是“幻术”技能，但是设计师偏偏把“幻术”的控制效果定义为物理异常，那也就是根本控不了狂暴的敌人，而且这一组合天赋耗费的点数巨大，却只有一个鸡肋的幻术技能收益。我的建议是，要么把幻术改为精神异常状态，要么组合天赋进一步强化一下风之魔女天赋。

4.黑魔法师—后期的泪水职业，说实话现在的黑魔法师两位，无论是比安科还是席翁，存在一个问题，小技能AOE缺乏——技能射程又不如敌方射手，外加敌人的隐蔽移动，使黑魔法师在自家近战切完对面射手之前完全没有胆量出门，否则就是被乱枪打死；期待制作组关注一下这个职业

5.米思提，这个是我后来加的，因为深红乌鸦dlc刚出，这个角色也确实很多需要调整的地方，盗贼的隐身类似于是限定技能，基本全局开始用一次之后就和人正面对决了。忍者的隐身是真的容易被发现，特别是一些路过的路人甲随便破了隐身...另外水系忍术都是超能力加成，我不知道设计师是否有让这个角色能走法系的思路

然后有一些怪物的技能觉得很好用，期待后续图鉴收集满了能解锁学习该怪物的技能，比如安学个大地祝福和地震什么的

另外明星这个职业的很多分支天赋，比如音乐家系列还在制作，非常期待
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

1. 艾琳 :
" 英雄的那个组合天赋要求是复活能够发动，然而你这个天赋本身却并不能复活，"

因为我在使用翻译器，所以无法正确理解你的文章中的一部分。 能准确地告诉我相当于上述句子的 '英雄的那个组合天赋' 和 '这个天赋本身' 吗？

2. 吉赛尔 :
这部分很难同意。 防御 '吉赛尔' 和 '黑星' 攻击的敌人确实比以前多了。 但他们仍然在我军后方负责强大的火力。 因为某个角色不能通过一次攻击击败敌人，所以给那个角色像 '百分百爆头' 一样的固定数值,我认为是非常危险的冒险。

3 & 4 比安科 :
比安科在战斗中给敌人带来混乱，在进攻和防守中起到辅助作用( 特别是 黑魔女 的情况 )。 但是，这种作用在目前的战斗中很难得到很高的评价，因为比起试图向敌人异常状态，要求更多的攻击。另外，由于没有设定为带头战斗并承受对方的攻击，所以要接近敌人的近距离对 黑魔导士 是不合理的，这一点我们也有一定程度的同意。但是，如果距离的问题得到解决，黑魔导士 的输出可能会稍微低一些。
我们将讨论如何使 比安科 在战斗中的作用更加明显，包括您提出的使 '幻术' 更有效的方法。

5. 米斯媞 :
开发组认为，目前 '米斯媞' 对 '忍者' 的利用多种多样，但 '盗贼' 的特色较弱。因为 '米斯媞' 是第一个正式使用 '隐身' 的角色，所以我认为今后会发生很多与 '隐身' 相关的变更。我们现在将集中精力提出利用 '米斯媞' 的多种方法。

谢谢你提出这么好的意见。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198099846664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 24051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23950, 'last_played': 1709325003}
review:
진홍까마귀 8장까지 업데이트 된건가요?
2장 사필귀정 이후로 스토리가 진행이 안되는데
developer_response:
진홍까마귀 DLC는 시즌 패스 형태로 발매하였습니다. 내년 여름 말까지 3~4 주 주기로 업데이트를 진행할 예정이며, 총 8개의 시나리오 스테이지와 2개의 강력 사건을 목표로 하고 있습니다.

시즌 패스 형식의 업데이트를 상품 페이지에 적어두었지만, 이 부분이 명확하게 드러나지 않는 부분으로 인해 구입에 오해를 드려 죄송합니다.

비록 한 번에 업데이트 되지 못하지만 최선을 다해 이어지는 업데이트로 즐거운 컨텐츠가 가득찰 수 있도록 최선을 다하겠습니다.

DLC 발매에 찾아주셔서 진심으로 감사합니다. T_T

author: {'steamid': '76561198862372693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12257, 'last_played': 1701094644}
review: 游戏非常好玩，就是天赋列表不知道，一个个试有点浪费时间
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

天赋是游戏的核心系统。 开发组积极鼓励使用它。 但是不公开所有内容是为了在游戏中发现什么的乐趣。 也许游戏开发者认为的游戏设计和喜欢游戏的玩家认为的游戏设计存在差异。 为了让你以最小的努力找到附加天赋，还需要什么呢？ 如果你有意见，请通过公告栏告诉我们！

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198037482967', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1669232591}
review:
구매한지는 좀된거 같은대..일단 입문하기 제일 힘든점이 특성판보면 멍할정도로 뭔가 입문하기가 힘든거같습니다
다른 평가에도 좀 보이는거같던대 아무래도 인디게임이고 하다보니 일러스트랑 인게임 모델이랑 차이가 심해서 아쉽긴하네요
일단 게임자체가 좀 하드?하다 해야하나 초반에 알아야 될게많고 공략글을 읽어도 특성판에 종류가 너무 많아서 이부분이 신규 유저들이 유입하기가 제일 힘든거같네요  신규입장에서는 혹시나 차기작이 나오게된다면 게임이 너무 복잡한거보다는 어느정도 타협을봐서 간단하게 만드는것도 좋을거같네요 일부로 확장팩 이나 코스튬등 다 나오면 플레이할려고 처음 맛만보고 존버중이긴하지만 차기작이 나온다면 개발자분들이 아쉬웠던부분들 그래픽 업글등해서 나오면 아마 살거같습니다 그리고 갈수록 한판 한판 길어지기때문에 피로함이 생각보다 있구요 잘마무리해서 차기작이든 새로운 아이피든 잘나오면 좋겠습니다
developer_response:
여러모로 많이 부족한 저희 게임을 즐겨주셔서 감사합니다.

지적해주신 대로 게임이 가지는 방향성에서 현재 트렌드 게임에 비해 많이 무거운 것은 사실입니다. 최대한 그런 무거운 부분을 고려하지 않아도 즐길 수 있는 난이도 혹은 모드를 동시에 제공하여 말씀하신 유저층 들에게도 쉽게 어필할 수 있는 방법을 같이 고려하도록 하겠습니다.

부족함에도 불구하고 응원해주셔서 감사합니다!

즐거운 한 주 보내세요!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048527140', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3061, 'last_played': 1669925595}
review:
Я не очень часто пишу отзывы на игры, но пожалуй что, эти чуваки заслужили хороший отзыв

TROUBLESHOOTER: Abandoned Children - это не идеальная игра. 

В ней довольно-таки долгие загрузки между миссиями, очень дешёвая 3D графика- особенно это заметно на крупных планах, которые эта игра любит брать, а ещё есть пункт который дико раздражает лично меня- в отличие от последних игр в серии xcom персонажи не могут перепрыгивать через заборчики высотой в полметра, а вставшая в проходе девочка-подросток 14 лет своим широченным плечом способна перегородить дорогу всему отряду  , если случайно оставить её в проходе- союзные юниты не могут ходить через пространство друг друга,поэтому расставлять их нужно очень аккуратно, чтобы случайно не устроить пробку на дороге на ровном месте , перегоняя выданный тебе игрой отряд из твоей банды вооружённых школьников , к которым игра в нагрузку дала несколько юнитов-полицейских . 

Всё остальное , впрочем-сделано очень душевно . Абсолютно потрясающий конструктор билдов , который мне чем-то напомнил настройку мехов в последнем battletech , в котором из выданных нам игрой персонажей можно слепить какое-то чудовищное количество различных машин для уничтожения всего живого (и неживого- врагов в игре сделано очень много разных видов) . История-простоватая и немного наивная , но вполне себе занятно переплетающая целую кучу самых разных героев и злодеев. Персонажи- которые хотя и являются классическими героями аниме всё же написаны ( озвученные диалоги в игре не завезли совсем, что логично, учитывая чудовищное количество текста в игре) вполне прилично и очень весёлый геймплей- причина играть во всё это, сталкивая лбами то , что набилдили разработчики с нашим маленьким, но очень гордым отрядом школьников-траблшутеров , выкашивая пачками преступников, культистов и местную фауну. Учитывая то, что эту игру разрабатывали с бюджетом примерно в ящик пива и упаковку рамена- мне очень интересно посмотреть на то, что эти люди смогут сделать с нормальным бюджетом, поэтому купил копию игры другу до кучи , а ещё артбук с саундтреком,потому что музыка хорошая и 2д арт красивый . Игра не идеальна, но как по мне- очень хороша и я залип в неё на какое-то дурное количество времени на протяжении последней недели и буду играть ещё.

P.S: Кто-нибудь из игравших в игру понял , как можно быстрее перегнать отряд из дюжины юнитов из одного конца карты в другой? Бесит по десять раз кликать всему отряду, чтобы каждый десяти подконтрольных юнитов пробежал условную десятую часть одной из огромных карт , которые игра порой подкидывает, особенно в побочных миссиях .
developer_response:
No one in the development team knows the Russian so I used the Google Translation to understands your review. I ask for your understanding.

Thank you for your detailed review!

Becasue our lack capabilities, we couldn't solve the problems such as long time for loading, low-quality 3D, anti-jumpable fence, and blocking path by allies. These are parts where player can have a better experience if we solve and improve them. So we'll do our best to improve our capabilities and improve these areas to give you a better experience.

And in the case of the police unit, the AI panel at the bottom right allows them to switch to automatic action.

Although it is not a perfect game, we'll do our best to make it a game that gives you pleasure for a long time!!

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120005567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 13329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12637, 'last_played': 1695877004}
review:
고춧가루와 계란을 넣은 우동을 매우 좋아하는 제작진이 만든 X-COM 시리즈 스타일의 SRPG 게임.
사이코패스(?) 살육마 주인공을 바탕으로 흘러가는 영웅전기식 군상극 스토리와 특성 시스템(=로봇대전 시리즈의 기어나 부품이라 생각하면 됨)을 기반으로 한 복잡성과 내가 짜는 재미를 느끼게 해주는 전투 시스템이 장점이다.
특히 유랑광대단 사원들의 스토리는 제작사 직원들의 자화상이 아닐까 싶을 정도로 혼이 느껴진다.
단점은 갈수록 늘어나는 캐릭터 덕분에 게임 한판한판이 매우 늘어지고 쓸놈쓸 현상이 가속화되고 있다. 그리고 주인공의 서사가 너무 빈약해 사패(?)하고 욕하는 이딴 리뷰에 추천이 달릴 지경이다.
해결책은 궤적 시리즈 마냥 같은 주인공을 리셋시켜가며 만드는 새로운 타이틀(혹은 시즌)을 내놓거나 DLC를 이용한 서사 강화가 필요한 시점이라 본다. 기업 이익적 측면을 감안하면 전자가 낮겠지만, 그것도 지금 작품의 서사를 일단락 지은 다음이다. (예시 : 바람지구편 완결)
하지만 (정식)출시된 지 2-3년이 지났음에도 꾸준한 업데이트와 빠른 피드백으로 인한 제작진의 노력이 돋보이며, X-COM 스타일의 수요가 있는 해외시장을 노린 스팀이라는 플랫폼 선택도 그렇고 앞으로의 기대가 많은 게임이다.
개인적으론 제작사가 한국의 Falcom사라 불릴 정도로 성장하길 기대해본다.

P.S : 매력적인 캐릭터가 자꾸 늘어나고 생기는 건 좋은 일이지만, 아직 살육마 주인공의 스토리는 반의 반도 못 풀은 느낌입니다. 진도 좀 나가주세요... ㅠㅜ
(본 평가는 2022 스팀 어워드 배지떄문에 1번 이상 수정되었습니다.)
developer_response:
역량이 부족함에도 불구하고 주제넘게 주인공의 스토리를 길게 시즌으로 가져가려고 했기에 이 사단이 나버렸습니다. T_T

말씀하신대로 이번 DLC 완료 후 여력이 된다면 알버스의 이야기를 추가하거나 혹은 시즌 2인 신작으로 넘어간다 하더라도 알버스의 이야기를 중점으로 풀어나가는 방향성을 강화하도록 하겠습니다!

많은 부분 역량 부족으로 이야기를 압축시켜 전달하지 못해 죄송합니다!

그럼에도 불구하고 즐겁게 즐겨주셔서 감사합니다.

즐겁고 행복한 한  주 되시길 바라겠습니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028664786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 72873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70004, 'last_played': 1669309224}
review:
Surely one of the most entertaining take on the X-Com / Jagged Alliance genre.

Everything in this game ranges from well made to really good.
Character evolution mechanics are a blast. It's an inventive, fun and rewarding system.
The combat system is remarkably well thought out, and the numerous hand-crafted levels manage to keep the fights interesting throughout the whole game.
There is a lot of contents even for a single playthrough, but most characters can be built in a variety of ways and some synergies between members can be developped. This variablility can keep the game fresh for a couple extra palythroughs.
Graphics are very nice, in a cartoonish style well suited to the game's superheroes universe.
The story might seem a bit strange, but the characters are cute and likeable as hell.
The translation has a few minor issues, but with no consequence on the gameplay.

All in all, a true hidden gem. Cute, fun and refreshing. Highly recommended.
developer_response:
It's an honor to compare with masterpieces like "X-Com / Jagged Alliance." 

We did our best to give you the pleasure we could, creating a turn-based strategy RPG. In the process, there may have been some that were conveyed as unpleasant rather than pleasant due to insufficient competency. Nevertheless, I'm just grateful that you enjoy our game.

As long as we continue to develop this game, we will do our best to give you more pleasure.

Have a great week!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007466044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1680934957}
review: Great game. Great content. Great graphics. What can I say. A fresh setup, on PC. I just started playing so to speak. Not always easy to understand everything. Just one single issue with a "lowered camera" problem at the beginning of the mission, when I just can not "reset" to normal camera view, is very unfortunate and annoys me a lot. Otherwise I'll keep on playing this great game. Looking forward how the story develops.
developer_response:
Sorry for the inconvenience!

What is the "lowered camera"? You can control the camera Zoom In/Out through "T", "G" key, and the camera height through Mouse Wheel Up/Down. Camera Zoom In/Out provides the position fix. But camera height is the instance fix. So if the camera height doesn't seem to change, it's a camera zoom-in problem. Use the "T" and "G" keys.

If it is not the above problem, could you tell us your problem in detail again?

We'll do our best to solve your problem!! Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025599484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6261, 'last_played': 1668672661}
review:
I think the game is wonderful, with only a few points before you get started.

First, the game does a poor job of onboarding you. There's a ton of things that you're gonna have to either look up or stumble on in game. How Stuns work, Machine crafting, Taming, and crafting stick out as the ones I remember. 

Aside from that, the game sort of... stumbles over the finish line. The final chapter of the main story does not end well, nor does it feel particularly engaging to play in. At worst, the difficulty in the final chapter came from annoying synergy that the final enemies have. The arguably best fight in the game is found optionally, close to the end.

But with that said, I got a solid 100 hours out of the game, and I haven't finished it fully. This is clearly part 1 of two (or more hopefully), and the game's cadence clearly establishes that it's not finished with anything, and with that you don't get a lot of closure. If that's a deal breaker for you, avoid the game. If not, you'll have a wonderful tactical RPG on your hands with fantastic writing, characters, and mechanics to uncover.
developer_response:
Recent game trends give gamers an instant experience. It is designed to provide end-content of the game at the start of the game, or to experience everything in the game for just 30 minutes. If you look at Troubleshooter from this perspective, the game might look very inflexible (and not very good visually either). 

Troubleshooter follows the traditional formula of SRPG. You have to spend a lot of time to experience everything in the game. Of course, the traditional way is not bad. I think it's the most ideal way to develop a game if you keep the tradition and make it sophisticated. Unfortunately, however, we lacked this sophistication.

I think overcoming the boredom of tradition will definitely give you another experience of the game afterwards, but this is not a welcome way for gamers. We realized this belatedly, but already a lot of the game has been stuck in the traditional way and there was a clear limit to improving it.

So the development team spent more time in the second half of the game while improving the first half of the game as much as possible. Although Troubleshooter is weak in attracting people, it's not to miss out on a gamer that's attracted once.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006714108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3956, 'last_played': 1697693668}
review:
The Best Xcom.

Sure, its lacking a bit in the translation department, but not to the point where I couldnt understand what was meant. You get used to it.

A lovely (huge) amount of build twinking, and enjoyable combat (and not the yell-at-my-screen frustration of xcom2012/2)

Its a slow burn, and it takes a long time to introduce mechanics and chars, and you might end up replaying/farming missions for specific loot, and afaik you have to refer to out-of-game info on where to get certain masteries half the time. But im the kind of guy that doesnt consider most of those points a bad thing.

Personally, I was a little skeptical about it, but had kept hearing it was good, believe the hype. And give that guy replying to all the comments a raise :)
developer_response:
In the first sentence of your review, the development team felt great glory, but in the following content, the development team felt ashamed consecutively.

" its lacking a bit in the translation department "

" Its a slow burn, and it takes a long time to introduce mechanics and chars, and you might end up replaying/farming missions for specific loot, and afaik you have to refer to out-of-game info on where to get certain masteries half the time. "

" I was a little skeptical about it "

Reading the sentences above raises doubts about whether we deserve a good review. However, I do not believe that you are trying to sarcastically or criticize the development team through this review. I decided to accept the contents of the review purely.

There are still many shortcomings in the game. Nevertheless, I think your leaving a good review means that there are many good things. We will improve the shortcomings and make the good ones better. :D

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212955444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1667830112}
review:
xcom1 2 키메라 다 사고 1 2는 엔딩을 몇번 이상 봤을 정도로 이런 게임 좋아하지만
이 게임은 너무 가볍다.
developer_response:
' 너무 가볍다 '

정확한 표현이십니다. 저희는 XCOM으로부터 많은 영향을 받았고 검증된 전투 시스템을 차용했지만 개별 미션의 실패로 인한 악영향, 캐릭터의 죽음등이 SRPG 에서는 너무 큰 부담 요소라고 생각했습니다. 그래서 이런 부분을 어떻게 하면 가볍게 만들 수 있을까 고민하며 이 게임을 개발했습니다. 캐릭터의 분위기도 마찬가지이고요. 뭐랄까요...XCOM스러운데 XCOM스럽지 않은? 그런것을 만들고자 노력하고 있습니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

review: I really liked this. I came in expecting Korean XCOM - some sort of KCOM - but it was much more than that. It's like XCOM without the stress of permadeath. It's a very competently made game. It never crashed, and I don't recall any bugs. The translation is kind of screwy, and its storytelling style is good at some times and weird & bad at others, but the gameplay is solid. It was fun! I could write a giant review, but there's no point. It's a fun game.
developer_response:
Your play time has more power than a giant review. I love the word KCOM. And I'm relieved it didn't disappoint you. We're not sure if the game we made was well-made enough to have the modifier K. However, from now on, the development team will further improve Troubleshooter to fit the modifier K.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051947622', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8336, 'last_played': 1668292115}

author: {'steamid': '76561198361172243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1669042934}
review:
[h1]SERIOUSLY NEEDS A LOT OF POLISH [/h1]

No, it's not as good as Xcom 2:WOTC, far from it. 

To describe it, the story plays like a visual novel game with "X-com like" combat. But a lot of them are really sub par in terms of design. I know there is a massive difference in budget, so i won't blame things such as poor graphics and so on. I find a lot of the design choices really bad, but I also like these kind of turn based game and want to see more of it, so i end up giving it a recommend, while listing all the cons below that I hope the devs will fix it in the future. Sigh.

[h1]STORY [/h1]
Sorry, the story is actually terrible, it tries to be heart warming, mixed with some idiotic elements, and a mess of themes. In this world, there's..... magic? Yeah, it's not explained, while some of the bandits fight with guns and bats, this world is an anime kind of world where some people have super powers and such, it's really weird. I haven't finish the entire story line obviously, but there's this whole "Spoon" worshipping (yes, literal spoon) that I find downright idiotic, and it's quite a major part of the story. 
While Xcom2 starts strong with an overarching main goal, here there isn't any main goal initially, it's just a guy becoming a "Troubleshooter", which is something like a supercop, and trying to do his job, then on his adventure, he meet friends like anime. Xcom2 starts strong with great pacing, here it starts really slow, almost like a slog. Guy graduate from academy, clean up apartment, find rent, get rent, take job, recruit colleagues etc. I'm 8 hours in, there is still no main narrative. Pick a theme and focus into it, don't try to mix serious and goofy when you don't have much experience in storytelling.

[h1]COMBAT [/h1]
Combat is rather good, seeing it copies closely to Xcom2, and I like the big maps they have, not small arenas like some games. Unfortunately, it doesn't copy everything good in Xcom2. Like in Xcom2, some missions you start in ambush, and the tiles are marked with "!" to signal that if you step on those tiles, enemies will notice you. Here, it is so idiotic, even on your normal blue travel distance, the "!" is actually hidden. So it seems like you can walk to that tile but NO, the moment you step onto that tile the ambush got broken. What's the point? Then there is no strategy available, because the system deliberately hides what can and cannot be done even when it should be visible. 

And even more CRAPPY, is that once you noticed the "!" sign, it's not even all revealed to you! So you try to move one of your units near one of the "!", and guess what? Your unit stepped into an unseen "!" and the whole ambush is thrown away, even though IT HAS BEEN REVEALED. This is utter garbage design.

Some actions are also so redundant and annoying. If you stand beside a treasure chest, a prompt to open a treasure chest appear, and you have to click that specific prompt for that "specific" action, but when you click it, it ask you again whether do you want to open the treasure chest. How idiotic, why am i clicking that prompt then? 
Every single specific prompts does that, 2 clicks instead of 1 click. 

The dodge feature in this game is ridiculous. In Xcom2, even if you can miss a 95% chance shot, you will hit it most of the time, which is why cover is so important. Here.... it's really kinda meaningless, like holy crap, 4 cops cannot shoot a single dog because the dog "dodges" all of the shots. A straight close combat attack is dodged continuously, regardless of cover. 

Then, there is no clear indication on what makes your shooting chance go up. You move to another angle free from enemy's cover, closer, and your shooting percentage go down, what?! You move up close to their face to deliver a close combat attack, and your hit chance still doesn't go up. It is also not clear what obscures your line of sight, you can literally shoot pass cars, next you can shoot pass a pile of pipes, another you can't shoot pass a pile of pipes. So the strategic layer is kinda a mess. 

Your chances of shooting someone in cover is actually higher than your chances of shooting someone in the open, what's the logic in this? Another garbage design.

The mechanics behind it is more RPG than strategy. In Xcom2, while yes your characters can level up and get stronger, it's not that significantly stronger, you can still clear endgame level with recruits. Here it's powercreep, no amount of strategy will make a lvl 8 unit beat a lvl 18 unit.

[h1]UI [/h1]
The UI is crap, too messy, and useless for the information that you happen to want to find out. They tell you the state of the units "in faith/motivated etc" then when you want to know what it does....no info. There's an arrow up beside that unit, what does it mean? no info. Meanwhile it has a lot of crap like blunt resistance %, slash resistance %, while you don't even know what category enemies' attacks fall on, and neither can you prepare for it. Yeah, so enemies with swords is slash resistance obviously, and bats is blunt resistance but so what? It's not like you can come to a fight predicting what they bring and it's not like their damage makes a ton of difference, all you know is that it's close combat and you should get some distance. 
Multiple items with same name sports different stats, this is another terrible design choice. 

[h1]CONCLUSION [/h1]
I could go on, but I don't want to make this review sound too negative. The developers should really spend some time streamlining a lot of things, hell, even copying xcom2 system 1 to 1 is better, especially for learning why it works so well. There's a lot of good premise here, but at the current stage, it's mess of ideas and executions. Buy it only ON SALE.
developer_response:
Thank you for leaving us a good review despite many shortcomings. If we weren't a small independent game development team, we would definitely get bad reviews. In fact, our scale of development cannot be a reference for evaluation when the user has paid for the game. Nevertheless, thank you for making the development team move forward with a good evaluation.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034065420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8827, 'last_played': 1693498238}
review:
Holy crap. What can I say. This is a HARD RECOMMEND. It is a good game, and its only flaw is that some of the items descriptions has some small translation flaws that become unnoticeable over time.

It's pretty much Manwha (Korean) XCOM with more forgiving death mechanics (no permadeath) and fights where you are battling dozens of enemies while exploring a cyberpunk sprawl. Every character you control is named and has their own classes (and prestige classes), there's an almost Final Fantasy Tactics Side Powers / D&D 3.5 feat chain system (except you don't have to buy your feats a wedding ring and can retrain at any time) which allows you to do ridiculous passive power combos that let you feel incredibly powerful. BUT the enemies all work under the same mechanics you do, and have their OWN builds. 

it's like someone grabbed a really really good korean cell phone game (the overly complex ones with all the gacha) and then got rid of all the gacha

Do you like XCOM? Get this
Do you like Weeb Stuff? Get this
Do you like Final Fantasy Tactics? Get this
Do you like a subtly anti-establishment plotline that slowly unfurls over time and shows the struggles of law enforcement within a deeply corrupt political system that encourages the sort of dangerous carelssness that puts common people at risk? Get this.
developer_response:
I'm starting to wonder if Troubleshooter is really the game that fits what you're referring to. But you've already left us a tremendously good review and it seems strange that we're asking you to revise this review because it's burdensome. Therefore, there is no other way now. The only way is for us to make Troubleshooter fit in with what you mention so that other gamers can agree with your review.

That, of course, will not happen at any moment. We've just made the first game and we may have to make more great games in the future. We will continue to produce games. Please watch how we grow with the game.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994180822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11663, 'last_played': 1608232521}
review: Underrated game. Character powers are diverse and will require a solid tactical plan to win battles. Good to excellent turn based combat, decent visuals, significant grind for materials, deep crafting system for gear and attribute improvement. interesting set pieces that suffer a bit from poor translation. RNG can be frustrating but mostly does fit the world given that most of your characters are young and inexperienced. Fair replay value.
developer_response:
I felt something strange while reading your review. And I found the cause.

" interesting set pieces that suffer a bit from poor translation "

You're right. The translation we provide has been really problematic and a lot of updates have been applied since then, but there are still some unclear parts. Please feel free to tell the development team if you see this. The development team won't miss your voice.

Thank you for this review.

review: 这是我开的第三个档，前两个都是因为有别的事中途就没玩了。总体是非常推荐的，我也是因为出新DLC了才重新开档，原价入DLC希望能支持下制作组吧。希望制作组可以简化一下制作，制作材料太多了，非常麻烦，个人觉得可以像制作天赋一样出个一起研究就更好了，可以清晰的看到自己还缺什么材料。还有希望制作组能平衡一下以前角色的能力，不要等角色多了之前老角色被边缘化，毕竟一路过来还是对老角色有很深的感情的，比如阿尔伯斯就是我最喜欢的角色
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

均匀匹配角色战斗能力的工作可能会持续到我们完成该游戏的更新为止。 我们将进一步加强每个角色的个性，而不是让所有角色的战斗能力保持一致。

在单品制作上，以后会登记更高的单品。 只是制作它的方式和现在不会有太大的不同。 现在防止道具制作方式再复杂化，以后会想办法简化。

author: {'steamid': '76561198281600029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1667764432}
review:
During the first "hard" mission, Sion decided to get oneshot by some kind of fire-type enemy and die from full hp, so I don't know what to think of this. Why does this entitled noble have no HP despite the fact that he eats 3 times as much as a normal person?
https://i.imgur.com/w3g2ZKG.png
Did another run. Characters decide to miss all their attacks, even attacking from flanks, melee attackers miss point blank hits. New character missed 4 of her 4 attacks as she ran into combat despite me telling her to cut off the enemy's escape.
Nothing feels better than to surround the enemy in a dead-end, only to have the main character (who missed with his sword) get oneshot by a 700 crit damage skill and die.
The game allows enemies to crit for 700 damage when your entire team only has 500 hp, and if a single named character is knocked out the entire mission fails.
Even in xcom legend ironman, if I make a stupid "mistake" (not really mistake, but you know how it's possible to miss point blank shots?), at most a single character dies. I don't lose the entire mission.
developer_response:
First of all, we're sorry to offend you. 

Steam's game discussion will bring more solutions. Most people who enjoy our game have given good advice to people who feel unreasonable like you.

In steam' discussion of our game, players range from players who have played XCOM to users who have played XCOM for thousands of hours. They will give you advice to turn the absurdity you feel into pleasure. You have to enjoy the game in a balance that suits you. In fact, users who are already familiar with it turn on all difficulty settings and there are many people who easily clear the hardest difficulty without ever dying.

In our view, you are so familiar with the XCOM method that you haven't understand the new method when you enjoy the new game. XCOM's fighting style and strategy are largely unhelpful to our game. Everything becomes easier only when you learn how to solve our game. This is what most users say. And our game method gives us a completely different pleasure than XCOM. We hope it will be a good experience for you.

Have a good day! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561199192030397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1670773483}
review: 除了语音不能更改只能听棒子的，其他作的都不错
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

支持更多的语言语音是一次愉快的体验。对此，开发组的想法也是一样。但是对于像我们这样的小独立开发组来说，这是一件非常不容易的事情。我们是开发专业的队伍，没有外语专家。因此从与配音演员联系开始，很难判断配音演员的演技是否是我们所希望的。

为了解决这个问题，需要和当地的游戏发行公司签订合约进行工作，但是像我们这样对小公司的游戏感兴趣的游戏发行公司几乎没有。最终开发组认为，现在只有更加集中于我们能做的事情。我认为，如果能够坚持不懈地做下去，总有一天机会会来的。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198278516797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1674395959}
review:
엔딩보고 평가 수정합니다. 

이 게임은 엔딩이 미완성입니다. 시즌제라 기승전결의 스토리를 기대하시면 실망하실수 있습니다. 영화로 치면 팝콘 사서 들어가서 앉아서 보는데 영화 한 20분 진행되다가 엔딩 로고 나오고 끝나는 기분입니다. 완결된 스토리를 원하시면 구입을 고민하시길 바랍니다. 이후에 추가 게임이 나와서 스토리가 완결된 후에 구입하시는것도 좋은 방법일거 같습니다.

추가로 트레일러랑 일러스트 디자인 보고 기대했는데 별로네요. 

문제점은 우선 초반부가 지루합니다. 후반가면 괜찮아진다는 소리도 있는데 공통적으로 지루한 초반부 통과하는데에는 아무런 위로가 안되네요. 예를 들어, 2-1 미션 같은 경우는 초반 광역기는 부족한데 적은 아군의 몇 배 이상 나오기 때문에 전투가 늘어져서 게임이 무척 피로해집니다.

추가로  그런 적이 많은 문제를  무개성한 경찰 NPC를 플레이어한테 쥐어줌으로서 해결합니다. 하지만 경찰 병력이 턴을 잡아먹어서 안그래도 지루한 전투가 더 늘어져 더더욱 지루해집니다. 난이도는 낮은 난이도로 낮추면 어렵지는 않으나 지루함은 없어지지 않네요. 

그리고 특성 시스템은 재미는 있는데 너무 파밍 노가다를 강요합니다. 원하는 특성이 나올 확률이 1~2% 언저리 던데 이거 하나얻자고 재미없는 전투를 강요하네요. 전투도 한두번이면 그나마 재미를 느끼는데 이게 단순한 노동을 위한 전투가 되니 지루함과 흥미가 떨어지네요. 

그리고 권장사양 이상의 사양을 맞춰는데도 심심하면 게임이 프리징이 걸리네요. 겜 하다보면 프리징이 심심하면 걸려서 몇분동안 플레이가 불가능합니다. 이렇게 프리징이 걸리다보니 게임의 흐름이 깨져 지루함을 더욱 느끼는거 같습니다.
developer_response:
최근의 게임 트렌드는 빠른 게임 접근성과 게임의 전체 컨텐츠에 대한 빠른 접근을 요구하고 있습니다. 그에 반해 트러블슈터는 이전의 싱글 플레이 RPG의 문법을 따르고 있습니다. 이러한 문법이 무조건 지루함을 동반하는 것은 아닙니다. 다만 저희의 설익은 문법 해석이 글쓴분에게는 좋지 못한 경험을 준 것 같아 매우 아쉽습니다. 

저희는 여전히 게임을 업데이트 및 최적화 하고 있습니다. 당신이 트러블슈터를 다시 찾을 때는 지금보다 더 나은 모습이 되도록 노력하겠습니다.

추가적으로 전투 불능으로 만든 적에게 획득하지 못한 특성이 있는 경우, 특성 획득 확률과 무관하게 먼저 획득 되는 보너스가 있습니다!

또한 회사 특성 중에 특성 획득 확률을 올려주는 회사 특성을 이용하시고, "일격 필살"(적을 만피에서 한번에 죽이기), "오버킬"(적을 죽일때 적의 체력 30%를 초과하는 오버 데미지로 죽이기) 을 이용하시면 각각 특성 획득 확률이 2배씩 증가합니다!

이런 부분을 이용하시면 특성 획득이 원활하게 진행되실 거에요! 

또한 그래도 운이 없어 안 얻어지실 경우에는 해당 몬스터의 정보를 100%획득하시면, 트러블메이커에서 보상으로 해당 적의 모든 특성 정보를 획득할 수 있습니다!

보스 몬스터의 경우, 25의 정보 경험치가 필요하는 데 오버킬, 일격필살 등 각종 보너스를 이용하거나 자홍거리 "정보상" 정책을 활용하시면 금새 정보를 획득하실 수 있습니다!

솔직한 평가 감사합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038650947', 'num_games_owned': 1552, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1673306516}
review: This game is absolutely huge and a joy to play. It's easily my favorite XCOM-like and has way more ways to develop your characters. The worldbuilding is great too and has so far felt like a silver-age comic book in all the best ways. The English localization is iffy and can have characters sounding awkward, but you'll be able to understand the story regardless. It's the only flaw I have with the game and considering how big it clearly is, the immense quality of the gameplay systems, and the fact it's being sold for so cheap, it's a flaw that I can easily look past. Of all the games I've ever played, this is the one I feel I underpaid for the most. Its price is a steal even when it isn't on sale. I just can't wait to play more of it, because with only 10 hours played, I can tell I've only scratched the surface.
developer_response:
We also want t"Troubleshooter world" to reach you with another story like DC and Marvel, which were born in a silver-age comic book. Although we are a small team, we'll do our best to deliver a better story as you show interest in our game.

In that respect, we apologize a lot for not providing the perfect translation. If the team has financial leeway, We'll definitely improve this part. And we'll do our best to continue the pleasant experience you are looking forward to now.

Thank you for playing our game! Have a good day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034557833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6859, 'last_played': 1668901834}
review:
These koreans devs managed to figure out gacha and stamina systems are not fun. If only for that I would recommend this game.

As for the gameplay, its amazing. Its pretty clear these guys tactics and spreadsheet min-maxing. Hovering over hitrates will give you a breakdown, and you can speed up the game massively so lategame fights arent a drag.
Min-maxing also is smooth and fun. Your characters have 2 advanced classes, which can range from "do you want more offensive or defensive specialization" to two completely different playstyles (think battlemage versus black mage). There is gear with plenty of stats to be found and crafted. 
Then there is the mastery system. There are limited slots and points which you can use to plug in special powers like +5% hit chance to extra damage the further away the target is. If you combine 4 specific masteries you get a mastery set that gives even more bonuses. The system even shows you the ones you can get if you have 3 of the 4 masteries already slotted in. If you learn the system you can make absolute monsters, and you can build anything from a supertank to a glass cannon. This system definitely is the high point of the game and something I wish other games would copy.
Just for good measure the game also has a crafting system, a complex drone system (made for just 1 character) a complex pet system (made for just 1 character, and only one advanced class really uses them a lot) a bond system, plenty of difficulty and challenge options. Optional bosses the game rewards you for killing. The list is endless. All of this just to support an excellent strategy game.

For the cons I would say that it starts out slow. You only get 2 dudes, and the mastery system starts to open up just as you get more guys. The amount of modifiers can also be overwhelming. Some systems can feel like 'if you move 5 spaces while its raining at night and then hit someone with the center of your AOE attack while another teammember is next to you you get 50% more crit damage'. Sometimes I rebuild some characters and then forget what they could do. So suddenly i get 5 popups when I kill a dude. The mastery system lategame can also feel a bit cluttered as you have to use a bunch of masteries that just give you more space to place masteries.
developer_response:
Since we are also Koreans, we fully understand the fun and financial advantages of Gacha and stamina system. In fact, most of our teammember had developed such game in previous company. :D

The reason why we're not interested in those elements is because people like you come to our game. We didn't have to pay attention to those things as the positive reviews like your review attract another new players in our game. If you didn't come to our game, we couldn't keep making this game.

Now we really wfocus on better SRPG. 
We'll do our best to deliver you the joy that the turn-based game called SRPG can give you.

Thank you so much for playing our game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198365255137', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13661, 'last_played': 1701179879}
review: 加油吧，希望能优化一下天赋表，至少能知道自己需要的是什么天赋对吧
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

可以说天赋是游戏的核心系统，如何充分利用它决定游戏的乐趣。因此，我们也想最大限度地帮助玩家使用该系统。 但是，如果我们提出最适合角色的天赋，它可能会对玩家的自由度产生不良影响。所以我们要营造玩家之间可以自由讨论和共享的环境。 所以创建的系统之一就是天赋版共享系统。今后，我们将采取一切方法，直到更多的人能够更自由地使用天赋版。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004696017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12832, 'last_played': 1667695987}
review:
I usually don't write reviews, but I really wanted to point out that this is a "FANTASTIC~" game by "FANTASTIC~" developers.
I love tactical SRPG games, and my first love was Fire Emblem. While this game is much closer to the XCOM series than FE in terms of gameplay, it has the focus on characters that I really enjoy in FE games from a story POV.

Yes, this game is very long, even if you rush the story without bothering with the side missions. But I think that ultimately is a good thing, because a lot of that time is spent building up relationships between characters and setting up future plot points that make it all worth it in the end. It gets you more invested in the story, and you grow to love the characters because of that.

By the way, the translations are not as bad as a lot of people say. It definitely needs a lot of work, but it is serviceable, and you will understand everything that is going on. I know that they are constantly improving the translations, too.

The mastery (passive abilities) system in this game is one of the highlights. When you are not fighting "VILLAINS!!," you'll find yourself at your home base, trying to min-max your characters with masteries, and it is honestly just as fun as the actual combat parts. There are so many masteries that even if you get ten different players using the same character with the same class, that character would most likely come out vastly different. Not to mention you are using about ten different characters, so the team you end up with may most likely end up being one of a kind in the entire population of this game's playerbase.

If you are into games with amazing graphics, however, this game won't impress you. But keep in mind that this is an indie title, and the maps are sometimes gigantic. I think the developers decided to sacrifice graphics for a smoother frame rate. I do wish it was better, though. Maybe for Troubleshooter 2? :D

The music is also very good. Makes you feel all the right emotions in key story portions, and that's what's important for a soundtrack.

Dandylion팀 수고하세요!
developer_response:
During we read a your long review, we're so happy to see what we made this game for and what we wanted to give it to you.

And we wanted to bring you the stories of characters in Troubleshooter world. we're glad the story was delivered without boredom, and we're happy for loving our characters.

I always feel sorry for the part we couldn't provide perfectly regarding the translation. As the story is long and there are many texts, the translation is underway without much cost, but I will do my best to provide proper translation when I have time in the future.

Thank you for giving us the courage to continue to develop this game.

Have a nice week! :D

review: This game blew me away! If you enjoy Xcom give this a chance you wont regret it. Translation is a bit off but you wont be lost in the story. Ending end with so many unanswered questions but luckily the devs are releasing updates that adds more. Great game give it a try you'll fall in love

author: {'steamid': '76561198394985182', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 12341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1697178414}
review:
完成度高、内容丰富+++
与之对应显得或许有些过于复杂的系统-
标准的二次元画面&故事+
地图大、敌人多，以及本来战棋游戏的节奏就慢，一局时间比较长，甚至可以说是冗长--
核心玩法类似XCOM，个人并不太喜欢这种远距离+命中率影响过大的战棋模式，虽然本作做了改良-
初见评分  7.7/10

设置所有动画最高速度可以稍微缓解一局时长过长的问题，但最高难度动不动就是40+敌人以及10+中立角色，即便是最高速都经常一场30min+，一些主线任务还是2-3场连战，非常离谱
随着角色慢慢加入，天赋、羁绊等等系统逐渐起到作用后，游戏体验有明显改善。不过这个过程显得有些过于漫长，差不多要10h左右的队伍无联动、无构筑、无打法的体验后，才慢慢步入正轨，我想大概不少缺乏耐心的玩家在此之前就已经放弃了
另外这游戏音乐翻来覆去就那么几首，属实有点腻了
中期评分  7.9/10
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

我认为这是一个很好的机会，让我们了解我们制作游戏的第一印象是如何被接受的，并暗示了很多东西。 我想要您，请慢慢把游戏玩完。 很多故事和很多同事都在等你。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198977655717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 69918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33615, 'last_played': 1700040489}
review: 我对着这款游戏非常满意，或者说这是非常适合我本人的一款游戏，无论是游戏模式还是天赋搭配的创意。唯一的问题大概就是开发者为什么不能把人物模型做的再美型一点，否则你们开发新服装干什么呢？
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

我认为 '人物模型' 要想得到好评，必须满足两个条件之一。一是投入大量人力和时间，创造出符合大型开发公司水平的质量，二是创造出与其他游戏明确区分的独特风格。遗憾的是，我们的 '人物模型' 没有满足这两个条件中的任何一个。我们是独立游戏开发团队，不接受外来投资。 因此，第一种方法几乎不可能实现。 那么我们剩下的选择只有第二种方法，我们的发展实力还不够，在这方面没有取得大的进展。 但是只要我们继续更新这个游戏，我们就不会停止努力去改进它。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198299713802', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 22058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1706153390}
review:
好玩是真好玩，但是体验也是真的闹心。
中文翻译不能说是闹心，只能说是等于没有。
各种奇奇怪怪的语法，给我的感觉是好像是在看一部明明很好冲却让人完全冲不起来的韩漫本子，出戏，严重出戏，以至于我花在理解对白上的精力远远大于了研究天赋的精力。
给出了推荐，但很勉强。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

对不起，没能好好向你传达游戏的重要部分之一的故事。 尽管如此，您还是给我们留下了好评，这意味着要进一步改善中文翻译。 只要我们更新这款游戏，中文翻译也会不断更新。

啊，游戏正式开始之前，请确认环境设置中的各种选项。包括加快游戏速度的功能(【快进队友行动】，【快进队友外的行动】)，提供利用多种设置舒适享受游戏的方法。

author: {'steamid': '76561198868039834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 23339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9013, 'last_played': 1705346102}
review:
150 hours of wonderful experience, thank you to the great developers for delivering this awesome game. Want to share some feedback

Pro:
1. Combat in general is very good, XCOM style and strategy does matter.
2. Some characters have good story development, mostly the Alleys, some antagonists too such as Hanson.
3. The mastery set is really fun to work with, different combination and variation is totally worth spending time with.

Suggestions:
1. Main character story is missing, there's not much story about Albus, almost feel like he's not needed.
2. A little too much grinding for materials.
3. Side quests are not interesting at all.
4. IMPORTANT, the combat has an issue with line of side for ranged attack and blast radius for area attacks. Characters can simply shoot through walls and structures all the time even they can't even see the enemy, but actions that are supposed to be doable such as throwing grenades or shooting through windows can't be done because there's no vision, this should be fixed. And certain area attacks should be blocked by structures or obstacles, for example the wind grenade, target behind wall should not be affected by explosion on the other side of the wall.
5. Minor, if would be more fun and realistic if friendly fire is added, such as missing a shot and it accidentally hurt an ally.

After all it's a great game and looking forward to new content.
developer_response:
1.
The story of the game is led by new characters. As a result, Albus' story is talked about at the beginning of the game, and after the middle, it feels far from the center of the game. Of course, Albus is indirectly involved in every case, but I think it's very insignificant for the main character. The development team agrees with this, but we can't change the story that's already in the past now. Through future stories, we will make sure that the story of Albus is illuminated as much as the new character.

2.
This is what happened when we introduced the elements of JRPG into the game. Rather than simply eliminating grinding, we will improve it so that gamers can get the production materials in the way they want through various channels.

3.
I think the existence of side quests is important. We wanted to lower the role of grinding mentioned in 2 through the side quests. In this process, we focused too much on the results, so I think the process was somewhat mechanically constructed.

4.
It's a loophole in our battle formula. Thank you for letting us know that. However, all the map designs and abilities' have been designed according to the existing battle formula. If you change it now, all existing things will be affected. The problem is clear but difficult to fix easily. I think we should listen to more gamers on this issue.

5.
The lesson we've learned so far is that gamers are very sensitive to things that go beyond their strategy when playing genre SRPG. And even more so when it comes to winning or losing a mission or the death of a character. That's why I'm excluding the element of 'accidentally' that you mentioned as much as possible.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389008583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11147, 'last_played': 1699772504}
review: 本笨比战棋类玩得很少，就玩过漫野奇谭还有火纹风花雪月，说实话我觉得这游戏的性价比和玩法完全比得上风花雪月，在天赋搭配等玩法上甚至更丰富，每个角色都很有趣并不模板化，不会说一眼就能看出角色标签之类的剧情猜个八九不离十，碎片化的信息让玩家有很多可以想象和进行讨论的空间（你们的关系网真的很复杂哎），打完本体之后意犹未尽，立刻购入了dlc美术集和ost，企图从中间寻找更多有趣的细节。真的很就没玩到过这么让我上头的游戏了，今后也会继续支持，买爆买爆！
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

我们的游戏给你留下了战棋类的好印象，这对我们来说真是个好消息。 我们现在是第一家推出游戏的公司，这种类型真的有很多很棒的游戏。 （您提到的火纹风花雪月也是非常有趣的游戏。）我们也会继续开发游戏，努力成为您在经历其他战棋类时能够想到的公司。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043003234', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 102, 'playtime_at_review': 3251, 'last_played': 1712265598}
review:
A fun Xcom/FF tactics style game with superpowers, guns and swords. 
Pro: It's fun, lots of skill customisation.
Con: Game is pretty long, plot progression meanders, customisation can need redoing for every character with every level up, and it can be very grindy if you want to craft gear.
developer_response:

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067037428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 16316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15541, 'last_played': 1702237207}
review:
Troubleshooter is one of the best games I've ever played, beautifully told story with many unique heroes and enemies.
There are many varied missions in different locations.
Both story missions and side missions that you can play for quests.
There is also an extensive crafting system and mastery system with which you can improve your heroes with equipment and skill sets. This will lead you to have fun discovering new Masterys and better items/materials.

In general you can say that both the gameplay and the systems in the background are very solid.
Anyway I'm having a lot of fun with the game although I haven't played much turnbased games and you really get a lot for the price.
developer_response:
" Anyway I'm having a lot of fun with the game although I haven't played much turnbased games "

I think the recent game trend is that access to games is becoming fast and very instantiated. In this sense, Troubleshooter is the opposite of that. Nevertheless, it is really good news for us that Troubleshooter made a good impression on you about turn-based game.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013001090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8969, 'last_played': 1703350414}
review:
I like the art and the music, game has a nice ambience to it. Story is interesting, many different actors in the plot going about their own agenda; characters are varied and nuanced. Even the bad guys have their side of the tale fleshed out. This is some good storytelling.

Characters can be spec-ed in different ways, and I like that it's not too grindy. The optional missions are much tougher, and offer more for players who want more. Overall, I enjoyed Troubleshooter, and I feel that it was well worth my money and time spent.
developer_response:
I'm glad Troubleshooter didn't waste your precious time and money. The development team will continue to research and realize ways to further develop what you have rated as a good factor in our game. We will continue to improve the game not only in your last time but also in the future until Troubleshooter can be with you.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334833934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 8707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6420, 'last_played': 1668005241}
review:
The bad:
- English translation could be better
- Crafting is somewhat tedious and cumbersome, should be made more practical like the mastery research UI where you can just research(made) all the prerequisites material from the same page

Undecided:
- Story is interesting, but left a lot unresolved, probably for future DLC and sequels
- Graphic looks like a PS3 or mobile games

The good:

- A large library of passive skills (mastery) adds a lot of depth to the gameplay.
- XCOM-like, but with more emphasis on melee combat
developer_response:
'The bad' and 'Undecided' are tasks that we must solve through future updates and follow-up works. Nevertheless, you left us a good review. We will not stop developing the game so that 'The bad' and 'Undecided' you mentioned can belong to 'The good'.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561199229397264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1683497020}
review: Deep game mechanics you can really sink your teeth into. Combats are challenging with adjustable difficulty which allows you to tailor the level of encounter you can handle. The game is a combination of Jagged Alliance franchise with X-COM II-like combat encounter. The story is a interesting, but writing is meh. But hey, this is SRPG. Go read a good book if you're after a really good well-written story. Short of that, play a good CRPG.
developer_response:
The story of the game is the most important element of the game that we think of. Nevertheless, your failing grade on that suggests a lot to us. All team members will have time to reflect on the fundamental causes and solutions of this.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976476873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3539, 'last_played': 1684891080}
review:
I'm 50 hours in and this is the game that has finally dethroned both XCOM and FF:Tactics for me. FF:T I played when it was released and nothing has quite topped it yet though many are great. TROUBLESHOOTER: Abandoned Children, though? If it continues this way up until the end, this will be an easy 10 out of 10 for me. 

It hits so many perfect notes to me. The way the translation is a little wonky in a way that significantly adds to the charm. The graphics aren't great but the animations more than make up for it. Your characters look bad ass and your team starts to evolve into something you never thought it could. System after system get added throughout the game and they all blend well thus far, nothing is overwhelming at the rate at which they introduce it but it's A LOT.  The capacity for character customization through different mastery sets is astounding and I'm always finding new ways to make my characters do unexpected things. And the story? I'm surprisingly hooked, I love it. Music? Don't get me started, it is fantastic and allows you to customize the music you hear for multiple different scenarios if you wish. For me, the typical battle music became a bit boring in comparison to most other game tracks.

Please give this game a try if you like tactics RPGs with some depth. It starts great- like a typical TRPG. Eventually, in my opinion, it gradually opens up into a masterpiece.
developer_response:
XCOM and FFT have always been mentioned since we first designed Troubleshooter. XCOM inspired us with a basic combat system that was recognized by many, and FFT informed us of the elements of SRPG. We're trying to create a game that feels different from these games, rather than going beyond them.

Your praise made the development team dance, but on the other hand, it was an opportunity to reflect on ourselves.

' Do we really deserve this praise? '

But I don't think we can avoid or reject these compliments. Rather, I think the only way now is to become a development team worthy of these compliments and prove it through good games.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069827109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 16707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8229, 'last_played': 1669295851}
review:
A charming Xcom-like with lots of story and dialogue. There are preset characters you earn throughout the story, each with 2 classes to choose from and a ton of room for build diversity. Customizing the skills of each character is done using Masteries earned from your class, missions, or from defeating enemies that use them.

Most of the characters feel quite unique in personality and gameplay.

The story feels fairly long.

One character can [spoiler] collect the wildlife you come into conflict with occasionally and train them with almost as much flexibility as your characters.[/spoiler] 

My only real complaint is how long some of the missions take. with 8 characters and a few extra pawns to control, the missions can last longer than i would prefer.
developer_response:
Thank you for mentioning the advantages of Troubleshooter a lot. And the weakness you mentioned is also our weakness. Basically, games of this genre require more time than games of other genres. That is why we need to prepare various devices to overcome this. It's true that we've been somewhat unprepared in this respect. 

We've focused on too many large-scale battles so far. We will do our best to show you the new aspects of the battle through the new DLC.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092343806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 5491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5491, 'last_played': 1666288032}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120997803', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 10990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1691681255}
review:
[i]Приятно видеть новые лица. Даже полускрытые текстильными масками лица мужиков средних лет.[/i]

[quote=] Впервые сталкиваетесь с『[b]Troubleshooter[/b]』? Могу познакомить вас.[/quote]

 Игра, под которой размещён этот обзор, сочетает черты пошаговых тактик новой волны с конструктором билдов из корейских RPG, со спрайтами современных новелл и с роликами из стратегий нулевых в сеттинге, отдалённо напоминающем RWBY. Тем не менее, здесь не будет ни『momento mori』XCOM, ни создания своего персонажа, как в Shadowrun, ни транзакций для разблокировки новых абилок. 

[quote=] I don't think that the absence of all these things makes the game worse, in fact.. [/quote]

Вместо всего этого будет пушечный залп плотно сцепленной с геймплеем историей, проносящейся в россыпи самых разных персонажей над необъятным миром, расширяющимся тем больше, чем дальше улетает ядро. 

[quote=] Игра кажется легковесной, но только прохождение основной компании займёт около 160 часов. [/quote]

Здесь так много миссий, где вместо управления [strike]'вашей'[/strike] командой Альбуса, вы становитесь частью стремительно меняющейся ситуации, перехватывая частичный контроль то над одним, то над другими персонажами, определяя их решении и меняя и саму миссию, и своё виденье этих персонажей в процессе. 

[quote=] Представьте, что в диалоге вы выбираете реплики только что встреченного незнакомца.[/quote]

И виденье является здесь ключевым словом. 
[spoiler] [i]- Я помню, как тогда, на кладбище, [strike], .,....[/strike] окрикнула  [strike]. ....[/strike], будто призывая отойти и не рисковаться своей жизнью понапрасну. Она стояла там, молча, не пытаясь ни укрыться, ни вмешаться, просто наблюдая со сдержанным неодобрением. Это напоминало её первую встречу с  [strike]. .....[/strike] Когда всё закончилось, она лишь отметила "Ты сильнее, чем я думала". Попрощавшись, она вышла с кладбища, на вопрос [strike].....,...[/strike] ответив коротко "Мы больше не встретимся". Будто поняла что-то, что отняло у неё всякий интерес к новой подруге.[/i][/spoiler]
Многим персонажам недостаёт своих моделек и спрайтов, но вот колорита им хватает всегда. Проследив за каким-нибудь бандитом средней руки, можно увидеть и былинные подвиги, и не менее былинные провалы. И это потрясающе.

[quote=] За поступками не перестаёшь видеть людей.[/quote]

Из-за этого здесь много запоминающихся миссий. Даже их названия, это не пустой звук. 
"[b]Никогда не сдавайся[/b]" - "[b]Однажды на Пурпурной улице[/b]" - "[b]Бесконечный дождь[/b]" - "[b]Сделать шаг назад...[/b]" -  "[b]Расставания день всегда печальный...[/b]" - "[b]Личная гордость[/b]" - "[b]На сегодня...[/b]"

[quote=] Вариативность? Я скажу... "Да, но нет." [/quote]

Геймплей - это важно. Местный конструктор билдов сложный и интересный. Её используют все существа в игре, даже машины. Исходя из законов: "Когда всё имба - ничто не имба" и "На каждую имбу найдётся контра", любой рабочий билд будет аннигилировать всё в пределах экрана, пока не наткнётся на свою прямую контру. 

[quote=] У большинства моих сотрудников до сих пор нет выверенного билда. [/quote]

Враги『a little dummu』и действуют обособленно друг от друга, но это лишь небольшая проблема. Сложность игры будет повышаться медленно, но неуклонно.

[quote=] Until the last day... not easy at all.[/quote]

Она содержит множество механик, кажущихся очевидными при первом знакомстве, но работающих в непривычном ключе. Как модификаторы урона, или сопротивления к нему.

К счастью, у 『Troubleshooter』крайне дружелюбные разработчики. 

[quote=] Их часто видно в обсуждениях. [/quote]

Благодаря им, игра имеет встроенную энциклопедия, где можно почитать про мир и его механики, в музыкальный автомат загружен полный OST, а в меню можно просмотреть не только галерею артов, но и пропущенные сцены. Не говоря о том, что любую миссию в игре можно переиграть, получив трофейное имущество и узнав о том, как всё могло повернуться в ином случае.

В ходе обучения вас мягко познакомят со многими, но не всеми основами игры. Если не хотите всю игру собирать Forestallment, то лучше изучите управление, чтобы строить маршрут поклеточно.

[quote=] Просто читайте подсказки и заглядывайте в Троблопедию. [/quote]

То, что перевод на английский осуществляют сами разработчики, делают его немного спутанным, но очень артистичным. Мне сложно представить Troubleshooter без этих 『Prophecy』『The First Spoon』и, конечно же,『hard work』. . . На русский переведена большая часть основных миссий, но не вся, так что лучше держать переводчик под рукой.

Игра продолжает развиваться, патчи, правки баланса происходят чуть ли не каждый день. Уже вышло два больших дополнения, а сколько ещё их будет. Впрочем, это уже фантастическая игра, actually.

[quote=] Мне не хватает момента, когда стихает музыка и остаётся только стук дождя. [/quote]

[quote=] Ваш любимый тунец.[/quote]
developer_response:
No one in the development team knows the Russian so I used the Google Translation to understands your review. I ask for your understanding.

"Тем не менее, здесь не будет ни『momento mori』XCOM, ни создания своего персонажа, как в Shadowrun, ни транзакций для разблокировки новых абилок."

The way you can create your own characters is a task that requires a lot of manpower and time. (I'm in awe of all the games that implemented this feature.) But we didn't have enough resources to implement it all. (That's why low-level 3D modeling is also the case.) But this is the limitation of the development team, and I couldn't ask the gamers to understand this. So we decided to take advantage of this, and we made the story centered on one main character the most important element of the game. This can't be the perfect alternative to not being able to set up a character at will, but I think we've succeeded in at least making the function look like an additional one.

The linear flow of the story with the predetermined protagonist can make gamers feel pressured without giving them a choice. That's why we wanted to make it possible for gamers to decide a lot of things in other areas. But these choices didn't make such a big difference except for masteries, so we're thinking about ways to improve this.

( * I didn't understand what you hid in the middle. Could not copy and paste hidden content into translator... )

Masteries are key factors in determining the outcome of a battle. A good combination of attributes allows me to overcome this situation no matter how many enemies I have and how little equipment I have, but a bad combination of masteries makes the game difficult no matter how good a gamer uses a strategy. That's why we're thinking about how to use this system in a deeper and more diverse way.

Features like Gallery, Help, and Jukebox were features that didn't exist when the game was first released. But we've been asked to do these functions through the game community and we've just implemented them implemented. We implemented the functionality, but all the designs were led by gamers and communities.

We have a Russian translation team that we have been working with for a long time. They are always passionately helping us translate our games for a long time. I would like to take this opportunity to thank the translation team.

Thank you for this review.
