author: {'steamid': '76561198378918421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6414, 'last_played': 1701166474}
review:
재밌게 플레이 했습니다.
다만 로딩이 너무 길어서 몰입도가 깨지네요
developer_response:
추석 연휴 즐겁게 보내셨나요?

연휴 기간 팀 전원 고향을 다녀오느라 답변이 늦어 죄송합니다!
그리고 저희 게임을 즐겨주셔서 진심으로 감사드립니다!

로딩 부분은 근본적으로 저희 개발 역량 부족입니다. 

현재 HDD에 설치되거나 남은 용량이 부족한 SSD에 깔린 경우, 로딩이 현저히 느려질 수 있습니다. 만약 위의 경우라면 조금 용량이 여유가 있는 SSD로 설치하시면 로딩이 조금은 빨라지실 것이라고 생각합니다. (이미 사용하고 계신다면 진심으로 죄송합니다. ㅠㅠ) 장기적으로 이런 개발 부분에서 조금 더 좋은 경험을 드릴 수 있는 게임이 되도록 꾸준히 개선해 보도록 하겠습니다!

즐거운 한 주 되세요!  즐겨주셔서 감사합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983820672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 25223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23522, 'last_played': 1668662217}
review:
I went in expecting a short but fun twenty-something chapter TBS-RPG with a compact story as is usually the case. They are never long.

Instead, I got a much deeper layered storyline and gameplay and complexities I never expected. Truly a delight. 

The setting is quite interesting and they really spend time getting into the details of how and why things are as they are, which is easy enough to accept at face value were this a shorter story, but things get more involved as the plot continues. Furthermore, the character design and aesthetics are great by themselves, but what's more impressive is how much time they spend on understanding each character. More so than most RPGs short of say, series like Persona.

The translation is a bit rough at some points, if they could get an editor to go through all the dialogue in the future that'd be a huge plus, but the heart of the characters shine through regardless. More importantly, they solved a pet peeve I have with TBS-RPGS - they translated the sound bites/battle quotes/one liners, not just the main story text. That sounds like nothing, but those snippets really help define the characters.  Understanding what they're saying there really helps with the feel. From what I can tell, basically every voice line is translated (except maybe I think the one line in end-game win screens where there is VO showing the stats). I think it'd benefit other games to take a lesson from Troubleshooter and translate the small VO stuff to the language of the user.

In any case, there are a lot of options, a lot of interesting characters, and a lot of depth. For those really into tactics you can really customize out your abilities and come up with some really fun combos. Each character has an ability set you can pick a couple from so you can get a loadout you are comfortable with. They also are really good at making sure story missions include most of the characters, so you don't run into the issue with characters being sidelined as you have to pick a few favorites. A few missions will exclude one or two for narrative reasons to help change things up, and there are also personal stories that focus on one or two characters that may feature unexpected NPC allies or some of the team showing up later.

And while I'm more than a bit tired of the main/initial protagonist being "Young Guy With Sword," they do a good job of making him a character I care about and like. And just as importantly, give the spotlight to the other characters so it feels like every character's story is important, much like say Final Fantasy 6 with an ensemble cast.

What's really impressive is that I understand this is a smaller studio, and that outside the minor translation issues it feels incredibly polished. I don't think I ran into one bug, at least one that I can recall, and certainly none that had any impact, and these are not simple systems to QA. Sincerely, I don't know how they did it, but amazing work.

In short, fantastic game. Highly recommend it.
developer_response:
First of all, we're sorry for the late reply! We have been to our hometowns for the past four days, including the weekend due to Korean Thanksgiving holidays. 

We have wanted to bring you the stories of the troubleshooter world that we wanted to tell you, focusing on the characters. And we have wanted to bring you a deep and wide story flow that combines the stories of each character, not just character settings. However, due to our lack of capabilities, the Season 1 story focused on introducing and delivering the world where major characters and troubleshooter are active.

In this situation, we have the courage to tell this story further because people like you enjoyed our story. We sincerely thank you for the opportunity to talk more through this story. 

Final Fantasy 6 is a great ensemble story we respect. We'll do our best to ensure that our troubleshooter's story is recognized as such.

In the translation section, as we move on to season 2, we will think about the opportunity to refine it to a professional translator as you suggested. I think it's a really good suggestion.

Although we are a small studio, we know how precious you are to enjoy our game like this because it is a small studio.

Thank you so much for enjoying our game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027826544', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 10921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10919, 'last_played': 1669147291}
review:
Икском в мире кей-попа. Игру можно условно разделить на два больших компонента — визуальную новеллу и менеджер тактических боёв, причём самое удивительное, что каждый из этих компонентов абсолютно полноценен и мог быть выпущен отдельной игрой. 

В мире, похожем на Гонконг будущего, орудуют банды и культисты, полиция не справляется, и правительство запускает программу траблшутеров — добровольческих команд, которые борются с преступностью, а взамен получают лут и денежные вознаграждения. Титульный герой по имени Альбус организует такую команду и начинает нанимать себе самых разных харизматичных сотрудников. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2804160899

Каждый траблшутер живёт своей жизнью, у каждого есть драматичная предыстория и связи с другими персонажами, в том числе с кучей игровых боссов (!). Сюжетная составляющая в игре развита настолько, что и многочисленные побочные миссии тоже имеют свою катсцену, и даже побочные квесты зачастую блещут остроумными диалогами. 

Сам сюжет сделан не по западным лекалам, тут нет никаких арок и даже внятной структуры. Скорее это такой большой сериал с плавающим фокусом повествования и по-анимешному гипертрофированными эмоциями. В "Войну и мир" его скомпоновать вряд ли выйдет, но основную икскомовскую функцию (вжиться в роль своих героев и переживать за них на миссиях) он выполняет лучше, чем все икскомоподобные игры вместе взятые. 

Тактическая часть сделана на стандартном нео-икскомовском движке с двухфазным ходом (пробежал-выстрелил), укрытиями и зонами контроля, только все ходят не строго поочерёдно, а по шкале таймингов, как в JRPG. При этом тут трёхмерное поле с высотами, просто куча классов (впоследствии двойных) и механик взаимодействия между героями (поддерживающие выстрелы, если герой не добил врага; упреждающие выстрелы, если твоего напарника атакуют и т.д.). 

Вне миссий героев можно кормить, есть масштабная система лута и крафта, а навыки тоже валятся с врагов и крафтятся (никогда такого не видел). В какой-то момент можно будет заводить роботов и приручать пёсиков. При этом вся тьма тьмущая врагов и боссов тоже имеет свой шмот и свои наборы навыков, которыми они вашу команду и лупят (или друг друга). Игра регулярно позволяет вам поиграть то бандитами, то культистами, то дикими гепардами. 

Сложность на мой взгляд лайтовая и хорошо настраиваемая. Я сразу включил хард, в какой-то момент переключил на cruel (предпоследнюю), да там и остался до самого конца. Но тут многое зависит от того, сколько вы делаете побочных миссий (и как далеко уходите в оверлевел). 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2810153494

Из недостатков я бы назвал в первую очередь гигантские масштабы игры. Тут можно смело закладывать 100 часов, а скорее куда больше, особенно если вы склонны к "параличу анализа". Геймпад поддерживается из рук вон плохо (10 лет назад я был поражён, что в римейке "Икскома" с геймпада управление удобнее, чем на мыши). Нет ручных сохранений, только автоматические (авторы [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2803205530]успешно[/url] борются с сейв-скамом, но иногда миссия заканчивается не там, где ожидаешь, и откатить назад ничего нельзя). 

Список навыков ([url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2823685003]masteries[/url]) довольно быстро превращается в свалку, где чёрт ногу сломит (авторы будто не играли ни в одну игру и не знают, зачем существуют деревья скилов). При этом копаться в навыках придётся всё время, а периодически ещё и менять привычные наборы на новые (н-р, в какой-то момент захочется всем навесить Armorbreak). Постоянно открываются новые наборы скилов (комплекты, дающие сборный бонус), но их нужно или специально мониторить или (учитывая недружественный интерфейс) забивать на них, натыкаясь на что-то зачастую крутое лишь при случайных изменениях. Иной вечер у меня весь уходил на ковыряние в инвентаре и билдах, а до очередной миссии дело даже не доходило. 

Некоторые диалоги почему-то идут без кнопки "продолжить", просто по таймеру. Некоторые миссии сделаны чересчур оригинально — тебе предлагается биться против своей же собственной команды. И если первый раз тебе хотя бы дали самому разбить людей на две группы, и было очень бодро и [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2828906878]свежо[/url], то второй раз я был готов бросить, когда мне вручили одного снайпера и одного помощника к нему и потребовали вынести всех остальных кабанов, раскачавшихся к тому моменту до небес (в итоге пришлось [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/470310/discussions/0/5760637065640894766/?ctp=3#c3318611373471809902]схитрить[/url]). 

Игра от корейских разработчиков и она довольно посредственно переведена на английский (причём, это уже вариант, отредактированный силами игрового сообщества). Есть и неофициальный русский [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2020434306]перевод[/url], упоминаемый тем не менее в финальных титрах. Масштабный сюжет так ничем особо и не заканчивается, тонкости политических интриг и загадок приходится [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/470310/discussions/0/3194745954534788896/#c4706830261927816763]додумывать самим[/url].

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2806503320

В целом я бы рекомендовал игру любителям жанра, не боящимся дыхания чужой культуры и проектов на 100500 часов. Можно было бы посоветовать игнорировать все доп. миссии, но как раз фиолетовые (с кучей мини-боссов) сделаны наиболее интересно с тактической стороны. На мой взгляд, "Траблшутеры" вполне способны составить конкуренцию куда более вылизанному и дорогостоящему [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/alpasy/recommended/268500]второму "Икскому"[/url] (более недоступному в нашем регионе). Я играл в эту игру 4 месяца, и до сих пор сложно оторваться.

P.S. Номинировал игру на Labor of Love 2022 (авторы продолжают её регулярно обновлять).
developer_response:
No one in the development team knows the Russian so I used the Google Translation to understands your review. I ask for your understanding.

First of all, we're sorry for the late reply! We have been to our hometowns for the past four days, including the weekend due to Korean Thanksgiving holidays. 

Thank you very much for your detailed explanations of the overall background setting and the frame of our game, the plot of the story, the battle, etc. Whenever we read these detailed reviews, we only appreciate the author's efforts.

We'll do our best to improve and provide the usability of game controller and save system that you mentioned as a disadvantages. In addition, we'll consider the part where the experience of the various missions we set forces a specific solution and find a way to improve it.

And we're always sorry for the lack of translation. We are always grateful to the Russian volunteers for their unofficial support of translation.

We'll do our best to make today's troubleshooter experience a better experience in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016000674', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1641654897}
review:
국산 srpg 
턴제알피지 좋아하는 분들에게 추천드립니다

지속적인 업데이트와 CS를 통해 개발자의 정성이 느껴집니다
댄디라이언 화이팅
developer_response:
추석 연휴 잘 보내셨습니까!!

저희 댄디라이언은 평범한 개발자 6명이 모인 역량이 많이 부족한 팀입니다.
그런 저희 역량을 잘 알고 있기에 현재 만들어진 저희 게임을 즐겁게 즐겨 주시는 여러분에게 진심으로 감사한 마음입니다.

다음 DLC, 시즌 2 등 저희가 계속 개발할 컨텐츠와 게임을 통해 저희에게 주신 응원에 보답할 수 있는 즐거운 경험을 드릴 수 있도록 최선을 다하겠습니다!

행복한 가을 되시길 바라겠습니다!

감사합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004447563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1694632818}
review:
3D 그래픽의 단점이 모든 장점을 씹어먹음. 불쾌한 골짜기.
그 와중에 2D 그래픽은 잘 뽑아서 괴리감이 너무 심함.

인벤토리 열었을 때 코스 템 장착샷을 따로 보여주고, 캐릭터는 2D 모습만 보여주는 게 차라리 나았을 텐데.. 무슨 자신감인지 그리 세련되지 못한 3D 모습을 정면으로 확대해서 너무 자주 보여주니 괴리감이 점점 심해짐.

여캐가 히어로 히어로 외칠 때마다 나오는 브금도 한두 번 들었을 때나 괜찮은거지 시도때도 없이 똑같은 브금을 틀어대니 그것도 영....
developer_response:
저희 역량 부족으로 많은 불쾌감을 드려 죄송합니다.

저희 개발 역량이 부족하다 보니 저희 기준에서 가능한 선을 맞춘 결과였으나 적지 않은 분들이 저희 3D 모델링 퀄리티에 불만을 가지시는 것을 많은 피드백을 통해 잘 이해하고 있습니다.

이 부분은 저희가 꾸준히 역량을 키워 장기적으로 개선할 방법을 찾아보도록 하겠습니다!

BGM의 경우,  이벤트를 통해 언락되는 주크 박스를 통해 원하시는 음악을 전투, 로비 상에서 재생하실 수 있습니다. 

즐거운 추석 연휴 되셨길 바라며, 지적하신 부족한 점은 지금이 아니라도 저희 개발팀이 계속 존속하는 한 꼭 보완할 방법을 찾아보도록 하겠습니다.

부족한 3D 퀄리티에도 불구하고 2D 일러스트를 좋아해주셔서 감사합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062634916', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1663028471}
review: XCOM pero otaco coreano.
developer_response:
Nadie en el equipo de desarrollo sabe español, así que usamos la traducción de Google para entender su reseña. Por favor entiende.

XCOM es un juego legendario y representa este género en estos días. El sistema de batalla base de Troubleshooter también está fuertemente inspirado en XCOM. Pero el equipo de desarrollo trató de que los jugadores sintieran que Troubleshooter es un juego basado en personajes o en una historia.

¡Haremos nuestro mejor esfuerzo para darle más placer!

Gracias por esta reseña.

author: {'steamid': '76561199139855776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1400, 'last_played': 1658898601}
review:
노가다성을 좀 줄이고 특성 조합법도 그냥 공개하는게 더 편하지 않았을까 하는 아쉬움

그래도 국산과 해외 턴제게임을 통틀어
꽤나 완성도 있는 작품이라고 말하고 싶음
어설프게 예전 게임들 복각한 흔한 jrpg에 비하면

developer_response:
추석 연휴는 즐겁게 지내셨나요?

개발팀도 내일 전원 복귀하여 다시 게임을 개선하고 추가되는 DLC 작업에 열중하려고 합니다.

여러모로 작은 개발팀이다보니 많은 것을 만족시켜드리지 못하고 있지만, 지적해주신 제작 부분과 노가다성 부분에서 개선할 방법을 찾아보도록 하겠습니다. 이 부분을 현재 대대적으로 개선하지 못하고 있는 이유는 그저 저희 역량 부족으로 어떤 방법이 게임의 흐름을 무너뜨리지 않으면서 접근할 수 있을까 고민을 하고 있기 때문입니다. 

좋은 개선 방향을 찾아 게임을 더 즐겁게 즐길 수 있도록 최선을 다하겠습니다!

저희 게임을 즐겁게 즐겨주셔서 감사합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978897957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33568, 'last_played': 1666847707}
review:
The gameplay here while similar to X-COM in some areas differs quite significantly in other aspects. Instead of each side taking their turn by teams, characters take turn individually based on their speed ala FF Tactics and have to wait before they can act again. This makes it harder to eliminate enemies by grouping up on them but on the flip side it makes it easier to survive their attacks too.

There is no manual saving in combat so no save scumming. If you mess up, either restart the mission from the beginning or from one of the checkpoints if available. There is no permadeath though, so feel free to experiment and take risks.

Each character can be customized with a combination of different class, skills, abilities and masteries to tackle various challenges. The difficulty does not really ramp up until the late game so you have plenty of time to familiarize yourself with its system. Be aware that some grinding is expected, the amount of which depends on how many stuff you want to unlock. You certainly don't need every single mastery to beat the game but they do make your life easier especially if you play on the higher difficulties and the DLC.

Definitely well worth my money.
developer_response:
First of all, we're sorry for the late reply! We have been to our hometowns for the past four days, including the weekend due to Korean Thanksgiving holidays. 

We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed a lot of contents that we wanted to give you through the game.

We promise you that we bring you a lot of content that you can enjoy in the next DLC.

Thank you so much for enjoying our game!

Have a nice day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030935873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4013, 'last_played': 1689474068}
review:
I love this game a whole bunch but I want to write this review just to show love to the developers. They are constantly either updating the game or updating the playerbase as to why the game isn't being updated. They are the most attentive developers I've seen and are excellent at communicating and setting a gold standard for the developer/consumer relationship.

The game is X-Com but anime and it rules. Has more than enough personality and flair to set itself apart from being a cheap X-Com clone and is absolutely worth a look if you want to scratch that itch.
developer_response:
Thank you for appreciating the efforts of the small development team. I think it was possible for us to increase our contact with gamers because we were a small development team. Without going through a multi-step verification process in a large organization, gamers' opinions could be communicated within all teams, which led to the result that we needed to increase our contact points with gamers. We will continue to prepare more diverse games and updates based on this experience.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015255057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5510, 'last_played': 1662420099}
review:
It's a lot like XCOM in that you have a team, you build them up, you do tactical combat, etc. Most of the same things you'd expect from a tactical isometric turn based game. Its all ironman mode so no way to save scum which is interesting. There's also no fail state that I know of though, so you just get to re-equip, get your team drunk so they're motivated, and try again. WAY less punishing in my experience, as XCOM will murder anyone not in full cover, Albius can walk down the street and dodge everything.

I'm 91 hours in and they're introducing new mechanics and characters still, and have barely scratched the surface of the mastery system. 

For a small team's passion project, I am so impressed with this game. Its got some quirkiness in its mechanics and how things flow but nothing you wouldn't kind of expect from a small team. 

If you enjoy tactical games, this one is a lot of fun. The story I've found also to be touching at moments, hilarious at others, and well worth the price of admission.
developer_response:
We got a lot of influence from XCOM when we made the Troubleshooter. One operation was really important when doing XCOM. The fatigue and disappointment when the character I had worked hard to foster died due to one mistake made me not to restart the game for a while. We wanted to create a system that would reduce the burden of this as much as possible and allow gamers to focus more on the story and development of characters. 

We were able to confirm that this is working well through your evaluation. Now we need to come up with a device that the more a gamer fosters a character, the stronger the character can become. That's the mastery system and as long as our updates continue, the mastery system will become more diverse and constantly change.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015780859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3897, 'last_played': 1662271269}
review: Одна из лучших игр в жанре пошаговых стратегий, в которую добавили кучу шмоток в стиле диабло с крафтом и выбиванием ресурсов. Добавили много навыков, которые вы сами находите, исследуете и выбираете для героев. В итоге полная кастомизация героев, вполне интересные миссии. И все это в инди игре за небольшую сумму, которую регулярно обновляют корейские ребята. Сюжет есть, вполне понятный - защита города от криминала.
developer_response:
No one in the development team knows the Russian so I used the Google Translation to understands your review. I ask for your understanding.

The Battle of Troubleshooter is essentially about strategy, but how quickly it takes down a large number of enemies is also a very important factor. Failure to do so would result in longer enemy activity and this would be a very disadvantageous factor for our forces. Therefore, as you mentioned, I think it would be good to think of Troubleshooter as a strategy game that includes Diablo's Hack & Slash elements. If this becomes a feature of the game we will make in the future, I think that's also a good direction. :D

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020479803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 6600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1706875043}
review:
그래픽의 허술함을 메꿔버리는 훌륭한 게임성과 아트워크. 한국의 대표 SRPG가 되길 바랍니다!


건의사항: 
습득한 장비와 캐릭터의 현재 장비를 비교해서 습득 장비의 능력치가 높으면 아이콘에 △ 표시 같은 게 있으면 좋지 않을까 싶습니다.
developer_response:
저희 게임을 찾아주시고 즐겨주셔서 감사합니다!!

제안해주신 장비 비교 부분을 고려하여 더 직관적인 방법을 제공해 보도록 하겠습니다!

곧 추석입니다. 

즐거운 추석 되시길 바라겠습니다! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198267084278', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 20443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19318, 'last_played': 1696409364}
review:
传统战棋后期队伍出击人数都是不足，总是头疼要把谁丢下，这游戏后面完全不需要担心，还是可以全部都上，甚至当前最新图全员上阵还会多一个出击位。
剧情上现阶段已经相当丰富，但是坑还是很多，感觉没有个好几年还更新不完，不少人物还只是漏了个头没有展开，不过设定框架都挺全面的，还没实装的角色武器也都配好了，手枪和斧头现版本能刷的出来但是没人能用，所以后续的更新还是值得期待的。
难度上来说，这游戏是强制铁人模式，没有sl空间，且同一个地图分布也是随机的，初见杀是常有的事，被狂暴大流士砍死、对着开不死的约翰输出之类的基本都要经历了。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

【分争调整者】受到了XCOM系列的影响，所有的比较标准都只能是XCOM。但是我们为了向与XCOM不同的方向发展游戏，正在持续更新。我们不想单纯地模仿XCOM的作品，而是想打造新的品牌。

正如你所提到的，很多事情都有改进的余地很大。开发组将尽最大努力通过下一个DLC逐渐解决这些问题。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561199219927822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9601, 'last_played': 1700377001}
review:
韓国ドラマがなぜ人気なんのかわかった気がする。ストーリーやキャラが非常にいい。ボスクラスの敵キャラのルックスがモブキャラと大差ないのが残念だが、悪党ギャング達の人間ドラマもクローズアップされてて楽しめました。ゲーム部分でも特性の組み合わせが奥深く、クリア不可能と思ってたマップも、特性を大改造したらギリギリクリア、あるいは楽勝クリアしたりと、密かな感動を味わってますｗ　モンスターの捕獲・調教や、戦闘マシンの作成も可能ですが、私はそこまで脳みそが追い付かず、ここら辺は適当にながしてます。やること多すぎると流石にきついｗ　とはいえ、人の好みによって最強キャラが変わってくるのは面白い。私はビアンカがお気に入りなんで、優先的に特性や装備を付けてエースアタッカーにしてますｗ　残念なのはカメラワークと敵キャラの数の多さからくる戦闘時間（待ち時間）の長さかな？ちなみに敵の動きのスピードは調整できます。私は戦闘シーンが好きなんでゆっくり見たい。しかし、前述のカメラアングルがこちらのターンの終了時に固定されるため、敵の攻撃ターンがビルの陰に隠れて音とシルエットだけになったりします。オプションで自動カメラアングルが選べるといいかも？　まだすべての伏線回収ができてないんで、どうやらＤＬＣが今後も続くようですが、ストーリーがいいんで楽しみにしています。

　深紅のカラスを追加購入しました。久しぶりにやったら、いろいろ快適になってましたｗ
上記の敵の移動中のカメラアングル変更が可能に。地味に見てて楽しく個人的にうれしい仕様です。ただ、シナリオの難易度が高かったんで苦しかったですｗ　
　実はまだ開発中らしく途中で終わってしまいました。少ない人数で開発している上に災害の被害も受けてるみたいなんで気長に待ちます。応援してます。
　日本のおじさんたちにはバレバレなガンダムネタもありました。ビミョーにツボなんで先の話がスゲー気になるｗ　新キャラのミスティもかわいくてミステリアスで話の終わりが気になるところですが、気になるキャラが多すぎて逆に心配になりましたｗ　ワンピースみたいに20年くらいやってるかもｗ 
　このゲーム最大のポイントはキャラ愛なんだろうと思います。一撃で倒すともう一回攻撃できる特性とかあるんで、カッコいいヘイシン兄さん（女性陣からは賛否両論ｗ）の単身突入１ターン８人抜きとか、頼りになるジゼル姉さんの連続長距離狙撃とか、王道主人公アルバス社長の防御率を８６％まで上げたりとか（敵の連続コンボが炸裂したりするんで無敵ではない）、個性的なカスタムできるのが楽しい。あえて言うと特性の付け替えに必要なポイントがあり、ケチケチマンの俺は全ての特性を試してみることはない。で、5000ポイントくらい溜まってるはず。が、付け替えて元の状態に戻せなくなるの怖くてやることはない。このポイント無制限にしてくれたらすべての特性を組み合わせる実験する猛者も現れるのではなかろうか？　ちなみに特性パターンの記録が4つくらいあるので、元に戻せないというわけではない。俺がケチケチマンなだけであるｗ　どうしても勝てない敵が現れるときのために取っておきたいんだよねｗ　同じマップで5回やられたら事前準備が必要です。
developer_response:
(この文は翻訳機を使って作成されました。)

開発チームは6人で構成されています。 そして彼らは皆美術または工学を専門的に扱っています。 ゲームを作るための最小限の必須人数だけで集まっているのですね。 残念ながら開発チームには人文学に特化した人数がいません。 そのため、開発チームには話の流れ、そしてそれを完全に伝えるための外国語能力が特に不足しています。 それにもかかわらず、あなたがアルバースとヴァルハラの話を気に入ってくれているようで、本当に感謝しています。 

SRPGジャンルのゲームはジャンルの特性により、他のジャンルのゲームよりゲームの進行速度が遅くならざるを得ません。 さらに最近のゲームトレンドは、ゲームの序盤から強烈な印象とともに始まり、いつでもゲームのすべてのコンテンツを利用できるように変化しています。 それに対し、私たちは伝統的なSRPGの公式に従っています。 しかし、伝統に従いながらも最近のトレンドに符合する試みが並行されなければならないのに、私たちはそのような面で弱点を表しました。 弱点を補うためにあらゆる装置を導入しましたが、それはあくまで補助的な手段に過ぎず、根本的な解決策ではないと思います。 私たちはこれを大切な教訓としてより良い姿をあなたにお見せするために最善を尽くします。

いい評価ありがとうございます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198017287527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 28151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9695, 'last_played': 1706778212}
review:
예전에 파랜드 택틱스도 재밌게 했고, 엑스컴도 재밌게 했기 때문에 기대하고 플레이했는데 기대를 져버리지 않고 정말 재밌게 했고 당분간 재밌게 할 예정입니다. 원래 다른 게임들도 몇 개 하고 있었는데 이거 하느라고 다른 게임들은 손을 놔버렸네요.

 굳이 단점이 있다면, 제작 시스템이 너무 난잡한 느낌이 있습니다. 캐릭터들마다 사용하는 장비들도 조금씩 다른데 재료들도 속성이나 기타 특징으로 많이 나누어져 있어서 정리가 안 되는 느낌이 있습니다. 아마 개발/제작자분들이 알아서 하시리라 생각하지만 재료와 제작 시스템이 조금 간소화되었으면 합니다. 다양성을 위해서 세분화를 시켜놓으신 거 같지만 복잡하다는 건 결국 유저의 거부감으로 다가오기 마련이라고 생각합니다.

 물론 어디까지나 개인적으로 생각이라 다른 분들은 공감 못 하실 수 있습니다. 이거 말고는 제가 느끼는 단점은 없습니다.
 이런 류의 게임 좋아하시는 분들한테는 재밌게 할 수 있을 거라 생각합니다. 추천!
developer_response:
말씀하신 것처럼, '다양성을 위해서 세분화 시킨것'은 맞지만 그럼에도 불구하고 그것이 제작에 대한 접근성을 훼손시켰다면 그것은 개발팀의 실수 혹은 능력 부족입니다. 해외의 평가를 통해서도 많은 분들이 제작에 대해 진입장벽이 높다고 토로하는 분들이 있었습니다. 그러므로 리뷰를 쓰신 분의 평가가 정확하다고 할 수 있을 것입니다. 앞으로의 업데이트에 있어서 새로운 컨텐츠만큼이나 기존의 컨텐츠에 대한 접근도를 향상시킬 수 있는 방법에 대해서 계속 고민 하겠습니다.

파랜드 택틱스와, 엑스컴을 재미있게 즐기신 분에게 듣는 좋은 평가는 각별합니다. 언젠가는 다른 게임을 평가하실 때 트러블슈터라는 브랜드가 인용될 수 있도록 개발팀이 더욱 노력하겠습니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188402518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 13039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9493, 'last_played': 1707993017}
review: 作为战棋真的很不错，类似xcom但也有自己的独特优点，而且命中率很高，不过缺点就是全天赋收集有点肝，未成型以前一局游戏时间比较长，特别是一些大型关卡，不过总体很不错。推荐困难难度开局，不然会少一些精英敌人，游戏难度不高，困难也不会说过不去。主要是新dlc要出了，特别来推荐一下。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

" 不过缺点就是全天赋收集有点肝，未成型以前一局游戏时间比较长，特别是一些大型关卡 "

仅凭这篇文章中的内容，【分争调整者】充分有理由受到不好的评价。尽管如此，还是给予我们好评，给我们再次前进的力量，非常感谢。开发组将继续完善缺点，并继续更新使优点更好的更新。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198333422187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 38060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33897, 'last_played': 1709966952}
review: 特别喜欢这款游戏，可以说是非常爱了，里面的设定基本都很喜欢无论是游戏性还是画风还是bgm 都是特别喜欢的，从小时候玩过幻世录，风色幻想之类的战棋之后就总想再找一款特别喜欢的战棋游戏，然而特别的难，本人其实不是很喜欢画面简陋的类似火焰纹章那样的战旗游戏，尤其是像素风的战棋，为什么战棋游戏就一定要像素风？市场上太多太多像素风的战棋了，内容做的也不够好，这是对战棋游戏的刻板印象吗而且游戏内也没有什么成长方面的反馈，单调的换更高级的武器，太乏味了。 总之是非常推荐这个游戏的，很喜欢。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

战棋比其他游戏需要知道的规则更多。如果游戏系统复杂，只有了解更多内容，才能真正体验到游戏。也许这些因素会诱导游戏越来越简单。再加上最近人们想更快地受到刺激，所以这种倾向似乎更加强烈。

与此相比，我们站在相反的位置。游戏方式不跟随最近的趋势，只有经过游戏初期的郁闷时间才能正式体验游戏。尽管如此，您还是喜欢我们的方式，非常感谢。我们将在发挥我们独特个性的同时，继续研究能够接受最近流行的方法。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198822020272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1663613153}
review:
[h1] So far so good (13 hours only though)[/h1]

It's Freedom Force 3 (that old unique game with superheroes) and abit of Phoenix Point without aiming.

It's not so close to xcom but more to turn based rpg from the east. 
- So far the only think i havent figured out well is how to use masteries and dont like that i cant save the game while in missions. (Perhaps this adds to the difficulty but with no perma death not sure how it works).

Alot of good ideas that might need some changes through future expansions but definitely a game someone should try . 

---  I have return king's bounty 3 after 1 hour since it was disappointing (got it in less than 20 euros in a huge discount but still did't keep it). Instead with these money you can get this game (if you find in a discount) and Phoenix point and spend hours playing and experimenting with these games.  ---
developer_response:
The character's growth is linked to the core fun of the game. And it's mastery system  that has the biggest impact on that. However, it is a big mistake for the development team to not explain such a system to the gamer efficiently. If there was any inconvenience you felt while using the mastery system, please share it on the community board. The development team will never miss it.

As you mentioned, you can't save the progress manually during the mission. However, by adjusting the Auto Checkpoint in the game's options, you can achieve a similar effect to manual storage. I recommend that you try it. :D

Oh, and have you noticed that there are options that make game speed faster? Please check the [Ally Units Action Speed] and [Non-ally Units Action Speed] in the [GAMEPLAY] in the game option.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149027668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2752, 'last_played': 1690090791}
review: 非常超出预期的游戏，作为战旗游戏不管是策略还是剧情在我心里已经远远超过风花雪月。制作者可以考虑付费的DLC，希望能增加一些角色，同时增加二转甚至三转。同时希望能平衡近战和远程（游戏前期近战过强，远程过弱，进入中后期高难度近战基本只能当T，比比甚至能单人清图）

author: {'steamid': '76561198878110260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4641, 'last_played': 1662174563}
review: 这么肝的单机应该出个挂机刷图，跳过低等级战斗之类的功能，还有就是不要那么多NPC警察啊，没什么用操作还麻烦。总之就是很肝但玩起来还不错的游戏。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

玩家们舒适的游戏环境，提供手机游戏，游戏的感觉太好了的是很难得的事情。开发组将保留游戏 单机游戏 的感觉，尽最大努力创造符合最近趋势的舒适的游戏环境。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198092182539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 7056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1665931244}
review:
4 hours in: An absolute blast. Cannot wait to get deeper into the story and game play. Plenty to customize regarding skills, inventory, and more. Will update as I play more!

12 hours in: Still having an absolute blast! There are multiple classes to change or evolve into. I still only have three characters but I know there are many, MANY more. I've also found that there are many difficulty settings you can mess with. If it's too hard or too easy there's special rule-sets as well that change how you play the game. I haven't had a chance to mess with it yet but it looks inciting. I love how you can decide to grind or collect more items, or decide to continue the story. There's many different missions and I love how each one, even the ones you can repeat, feel like they are continuing the story. Still highly recommend. I'll probably update this another 12 hours in. :)

~36 hours in: Where has the time gone! Unlocked another character, missions are getting hard but a lot of fun! Always something new with each story missions and the repeatable ones you shouldn't miss either. A lot of the missions, you decide how they play out and what the outcome will be! They'll expand the story, unlock new items or masteries, and generally are as much fun as the story missions. I know there's still plenty more to see and unlock. Definitely worth the money. I'll continue updating this review, but I'll probably wait till I unlock something more substantial.

80+ hours in: Cannot recommend enough if you are into Tactical turn based games. I've evolved a beast pet, I can create robots to fight for me and hack them as well. The game continues to expand with new characters, abilities, classes, masteries, enemies, and more (!) and the story is still interesting, much more than the first couple hours. Some of the maps are massive too, not in a bad way either. At any time, whether you're in the alternate hub or in the middle of a mission, you can always save and take a break. There are many automatic checkpoints on many of the maps as well if you make a mistake and aren't on one of the more difficult game settings. Many of the story missions are re-playable so that you can unlock even more goodies from the bosses or completing missions in a different way.

I'm assuming I'm no where close to the end of the game either.

At some point I'll write a formal review. This has become one of my favorite games to play. It's also a fantastic time sink. I cannot wait for the next DLC and the next game from this studio!
developer_response:
More stories and more colleagues are waiting for you. Please take your time and enjoy all of it.

Oh, and have you noticed that there are options that make game speed faster? Please check the [Ally Units Action Speed] and [Non-ally Units Action Speed] in the [GAMEPLAY] in the game option.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198856919978', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4979, 'last_played': 1688371344}
review: 还是忍不住想吐槽，83个小时也算是稍微入了门，但每次我开始新任务时都很抗拒，为什么呢，因为每次我都要操纵大量的npc警察，然而高难度下他们的伤害是那么的令人忧伤，以至于每次我都是拿他们当喂血瓶的工具人。这些npc伤害低还要占用回合，玩家不爱用，伤害哪怕正常于队员们，高难度的乐趣也会大打折扣。我真心的认为每关超过3个npc警察就已经有些臃肿了。严重影响每关时间不说，实际上并不能降低难度，因为精英boss该一招秒你还是一招秒你，小怪该被你一招秒还是被你一招秒。再来就是天赋，我并不是一个十分刻意追求完美bd的人，自己组一个自己觉得很酷的bd我认为正是这类游戏有趣的地方，但是这个游戏可是足足有将近小一千的天赋啊，列位！然而，且不说绝大多数天赋隐藏的，甚至我已经研究出来的天赋，连一个事先组建都没有。由衷希望制作组可以增加一个小小的功能，就是可以在不消耗制作书的前提下，允许玩家在自己已经研究出来的天赋范围里，预先组建bd，然后再决定是否要制作天赋。Thanks♪(･ω･)ﾉ
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

npc警察是非常敏感的问题。npc警察是在游戏初期，阿尔伯斯为了弥补同事不多时的不足而引进的。但是随着阿尔伯斯的同事们正式加入组合，对V的存在产生了两种立场。其一，在成长npc警察的同时，使其成为更加有用的存在;其二，只会妨碍我军的战略，所以干脆不要让它出现在任务中。我们为代表后者的游戏玩家增加了npc警察一次全部退却的功能，而不是一个一个退却。虽然这个功能不能完全满足这些人，但我认为会有一些帮助。开发组将在游戏的后半部更加慎重地决定使用npc警察。

对于您想要制作自己的bd，开发组积极支持您。但是在目前的情况下，很难去除训练书。因此，我们将提供更容易获得训练书的方法。天赋是游戏的核心系统，开发组也不希望利用B限制天赋。开发组将尽最大努力寻找只属于你的bd。

啊！谢谢可爱的表情 :D

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995259188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1661910540}
review:
Hoped for X-COM 2: WOTC meets quirky anime visual novel. Alas, it was not meant to be. Quirky visual novel, yes. X-COM 2: WOTC depth, no. 

Ultimately, it is at best a lite version of vanilla X-COM. 10-ish missions in, despite lots of different attribute options that affect a variety of percentages and statistics, there does not seem to be a tremendous amount of variety in the game play. Large maps. Lots of enemies. Lots of NPCs. Slow. 

Worse, it is not remotely challenging. On normal difficulty, after a series of slow, grinding missions, I opted to simply running directly at my enemies, surrounding them and attacking as much as possible. Safety considerations out the window. It was simply faster than being tactical, staying in cover, etc. 

Despite this reckless approach that would end in failure in either X-COM, Battle Brothers and the like, I never came close to losing in Troubleshooter. Between constant dodges, blocks and an occasional healing potion, my troops are virtually invulnerable. On top of that, nearly every mission features a player friendly NPC that can one shot enemy troops and rarely misses. I played one last mission that lasted 45 minutes because of the sheer size of the map and number of enemies, and I saw enough to move on. 

10-ish missions may not sound like much, but according to Steam achievements, I got further than 60% of the playerbase. 

The art is really cool.
developer_response:
We're sorry we couldn't satisfy you. Our game started as an early-access game, so most of the users who purchased it in the beginning did not return, so the initial amount of departure rate seems very high because at that time, we had only 5 stages.

As you pointed out, the part where the early play doesn't show our entire game is our lack of capability. Moreover, it is true that XCOM, who we were inspired a lot in the beginning, stands out. All are our low capabilities.

Despite current situations, we'll continue to improve and find ways to deliver our charms quickly in the beginning. So we'll make it easy to access what many people who make positive evaluations have experienced.

Thank you for your purchase and interest!

author: {'steamid': '76561198425691805', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10951, 'last_played': 1666414565}
review:
스토리 다 보고 도전과제 100%까지 완료하고 나니 어느새 182시간이나 플레이했네요

어렸을때 조조전과 디아블로를 즐겨했던 게이머로서 제대로 취향저격이었습니다
엑스컴과 비슷한 게임이라고 생각할 수도 있지만 매력적인 캐릭터, 꽤나 탄탄한 스토리, 다양한 특성과 아이템 조합등의 이유로 개인적으로 훨씬 더 재밌게 즐겼던 것 같네요 

후반부로 갈수록 난이도를 위해서인지 짜증을 유발하는 상대 특성이 많아 스트레스를 받기도 했지만.. 도전과제를 마치는 순간까지도 새롭게 발견하는 요소들이 있기에 마음만 먹으면 이보다 더 즐길 수 있겠다 싶기도 했습니다 ㅎㅎ

이 가격에 이정도 볼륨, 꾸준한 업데이트라니 앞으로도 트러블슈터 개발사에서 제작한 게임은 믿고 할 것 같습니다!
후속편이든 dlc든 뒤에 이어지는 스토리는 꼭 풀어줬으면 하는 바람도 있구요 ㅎㅎ
앞으로도 플레이하며 응원하겠습니다~
developer_response:
개발팀이 아무리 많은 것을 준비하였다고 해도 그것을 알아주고 즐겨주는 사람이 없다면 그것은 없는 것과 같습니다. 그래서 우리 게임을 완전히 즐긴 당신에게 개발팀은 정말로 감사의 말씀을 먼저 올립니다. 

게임 난이도가 선형적으로 증가함과 동시에 게이머들에게 자연스레 받아지도록 만드는 것은 정말 어렵다는 것을 이번 개발을 통해서 체감하고 있습니다. 난이도의 조정은 앞으로도 조금씩 수정이 이루어질 것입니다. 더 많은 분들이 게임의 끝에 도달하도록 만드는 것이 현재 개발팀의 가장 큰 과제이기도 하고요.

개발팀은 여전히 트러블슈터의 세계관을 확장시킬 수 있다고 믿습니다. 그리고 이것을 현실화할 다양한 방법들을 고민하고 있습니다. 늦지 않은 시기에 이와 관련한 좋은 소식을 전달할 수 있도록 최선을 다하겠습니다.

좋은 평가 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970108018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 12540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11986, 'last_played': 1680338387}
review:
An uber harcore, anime X-Com.

Thoroughly enjoyed my 200 hours in the game and I'm very much looking forward to new content.

The game can be a little overwhelming at first, due to the depth and variety of the systems. The character builds are the deepest and most complex I have seen this side of Path of Exile, and combat is challenging and very strategic. 

I'm not a big Anime fan, and the art style and story line left me somewhat cold, especially as the translation is often a little wonky. But the excellent combat and incredibly varied character builds were more than enough to get me hooked

The devs seem very active as well, with constant interaction with the community. The only thing about the game i struggled with is the lack YouTube videos with recommended builds. shout out to LifeofAshuram as his channel is pretty much the only one that seems to be consistently churning out guidance vids. I doubt i would have stuck with the game as long as i did without his channel, because the game doesn't do a very good job of explaining the more complex systems
developer_response:
Two key elements of the game are the story and characteristic system of the game. The development team feels a lot of responsibility because it seems that you did not fully enjoy one of the translations we provided because of the poor quality. As long as we continue to develop updates for this game, the translation will continue to improve. And we don't want to finish updating the game for the time being!

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046197086', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2820, 'last_played': 1687195173}
review:
作为我最喜欢的回合制战棋游戏，含泪点下不推荐。这游戏什么都好，就是有2点无法忍受。一个是单局时间实在是太长了，随便打一局就是一个多小时。要命的是这个时间不是花在思考战略战术上，而是花在找怪上。特别是很多巷战，地图又大地形又复杂，经常走完整个地图了发现还有怪在一开始的地方，然后再一路摸回去，然后碰到个死胡同还要绕半天。每局游戏都要花大半时间赶路。加上很多地图都要打不止一次，实在是太累了。第二点是这天赋做的太多太杂了，我不知道一个回合制战术游戏要搞这么多乱七八糟的天赋干什么，而且天赋还是刷怪掉的，你搞成天赋树给玩家点不香吗？反正这天赋我搞过一次以后就再也懒得弄了。可能有人喜欢折腾天赋，反正我是很不喜欢。
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
看了开发者的回复，快进行动确实可以节约很多时间，但是我说的问题关键在于跑图花的时间占了一局战役的一大半。我不介意一局游戏玩一个小时，但是我希望我的时间是花在战斗上的，比如思考如何用最小的伤亡消灭敌人，甚至不停的被BOSS团灭重开，而不是在地图上跑来跑去找怪。因为你们游戏中的战争迷雾只要人走了又会出现，很多战役敌人又都是会移动的，所以很容易漏掉怪。虽然系统会通过信号提示你怪的方向，但是因为地图又大地形又复杂，如果怪在地图的另一端常常要花费很长的时间。我建议是不是可以把地图做小一点，怪的数量减少一些，但是强度增加一些。现在敌人数量很多，但是除了一些BOSS其他真的太弱了，找到基本就是一刀一个，根本不需要思考怎么打，感觉就是用敌人的数量在延长游戏时间。既然你们想做的是一个SRPG，那就应该体现出游戏的策略性。一味的增加敌人的数量并不能增加游戏的策略性。适量的减少敌人的数量，但是让敌人更强大，玩家才会去思考如何更有效的击败他。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

完成任务确实需要较长的时间。这种类型的游戏具有结构性局限性，但我们未能打破这一局限性。但是我们正在对此准备各种对策。代表性的例子就是 "快进队友行动" 和 "快进队友外的行动"。或许是在用这个吗? 如果你没有使用这个的话，建议一定要试试。对快速完成任务会有很大的帮助。 

在游戏任务中，你没有体验到战略上的乐趣，这是因为开发组的实力不成熟。我们计划最终把【分争调整者】制作成SRPG 因此，在游戏中，战略性是最重要的因素。因此，开发组不会忘记无论采用何种更新，游戏的根本就是战略，会努力进一步改善。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010102758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 10063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9762, 'last_played': 1686512642}
review:
Troubleshooter was a really pleasant surprise for me. I didn't have high expectations for the game going in, but I was kinda blown away by just how much fun I've ended up having with it, and how much of a labour of love it clearly is. It has something of a slow start, unfortunately, with characters unlocking a bit too slow, but once it grips you it really grips you with plenty of systems, such as heavy customisation, robot building, pet taming and more.

The game is very clearly heavily inspired by the newer XCOM games, which shows both in the UI, the visuals and the gameplay, but it adds a layer of RPG elements on top of it that adds more of a sense of consistent progression for better or worse. The focus on distinct characters with personality and unique classes and playstyles instead of disposable grunts is a choice I personally really enjoy, and the lack of harsh consequences for failure is really good for me. 

The RPG system has quite a bit of customisation; you can equip gear, you have a main class and two advanced subclasses for each character that unlock new abilities and further customisation options, and masteries. They're essentially how you build a character: they're skills, generally either passive or conditional, that you assign to a character to change both their stats and how their abilities interact with themselves, allies and enemies. It's a super cool system, but...

The downside of all this is that it is kinda grindy. If you want to craft gear, you need to either get a lot of money or do a lot of hunting of monsters and other resources. Masteries are gotten either as drops from enemies, or from unlocking them through levelling up player classes and subclasses. Many are tied just to enemies, and many more-or-less essential masteries for making a build capable of dealing with the strong enemies are locked behind those self-same enemies, which feels a bit awkward.

Still, the base gameplay very much scratches the XCOM itch for me, and I've been having a lot of fun with it. The story, told through a sort of VN approach, was surprisingly enjoyable too, and the characters often very endearing. Particularly Ray and HERO IRENE have been enjoyable for me, and Bianca and Alisa's relationship is an absolute delight.

It's a game that's overflowing with fun stuff, with some smaller annoyances that, to me, weren't enough to overshadow the enjoyment I had of it. I definitely recommend it if you enjoy the newer XCOM games, and you can stomach some grinding.
developer_response:
" It has something of a slow start, unfortunately, with characters unlocking a bit too slow. "

You passed this section well and you seem to have experienced everything the development team prepared. This is really something the development team should be grateful for you. Recent game trends require 'instant stimulation' for all games, regardless of the genre of the game. In this respect, TBS has a natural weakness. Many development teams apply many ideas to games to overcome these weaknesses. But we didn't know anything about this. We just stuck to the formula of the existing game and made these things even more prominent. However, this was not in line with the current game trend, and this led to a lot of criticism. We've applied a lot of modifications to improve this, but due to the structural limitations of the game, we haven't made any progress that gamers can feel. This was a mistake made by our lack of development capabilities. That's why we feel more grateful to the development team for this.

" RPG elements on top of it "

You have grasped our intentions accurately. We borrowed XCOM's combat system. And we're trying to build a new brand by introducing our own elements here. The 'our own element' here is represented by the growth of the character according to the story. We want to reduce the burden of individual missions as much as possible and create a game that allows gamers to immerse themselves in the stories of the characters.

" it is kinda grindy "

I think this is the side effect of our active reflection of RPG elements in the game. This is very true. In order to grow the character as desired by the gamer, the mission must be completed repeatedly and sometimes the end feels too far away. But no development team will want gamers to suffer through "grinding". We will provide gamers with a way to get the items they want from more diverse sources.

Thank you for not giving up on Troubleshooter despite many shortcomings and for making a good impression on Troubleshooter to many gamers through recommendations.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035830117', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6777, 'last_played': 1705407045}
review:
Amazing game. Character build possibilities are endless, unique story and setting, good difficulty settings, many many hours of gameplay. 
Animations can be clunky and graphics aren't the best but it doesn't impact the experience. Translations aren't perfect as well but for me it wasn't a big issue.
The developer team is still putting out updates for the game reguralry and they gave away a huge DLC for free, with another on the way. I honestly can't wait for more of this game.

Subjective score - 10/10 (My favorite game in recent years)
Objective score - 7.5/10 (Hard to reccomend to everyone as it's a niche game that you need to sink your teeth in a bit deeper to get to the true charm of the game and to get the story rolling)
developer_response:
Even if your rating of the game was bad because the level of animations, graphics, and the translation didn't satisfy you, we would have accepted it (it's absolutely true). Nevertheless, thank you for encouraging the development team through good scores and good game evaluation. In order to have more fun with you, the development team will not stop the next development.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060695704', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 13614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11583, 'last_played': 1704441215}
review: Great game. Your playable characters are handcrafted rather than randomly generated which allows each one a backstory which is explored as you play the game. Game mechanics work really well and allow you to customize your characters the way you want. Finding combinations of masteries to unlock mastery sets is also quite fun. Theres a few mechanics which need to be fleshed out (Particularly the valkyrie coins, which I didnt spend any of). Translation is pretty good, although there are a few weird phrases here and there. I cant wait for season 2. I hope we can somehow transfer our progress across if it continues Albus' story.
developer_response:
The story of Troubleshooter is complete, but we want to expand the world view of the game even further. A lot of things were mentioned in the game, but not all of them were dealt with in detail. These will be covered in detail in the next DLC or a follow-up. Since you and the development team want it, it's time for the development team to do their best to develop the game!

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043519672', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3443, 'last_played': 1667829930}
review:
I got into this game thinking it was going to be anime XCOM. It's much more than that. 
The missions can be an uphill battle, but I can always go back to the previous ones if I need to, getting my party leveled up, and even adjusting the speed of both my party and the enemy's if I find it to be going slowly.  
There's a long list of masteries to unlock mostly through battles, and it was admittedly very intimidating to see. After a couple of hours (and a useful guide) I completely understood how fun it actually is to mix and match them.

Honestly a fantastic game, and even without a sale, the price for it is more than fair for the hours I'm getting out of it.
developer_response:
" it was going to be anime XCOM "

The Troubleshooter was heavily influenced by XCOM. And our painting style is closer to oriental painting style(Mainly Korea, China and Japan) than Western painting style. So the first impression you got from Troubleshooter is very accurate. And the fact that you've been playing the game and discovered the differences with XCOM is very encouraging to us. We are improving the game so that Troubleshooter can be a unique brand, although it has been produced with a lot of influence from XCOM. Your review suggests that we are moving in the right direction. We will continue to maintain this direction.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344644313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1665792004}
review:
Worth a try DURING A SALE
-better than some recent competitors (think D-mon Survive)

Great sound design, awful RNG and difficulty swings. First major length mission introduces the "pyromancer" unit type and makes it an RNG slog with constant penalizing resets. No point in playing past that if unfair 1 shot deaths out of nowhere bother you (they can and will happen). The visuals are nice and the customization runs deep (albeit taking hours to get to that point).  RNG is always a hurdle in tactical games but it feels worse here, especially early, and the grind can be a headache. All that being said, there is something good here if you dig for it. 

Edit: What people have said about the negatives of this game hold true, the writing is often clunky, characters range from archetypes to bland, and the grind is rough... HOWEVER, I have changed my rating to a recommended with extreme caveats: If you really have the time to pour into it, and you don't mind the tonal shifts from silly to "oh, everyone was just assassinated... huh" back to... well... spoons, then there really is something here. The ideas are great but the execution is frustrating, for example:

+Maps are large enough to make it feel like you are exploring and popping an enemy wave in the wrong way can be delightfully punishing.
-Maps are large enough that the devs clearly had a path they wanted you to take through it (and god help you if you don't)

+Easily accessible difficulty settings mean you can play the game at your own pace.
-The only way to enjoy 90% of levels is to play them on hard so you don't steamroll the enemy but if you get crit or an enemy has a trait combo that pins you to a wall and ends you with a stunlock make some maps untenable on hard without some serious over leveling.

+Map replay-ability is enhanced by the addition of a more difficult challenge mode which makes early levels more interesting to replay.
-Map replay-ability means nothing as the loot pool is largely unaffected by challenge mode.

+Some character stories are quirky and feel like they have some depth (Irene)
-Albus (your character) feels like a generic "I fight for my friends" protagonist with the depth of a puddle...in summer...during a drought...on the moon (no atmosphere).

+Game provides story choices
-Game provides only the illusion of choice

+Sound design is bangin!
-Ummm... make up something here about the sound being bad (honestly I can't point to much, the voices and music are great, maybe some sfx xould be tweaked).

+Sooo many systems and synergies
-*Boots up game* (-_-) oh, I have to wait 10-15 hours to get to the first half of them... Oh joy

+The game get infinitely better later
-The game is infinitely worse at the start

+Bugs were not existent during my playthrough, no crashes and didn't turn my computer into molten metal
-The clipping and pop-in got weird at points but it (mostly) fixes itself

-Controllers? What are you? Gaming nobility? We don't tolerate your kind 'round here son

There is so much here to like and even love but almost everything comes with a "but x frustrates the heck outta me"

TLDR:

Game is off-putting and is a slow tread through RNG hell, but it does get a lot right and the ideas are almost strong enough to carry the game on their own
.
Rating: Slimy...yet oddly satisfying / 10
developer_response:
I think the experience that the game we make provides and the experience that you wanted to get from our game went against each other. XCOM is a great game. It actually represents this genre and we've been influenced a lot by this game. I hope more gamers will experience the XCOM series. And for those who are looking for a similar but clearly different experience, the development team will further improve the game so that Troubleshooter can be an alternative.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052979829', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 26915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 25603, 'last_played': 1712456844}
review:
Algumas pessoas resumem dizer que Troubleshooter é uma junção entre XCOM e anime, mas acho que é muito além do que isso. Antes de tudo, preciso dizer que carrego mais de 400 horas de jogo e estou me divertido muito.

Basicamente, TROUBLESHOOTER: Abandoned Children é um jogo de estratégia por turnos. Conforme você vai avançando na história, conhece mais sobre o mundo e os personagens. Sobre isso, há uma grande construção de mundo. Até o final você acompanha a história dos protagonistas, antagonistas e pode fazer missões para NPCs. Há uma sensação bem agradável de visual novel enquanto você segue pela história.
O sistema de jogo é muito divertido também. As batalhas são sólidas e há uma gigante customização fora dela, para você aprender e jogar como quiser.

Eu peguei em uma promoção e considero a minha melhor aquisição da Steam. No momento que escrevo este texto, o grupo de desenvolvimento (Dandylion) está produzindo mais uma DLC (grátis) e continua divulgando informações para os jogadores. Se você está com curiosidade, recomendo muito conhecer este jogo!
developer_response:
No one in the development team knows the Portuguese so I used the Google Translation to understands your review. I ask for your understanding.

We are really happy that you enjoyed the game we prepared and the contents of the game. The beginning of the Troubleshooter is turn-based tactics, but the end will be SRPG. We are lucky to have this strategy in line with your taste.

The development team will continue to expand the world of Troubleshooter through more stories and characters.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070776237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 23602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22912, 'last_played': 1683728502}
review: One of the best XCOM inspired games out there. Sometimes a tad overcomplicated and I definitely would prefer squads of random hires instead of being restricted to storyline characters (i.e. no duplicate builds and can't be permanently killed). Despite that preference I can still wholeheartedly recommend the game to any fan of turn based strategy games.
developer_response:
The whole story is played while explaining the background of the characters. So every character has their own background story. As the game adopts this way, it has a disadvantage that it is difficult to feature random characters. We will make up for these shortcomings by making more diverse characters appear.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007300752', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 5388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5388, 'last_played': 1661041156}
review:
[h1]TROUBLESHOOTER: Abandoned Savegame[/h1]

This is a tough game to review. On the one hand it's one of the best tactical squad based games (aka XCOM) out there with a massive amount of content. On the other hand it's janky, annoying and overstays its welcome. Which is why my review calls this game "Abandoned Savegame" because it's not fun any longer. It was good for a while though, hence the Very Positive review score. Yet I'm not the only one - this game has been out more than 2 years and my last Story Mission - maybe 2/3rd through the game) had only been successfully completed by 11% of buyers per the achievement for completing the mission. So players are jumping off this train long before it ever gets close to its destination.

[h1]TROUBLESHOOTER: The Good[/h1]
TROUBLESHOOTER (TR for short) is a small squad tactics game where you run a squad of crime fighting heroes against various unmemorable enemies. You command squads as large as 8 players through various battlefields with an absolutely huge amount of content. Your crime fighters aren't faceless, as each one has their own story, look, feel and skill set. 

The devs really went for quantity in this game. There are over 700 skills, I currently have 9 characters and all play radically different. One is running around on the map slashing enemies with his sword, another is using machine pistols to mow down multiple enemies, another controls robots and yet another is a close combat specialist who is fire-based. So between the characters and the tremendous amount of skills (a combo of roughly 20 of which will go on any single build), there's never been a tactics game with this kind of build flexibility. 

Content? This game doesn't lack for it. There are dozens and dozens of missions - some story type, some combat, some just to build up your skills, some for quests - and they take place in the city and the countryside. Then there's some way to upgrade equipment, some way to train beasts, there's some massive story going on and probably a dozen other things that I'm not thinking of. You'll understand later why I say "some way" on much of these things.

The graphics are more than adequate and are pretty colorful at times. I'm not a big fan of the anime style in general and this didn't change my mind but it's done okay. There are voices but they're Korean so I can't tell you what they're saying or how the voice acting is. Music is decent and there are enough tracks to keep it from getting too dull, though that combat music has grown stale after the 50th mission or so.

Stability is good and I think it only crashed once. Not bad.

Look, there's a lot I like about this game and I am sincerely deeply amazed that a small dev team put this together and this much content. But Dear Reader, there's a reason you should approach this with caution. There's a reason only 11% of the player base has gotten 2/3rds of the way through the game after 2 years. So before you buy, there are a huge host of issues.

[h1]The Trouble with TROUBLESHOOTER[/h1]
There's a reason I think I'm throwing in the towel. I'm not having fun anymore for various reasons.

(1) The first, and biggest, is that the difficulty curve has spiked upwards in recent missions and the difficulty settings don't do a darned thing. It's not really fun when you play well but an enemy that was previously hidden in the fog of war appears, runs across the map and one shots your characters. And it doesn't matter if the game is Normal or Easy, the same enemy can one shot the same character regardless. To get by this curve, I'm going to have to grind out more levels which brings me to my second negative.

(2) Oh God is this game grindy. The devs took a page right out of the Korean MMO Rulebook and made this game terribly long. Mission after mission after mission with little progress. This game would actually be much better if it were half as long with double the progression. Do a story mission. Then do 2-3 "other" missions to get levels, sometimes repeating those missions. Then get a quest mission (with scant rewards) and grind through some of those other previously-completed missions with the only change that you have to grab things from 6 crates. Oh joy. Then do a story mission....and repeat.

(3) Maybe one of the reasons I'm having difficulty is that I don't understand the systems due to the really poor UI. It's just not intuitive, there's often no help or guide to understand stuff and some systems just don't work for me. I'm SURE there's a way (and dev, if you respond please address these points specifically) for crafting to work. But no matter how many items I salvage (and I salvage almost everything), I can't craft because I'm always missing materials. For instance, every single upgrade that I need requires a "Flawless" material. Except I can't craft it and have never uncovered one. So what's the point of the damned system if you never get the mats to use it? 

Another system that exists but I have no idea how it works is that you can train beasts .Except I have no idea HOW and it's not explained. My character is almost level 50 and I've not seen anything on this, yet I uncovered the vendor who keeps pets about 60 hours of game play ago. 

Yet another example is crafting Masteries (Skills). I can go in the screen and auto do it, but I haven't any idea what the system actually does and why I can craft some but not others. These systems are in the game but they're poorly explained or not at all. And if you ask on the forum, they'll just point you to some huge Guide that lists everything but explains almost nothing.  

It's like that throughout the ENTIRE game. Each character can have 2 different special classes. What does each one do? Unexplained. What is the exact impact of 20 more points of armor? Unexplained. What is the difference between general  Resistance and specific Resistances (like Blunt)? Unexplained. Even after 90 hours in the game I don't understand even fundamental concepts because they're are NOT EXPLAINED.

(4) Finally there's the interminable story that is so poorly translated to English that it's incomprehensible. It involves some cult called "Spoonage" (perhaps the dumbest name for a cult of all time), gangs, some mysterious bad guy, some unknown political leaders and for all I know Space Goats from the Planet Nexos. Each character has a story and they intertwine sometimes but I don't have any idea what's going on. And sometimes characters express emotion like "!!!" in the story line with some weird anime face. I don't know if they're angry, happy or have gas, so I don't have any idea about the relationship between characters. I tried for the first 70 hours to understand this stuff. The last 20 I've only halfway paid attention and frankly there was no difference in comprehension between actively trying to follow the story and not doing so.

[h1]So....Now What?[/h1]
In short, there are a lot of problems with this game and I'm struggling to figure out what the appropriate review score is. I got the game on sale for about $15 and I really enjoyed it for a while. The last 25 hours have been a pretty miserable experience and given that only 11% of the player base has gotten further, it seems that's pretty par for the course that players just give up on the title.

Because it's enjoyable for a while,. I'll give it a thumbs up. But if you go into this expecting to complete it, you probably won't because the systems are unexplained, the game gets terribly grindy and the difficulty curve makes it un-fun after a while (and turning down the difficulty does nothing  since the same enemies one shot you on any level).You'll probably end up like me and 89% of all the buyers - quitting the game and moving on to something else.
developer_response:
" So players are jumping off this train long before it ever gets close to its destination. "

No matter what the development team makes, if no one finds it, it's like nothing. Also, because you told the truth based on Steam's achievements, this sentence suggests that the situation is really bad for the development team.

I think some of the shortcomings you pointed out are subjective factors. However, some of the shortcomings are factors that the development team also recognizes.

The UI of the game is too functional. I'm not saying this is good. The UI is literally the interface between the user and the game system. That's why UI should be user-friendly as well as include features. But if you ask me if Troubleshooter's UI is user friendly, I'll say no, too. The bigger problem is that we cannot easily modify the UI. It's not difficult to put features in and out of the UI, but functionality issues can be felt differently by each individual. This is because there is no guarantee that the changed UI will necessarily be welcomed. I think a lot of research is needed on how to improve this problem.

Another problem is the translation of the game. This is a problem caused by a misjudgment by the development team. The development team is a small, six-member independent game development team with engineers to create games, but there are no specialists in humanities or linguistics. That's what made the game's initial translation low. Many users are willing to share their thoughts for better translation, but the translation still does not meet many people's expectations. Since our native language is not English, the problem will not be solved easily. I just think it's best to incorporate external feedback into the update as soon as possible.

Thank you for spending your precious time writing a special review. The development team will remember your words one by one and produce future updates.

Thank you for this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561199025084729', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 11395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11332, 'last_played': 1666513860}
review:
这是我接触到的第二款战棋游戏（第一款是彼岸花，带我入了战旗游戏的圈子），不得不说，这样的价格就算是原价购入都可以称为性价比之王。
我很喜欢游戏处理加入新的角色的方式，先用剧情混个脸熟，在最初四人组的不断进步之下，前期很强的角色慢慢被追上，在强度差不多了再加入队伍，这样难度区间比较平滑。游戏剧情依然未完结，希望能看见每个角色达成各自的愿望（我挺喜欢小丑团的角色的）。

给新入坑的玩家的建议：
[b] 1. [/b]目前我已经达成目前的217项全部成就，其中没有太难达成的成就，对成就党十分友好，大多数成就都是不知不觉中就以达成，基本没有很煎熬的刷成就的过程。
[b] 2. [/b]本游戏的天赋组合给该游戏带来了极大的游戏深度，不要被前期的“无聊”给劝退，因为前期无论是天赋，装备还是角色间的连携都未成型，宠物，无人机这些也都在偏后的地方，该游戏属于越玩越上头的类型。
[b] 3. [/b]游戏相关的中文攻略较少，天赋一个个试的话太难受，像莱顿这样的角色比较难，自己去探索玩法会比较难。建议去贴吧，加群（贴吧有，我也是玩了50小时忍不住了，加了），里面有很多大佬总结的各种攻略。
[b] 4. [/b]有些地图太大，对局时间太长，可以去设置里选择加速队友和敌人的速度，关闭特写镜头，会缩短一些等待时间，我打过了德拉基巢穴才发现，满屏幕敌人的情况下不加速真的太煎熬。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

" 不要被前期的“无聊”给劝退 "

事实上，我认为这一句话比其他任何一句话都对开始游戏的人都有帮助。我们为了改善游戏初期的无聊感，至今还在进行与此相关的更新，但是因为无法改变故事的大趋势，所以没能做出大的变化。但是在游戏的后半段，为了不让这些缺点反复出现，正在努力。开发组祝愿开始游戏的众多中国玩家阅读您的建议，在射手街与您见面。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198346766066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6123, 'last_played': 1709992993}
review:
总体上是好游戏，但感觉游戏策略性不强，反而更像RPG游戏，角色培养＞战场战术配置，吐槽几个地方：
1.有的关卡设计吐血，2个或3个人要打对面30个40个，正常难度下不回头刷天赋刷等级太难过了。
2.系统过于复杂，天赋+装备+技能，一个人物配个装备天赋花我一个多小时，太耗时间。
3.装备制作很麻烦，做一个装备要解锁N种材料，制作材料又要解锁N个前期材料，菜单界面翻前翻后，费时费力。
PS：剧情挺有意思的，像群像剧，画风也很清新。
developer_response:
( 这篇文章是在翻译机的帮助下写成的。)

我们希望【分争调整者】能成为最后的SRPG 开发组的这种愿望成为将RPG要素添加到游戏中的契机，也许这一点对你来说并不好。

即使【分争调整者】成为SRPG,游戏的战略也是一切的根本。尽管如此，如果你没有感受到战略上的快乐，那就是开发组实力不足的原因。即使时间流逝，开发组也会更加注意更新游戏，以免失去本质的乐趣。

感谢您的评论。

谢谢。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995165142', 'num_games_owned': 1516, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3699, 'last_played': 1661179377}
review:
Atrocious. Terrible. Boring. Incomprehensible. Easy. Off-putting.

These are the first 10 hours of Troubleshooter. Gotta be honest, it was tough. If it wasn't for my buddy swearing that it gets better I'd have given up.

Boy am I glad I didn't. After you survive the beginning you get possibly the best game of its genre with insane amounts of depth and unrealistically dedicated development team.

Don't go into it expecting a nu-xcom-like, the only similarities would be the cover system and existence of guns. This is a tactical JRPG on par with the best of them. It's not perfect, of course, there are some smaller or bigger annoyances here and there, but it's definitely worth your time.

Even after 60 hours, when you think you're nearly done, the game throws new mechanics at you. Go play pokemon with the local wildlife and build yourself a robot
developer_response:
"
Atrocious. Terrible. Boring. Incomprehensible. Easy. Off-putting.

These are the first 10 hours of Troubleshooter. Gotta be honest, it was tough. If it wasn't for my buddy swearing that it gets better I'd have given up.
"

What made you feel bored and tough for 10 hours after coming to experience the game joyfully is the tragedy that the development team's total mistake made. Nevertheless, the development team would like to thank you for enduring all that and enjoying the game until the end. 

The development team is applying a lot of changes to improve the section you found boring. However, we feel a clear limitation because there are not many changes that can be made while maintaining the existing narrative composition. But we're not going to give up because this part determines the first impression of the game.

Thank you for this review.
